original: @38b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @38b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: ma h'a y'a na s'u tra aa lam ka ra t'i ka / bod skad du /
analyzed: ma h'a y'a na s'u tra aa lam ka ra t'i ka / bod skad du /
translated: Mahāyānasūtrālaṃkāraṭīkā🔽In Tibetan:

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde'i rgyan gyi rgya cher bshad pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde'i rgyan gyi rgya cher bshad pa /
translated: The Great Commentary on the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Buddha and all the Bodhisattvas.

original: dkon mchog gsum po yon tan gter gyur pa //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum po yon tan gter gyur pa //
translated: The Three Jewels, who are a treasure of good qualities,🔽The eldest son of Śākyamuni,🔽And the other Bodhisattvas, the sons of the Victorious One,

original: sh'akya thub pa'i sras kyi thu bo dang // rgyal ba'i sras gzhan de dang de dag dang // thogs med zhal @39a * //
analyzed: sh'akya thub pa'i sras kyi thu bo dang // rgyal ba'i sras gzhan de dang de dag dang // thogs med zhal @39a * //
translated: And also Asanga,🔽His younger brother,

original: snga nas dang de'i gcung dang // bla ma gang las bdag gis skye bo la //
analyzed: snga nas dang de'i gcung dang // bla ma gang las bdag gis skye bo la //
translated: And the gurus from whom I have heard

original: gsal zhing snang byed bstan bcos 'di thos te //
analyzed: gsal zhing snang byed bstan bcos 'di thos te //
translated: This treatise that illuminates and clarifies for beings,

original: kun la bdag rtag mgo bos ra gtugs nas //
analyzed: kun la bdag rtag mgo bos ra gtugs nas //
translated: I bow my head to them all, always,

original: zhe sa dang bcas yang dag gus phyag 'tshal //🔽don bsam rnams la blo rtul bstan bcos 'di //
analyzed: zhe sa dang bcas yang dag gus phyag 'tshal // don bsam rnams la blo rtul bstan bcos 'di //
translated: And with respect and devotion I pay homage.🔽I have no intention at all of composing

original: tshig don zab par rnam bsams bshad sbyar dag / bya ba'i bsams pa'ang bdag la 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: tshig don zab par rnam bsams bshad sbyar dag / bya ba'i bsams pa'ang bdag la 'ga' yang med //
translated: A treatise that would be difficult to understand for those who think about the meaning,🔽Or of composing a commentary that would be profound in words and meaning.

original: de ltas rang la phan phyir cung zad bya //
analyzed: de ltas rang la phan phyir cung zad bya //
translated: Therefore, for the sake of my own welfare, I will briefly explain it.

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde'i rgyan gyi lus ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la slob po //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde'i rgyan gyi lus ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la slob po //
translated: The body of the Ornament of Mahayana Sutras is the bodhisattva who, having aroused the mind of awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, trains in the bodhisattva deeds.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are the bodhisattva deeds?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief, the bodhisattva deeds are of three kinds:

original: rnam pa gsum po de gang la slob pa dang / ji ltar slob pa dang / gang dag slob pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po de gang la slob pa dang / ji ltar slob pa dang / gang dag slob pa yin te /
translated: the bases on which one trains, how one trains, and those who train.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas /
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas /
translated: All of those are gathered together

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and called the bodhisattva deeds.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' dag gang la slob ce na /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' dag gang la slob ce na /
translated: Moreover, what do the bodhisattvas train in?

original: gnas bdun la slob po //
analyzed: gnas bdun la slob po //
translated: They train in seven bases.

original: gnas bdun po gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: gnas bdun po gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: What are the seven bases?

original: rang gi don dang / gzhan gyi don dang / de kho na nyid kyi don dang / mthu dang / bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa dang / sems can yongs su smin pa dang / gnas bdun pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: rang gi don dang / gzhan gyi don dang / de kho na nyid kyi don dang / mthu dang / bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa dang / sems can yongs su smin pa dang / gnas bdun pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: the meaning of one's own aim, the meaning of another's aim, the meaning of reality, power, the maturation of one's own Buddha qualities, the maturation of sentient beings, and the seventh stage is supreme enlightenment.

original: rang bzhin don dang de nyid don //
analyzed: rang bzhin don dang de nyid don //
translated: The meaning of nature and the meaning of reality,

original: mthu dang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi //
analyzed: mthu dang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi //
translated: power, one's own Buddha qualities,

original: chos dang sems can yongs smin dang // bdun pa byang chub mchog yin no //🔽byang chub sems dpas gang la bslab par bya ba de ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: chos dang sems can yongs smin dang // bdun pa byang chub mchog yin no // byang chub sems dpas gang la bslab par bya ba de ni bstan zin to //
translated: the maturation of sentient beings, and the seventh stage is supreme enlightenment.🔽What the Bodhisattva should train in has been taught.

original: ji ltar bslab bar bya ba de bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bslab bar bya ba de bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now the way in which he should train will be taught.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa rnams la slob par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpas dang po kho nar theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa mang bar bya ba dang / chos chol ba dang / chos ston pa dang / chos dang mthun pa'i @39b chos sgrub pa dang /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa rnams la slob par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpas dang po kho nar theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa mang bar bya ba dang / chos chol ba dang / chos ston pa dang / chos dang mthun pa'i @39b chos sgrub pa dang /
translated: and he should be one who is intent on teaching the Dharma, intent on practicing the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma,

original: yang dag pa'i gdams ngag rjes su ston pa la gnas pa dang / lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las thabs kyis zin par bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i gdams ngag rjes su ston pa la gnas pa dang / lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las thabs kyis zin par bya ste /
translated: and intent on giving correct instructions and teachings, and he should be one who has taken up physical, verbal, and mental actions that are supported by means.

original: rim pa 'dis gang dag slob pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar de kho na khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa 'dis gang dag slob pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar de kho na khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: By this process, one should understand up to “he trains in those.”

original: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: A bodhisattva who trains in that way will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽The summary:

original: sdom ni / mos pa mang ba nyid dang ni //
analyzed: sdom ni / mos pa mang ba nyid dang ni //
translated: Abundant interest,🔽seeking the Dharma, teaching the Dharma,

original: chos tshol ba dang ston pa dang // de bzhin sgrub dang yang dag pa'i //
analyzed: chos tshol ba dang ston pa dang // de bzhin sgrub dang yang dag pa'i //
translated: and likewise practicing the Dharma,🔽and the correct instructions and teachings.

original: gdams ngag rjes su ston pa dang // lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las //
analyzed: gdams ngag rjes su ston pa dang // lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las //
translated: and the actions of body, speech, and mind

original: thabs kyis zin pa tha ma yin //
analyzed: thabs kyis zin pa tha ma yin //
translated: are the best when they are embraced by means.

original: gang dag slob pa yin zhes bshad pa gang dag cig slob ce na /
analyzed: gang dag slob pa yin zhes bshad pa gang dag cig slob ce na /
translated: Who are the bodhisattvas who are said to be in training?

original: byang chub sems dpa' dag slob po //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dag slob po //
translated: The bodhisattvas are in training.

original: de ltar slob na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' mtshan nyid ji lta bu dag cig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar slob na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' mtshan nyid ji lta bu dag cig yin zhe na /
translated: What are the characteristics of the bodhisattvas who, by training in this way, will fully and completely realize unsurpassed enlightenment?

original: de dag ni mdor bsdu na bcur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ni mdor bsdu na bcur rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, they should be understood as being of ten types:

original: rigs la gnas pa dang / zhugs pa dang / bsam pa ma dag pa dang / bsam pa dag pa dang / bsam pa yongs su ma smin pa dang / bsam pa yongs su smin pa dang / ma nges par rtogs pa dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dang /
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa dang / zhugs pa dang / bsam pa ma dag pa dang / bsam pa dag pa dang / bsam pa yongs su ma smin pa dang / bsam pa yongs su smin pa dang / ma nges par rtogs pa dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dang /
translated: those who are abiding in the spiritual lineage, those who have entered, those whose attitude is impure, those whose attitude is pure, those whose attitude has not matured, those whose attitude has matured, those who are uncertain, those who are not liable to turn back,

original: sred pa tha ma pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa tha ma pa'o //
translated: and those who are in their last existence.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag thams cad kyi ming bye brag med par ni de lta ba'i cha dang mthun pa 'di dag yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag thams cad kyi ming bye brag med par ni de lta ba'i cha dang mthun pa 'di dag yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, all these bodhisattvas are to be known as the “stages conducive to insight” without distinction of name.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' che //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' che //
translated: The bodhisattva, the great being,

original: blo dang ldan pa gsal ba'i mchog / ces bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa gsal ba'i mchog / ces bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: the wise one, the best of the clear-sighted.

original: 'di'i lus ni de yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i lus ni de yin te /
translated: This is their body.

original: de ni phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de ni phyogs yin no //
translated: This is the direction.

original: phyogs des gzhan yang khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs des gzhan yang khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the others by this direction.

original: de la bsdus te bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de la bsdus te bshad pa ni /
translated: Here is the summary explanation:

original: tshigs su bcad pa dang po gsum gyis ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa dang / ji snyed yod pa bstan te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa dang po gsum gyis ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa dang / ji snyed yod pa bstan te /
translated: The first three verses teach the reality of things as they are and the reality of things in their extent.

original: ji lta ba bzhin yod pa'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin yod pa'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the reality of things as they are is:

original: ci zhes bstan pas ston to //
analyzed: ci zhes bstan pas ston to //
translated: What is taught is taught by “what.”

original: ji lta ba zhe na /🔽byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa @40a * //
analyzed: ji lta ba zhe na / byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa @40a * //
translated: What is it?🔽It is the meaning of agent, object,

original: dang / de'i phyir dang / rgyu'i don dang / yan lag gi don dang / ched kyi don te /
analyzed: dang / de'i phyir dang / rgyu'i don dang / yan lag gi don dang / ched kyi don te /
translated: and action, and the meaning of cause, part, and purpose.

original: rnam par dbye ba bdun po 'di dag dang / don shes don ston rab tu byed pa zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /🔽de yi 'gro ba sems can la zhes bya ba'i bar dang / go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba bdun po 'di dag dang / don shes don ston rab tu byed pa zhes bya ba nas bzung ste / de yi 'gro ba sems can la zhes bya ba'i bar dang / go rims bzhin no //
translated: These seven topics, beginning with the object of meditation, are to be understood in the following order:🔽the object of meditation, the person who meditates, the method of meditation, the result of meditation, the classification of meditation, the summary of meditation, and the benefit of meditation.

original: ji snyed yod pa'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ji snyed yod pa'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the extent of meditation is as follows:

original: grangs bstan pas rnam pa ji snyed yod pa'o //
analyzed: grangs bstan pas rnam pa ji snyed yod pa'o //
translated: The extent of meditation is shown by the enumeration of its aspects.

original: de yang rnam pa du zhig ce na /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa du zhig ce na /
translated: How many aspects does it have?

original: rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: It has five aspects.🔽The five aspects of meditation are:

original: 'byor ba'i don tshul bla na med gyur pa //🔽lnga'i bdag nyid ces bya ba 'di nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'byor ba'i don tshul bla na med gyur pa // lnga'i bdag nyid ces bya ba 'di nas bzung ste /
translated: the unsurpassable way of meditation,🔽the way of meditation that is like a diamond,🔽the way of meditation that is like a mountain,

original: gser las brdungs byas pa la sogs pa lta bu dpe lngas bstan pa'i bar yin no //
analyzed: gser las brdungs byas pa la sogs pa lta bu dpe lngas bstan pa'i bar yin no //
translated: the way of meditation that is like a thunderbolt,🔽and the way of meditation that is like a cloud.

original: gzugs brnyan gyi dpes ni don 'di kho na rgyan nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi dpes ni don 'di kho na rgyan nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: The example of a reflection shows that meditation is an ornament.

original: de ltar na bsdus te bshad pa /
analyzed: de ltar na bsdus te bshad pa /
translated: Thus, the summary of meditation is this:

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi don dang ldan pa'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi don dang ldan pa'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa yin la /
translated: It is unerring because it possesses the meaning of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir rgyas pa yang yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir rgyas pa yang yin no //
translated: It is also extensive because it is complete in all aspects.

original: de la grong khyer la sogs pa'i ngag ni yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la grong khyer la sogs pa'i ngag ni yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the speech of the Buddha is endowed with eight qualities, such as being a city.

original: grong khyer ba dang / snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / rnam pa gsal ba dang / rnam par rig par byed pa dang / mnyam par 'os pa dang / brten pa med pa dang / mi mthun pa med pa dang / gtugs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: grong khyer ba dang / snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / rnam pa gsal ba dang / rnam par rig par byed pa dang / mnyam par 'os pa dang / brten pa med pa dang / mi mthun pa med pa dang / gtugs pa med pa'o //
translated: It is a city, melodious, clear, informative, worthy of hearing, independent, without contradiction, and inexhaustible.

original: de la grong khyer pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer gyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la grong khyer pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer gyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a city because it is directed toward the city of nirvāṇa.

original: snyan cing 'jebs pa ni gdangs snyan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyan cing 'jebs pa ni gdangs snyan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is melodious because it is pleasing to the ear.

original: rnam par gsal ba ni nges pa'i tshig dang / yi ge bzang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gsal ba ni nges pa'i tshig dang / yi ge bzang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is clear because it is well-formed in terms of both letters and words.

original: rnam par rig par byed pa ni go bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig par byed pa ni go bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is informative because it is understood.

original: mnyan par 'os pa ni chos kyi don dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyan par 'os pa ni chos kyi don dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is worthy of hearing because it is endowed with the meaning of the Dharma.

original: rten pa med pa ni rab tu dang ba lhag pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten pa med pa ni rab tu dang ba lhag pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of support is the support of the superior faith.

original: mi mthun pa med pa ni mngon par 'dod pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa med pa ni mngon par 'dod pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of opposition is the expression of what is desired.

original: gtugs pa med pa ni rgya chen po la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtugs pa med pa ni rgya chen po la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of limitation is the skill in the great.

original: rnam pa brgyad dang ldan pa'i ngag 'di ni mdor bsdu na yon tan gsum dang ldan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad dang ldan pa'i ngag 'di ni mdor bsdu na yon tan gsum dang ldan par rig par bya ste /
translated: This speech endowed with eight aspects should be known in brief as endowed with three qualities:

original: dbang du bya ba'i sgo nas ni rnam pa dang po gcig gis so //
analyzed: dbang du bya ba'i sgo nas ni rnam pa dang po gcig gis so //
translated: By way of mastery, by the first aspect.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas ni rnam pa gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas ni rnam pa gnyis kyis so //
translated: By way of nature, by the second aspect.

original: sbyor ba'i sgo @40b nas ni rnam pa lhag ma rnams kyis so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sgo @40b nas ni rnam pa lhag ma rnams kyis so //
translated: By way of application, by the remaining aspects.

original: tshig dri ma med pas zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ge rigs pa dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ge rigs pa zhes bya ba nas 'grus skyong gi yan lag gi tshogs zhes bya ba'i bar yin te /
analyzed: tshig dri ma med pas zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ge rigs pa dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ge rigs pa zhes bya ba nas 'grus skyong gi yan lag gi tshogs zhes bya ba'i bar yin te /
translated: The phrase “with stainless words” refers to the “words and syllables that are appropriate.” The phrase “with a collection of limbs that are well-ordered” refers to the “words and syllables that are well-ordered.”

original: tshig dang yi ge rigs pa dang / 'brel pa dang / mthun pa dang / rung ba dang / 'byor ba dang / 'phrod pa dang / 'tsham pa dang / 'grus skyong gi yan lag gi tshogs so //
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge rigs pa dang / 'brel pa dang / mthun pa dang / rung ba dang / 'byor ba dang / 'phrod pa dang / 'tsham pa dang / 'grus skyong gi yan lag gi tshogs so //
translated: It is well-spoken in terms of letters, words, and phrases; it is connected, appropriate, suitable, coherent, consistent, and fitting.

original: de la rigs pa ni ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams go rims su legs par bkod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rigs pa ni ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams go rims su legs par bkod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is well-spoken in terms of letters, words, and phrases because it is well-arranged in terms of letters, words, and phrases.

original: yang rigs pa rnam pa bzhi la brten pa'i phyir rigs pa yin no //🔽'brel pa ni sgrub pa dang 'byor ba'o //
analyzed: yang rigs pa rnam pa bzhi la brten pa'i phyir rigs pa yin no // 'brel pa ni sgrub pa dang 'byor ba'o //
translated: It is well-spoken because it is based on four kinds of reasonings.🔽It is connected because it is connected with the means of accomplishment.

original: mthun pa ni rnam par bshad pa dang 'byor ba'o //
analyzed: mthun pa ni rnam par bshad pa dang 'byor ba'o //
translated: It is appropriate because it is connected with the means of explanation.

original: rung ba ni tshig dang yi ge gsal ba'o //
analyzed: rung ba ni tshig dang yi ge gsal ba'o //
translated: It is suitable because the words and letters are clear.

original: 'byor ba ni snying la 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byor ba ni snying la 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is coherent because it is pleasing to the mind.

original: 'phrod pa ni 'khor ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: 'phrod pa ni 'khor ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
translated: It is consistent because it is appropriate for the retinue.

original: 'tsham pa ni chos dang mthun pa dang / don dang ldan pa dang / dus dang 'tsham pa yin no //
analyzed: 'tsham pa ni chos dang mthun pa dang / don dang ldan pa dang / dus dang 'tsham pa yin no //
translated: It is fitting because it is in accord with the Dharma, it has meaning, and it is timely.

original: 'grus skyong gi yan lag gi tshogs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'grus skyong gi yan lag gi tshogs zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is a collection of the branches of eloquence.

original: 'grus skyong zhes bya ba ni mkhas par byed pa dang / rtag tu byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'grus skyong zhes bya ba ni mkhas par byed pa dang / rtag tu byed pa ste /
translated: The term “cultivation” refers to the practice of the wise and the constant practice.

original: de'i yan lag ni yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i yan lag ni yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Its branches are right view and so on.

original: gser las brdungs byas zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni dpe lngas theg pa chen po'i chos de don rnam pa lnga'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gser las brdungs byas zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni dpe lngas theg pa chen po'i chos de don rnam pa lnga'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa yin te /
translated: This verse with the line “like gold refined by the fire” shows that the Dharma of the Great Vehicle is taught in terms of five topics.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang / bye brag tu shes par bya ba dang / bsam par bya ba dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / yongs su grub pa rtogs pa'i don so so rang gis rig par bya ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang / bye brag tu shes par bya ba dang / bsam par bya ba dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / yongs su grub pa rtogs pa'i don so so rang gis rig par bya ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The five topics are the object of accomplishment, the object of special knowledge, the object of reflection, the inconceivable object, and the object of realization of the perfected nature, which is to be personally experienced.

original: 'di ni theg pa chen po dngos po lnga po dang / ngo bo nyid gsum dang / gang zag rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni theg pa chen po dngos po lnga po dang / ngo bo nyid gsum dang / gang zag rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: The Great Vehicle is the five topics, the three natures, and the presentation of the person.

original: rnam pa gsum gyis 'grel to //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gyis 'grel to //
translated: It is explained in three ways.

original: de la dngos po lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dngos po lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five topics?

original: ming dang / rgyu mtshan dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ming dang / rgyu mtshan dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: name, reason, conceptualization, suchness, and nonconceptual exalted wisdom.

original: de la ming ni brdar tha snyad gdags dpa mngon par brjod pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: de la ming ni brdar tha snyad gdags dpa mngon par brjod pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: Name is the nature of verbalization, which is the designation of a conventional symbol.

original: de yang 'jig rten ni @41a * //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten ni @41a * //
translated: Moreover, the world

original: chos 'di dag ji ltar ming gis mngon par brjod pa de kho na bzhin du ngo bo nyid du yod do zhes ming gi sgo nas chos thams cad la mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ji ltar ming gis mngon par brjod pa de kho na bzhin du ngo bo nyid du yod do zhes ming gi sgo nas chos thams cad la mngon par zhen to //
translated: is attached to all phenomena through names, thinking that these phenomena exist as entities just as they are verbally expressed.

original: ming gis mngon par brjod pa gang yin pa de ni med de /
analyzed: ming gis mngon par brjod pa gang yin pa de ni med de /
translated: That which is verbally expressed by names does not exist.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du ;
translated: As the Bhagavān said:

original: ming ni gang dang gang dag gis //
analyzed: ming ni gang dang gang dag gis //
translated: Whatever names there are

original: chos ni gang dang gang brjod pa //
analyzed: chos ni gang dang gang brjod pa //
translated: for whatever phenomena are expressed,

original: de ni de la yod min de //
analyzed: de ni de la yod min de //
translated: they do not exist in that way.

original: 'di ni chos rnams chos nyid yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos rnams chos nyid yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is the reality of phenomena.

original: ming gi sgo nas chos rnams la ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa de dag la ming gis mngon par brjod pa gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyis med do zhes bya ba 'di shes par bya dka' ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba yin no
analyzed: ming gi sgo nas chos rnams la ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa de dag la ming gis mngon par brjod pa gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyis med do zhes bya ba 'di shes par bya dka' ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba yin no
translated: For those who conceive of phenomena as having an essence by way of names, it is difficult to understand that what is expressed by names does not exist by virtue of an essence, so this is what is to be proven.

original: // de dang chos mthun par gser las brdungs byas pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: // de dang chos mthun par gser las brdungs byas pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: It is similar to gold that is worked by a goldsmith.

original: dper na bsreg pa dang / chus gdab pa dang / brdung ba la sogs pa 'bad pa chen pos gser las su rung par byas pa rgyan la sogs par brdungs na rnam par mdzes pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po 'di yang ming gis ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa rnams la ming gis mngon par
analyzed: dper na bsreg pa dang / chus gdab pa dang / brdung ba la sogs pa 'bad pa chen pos gser las su rung par byas pa rgyan la sogs par brdungs na rnam par mdzes pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po 'di yang ming gis ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa rnams la ming gis mngon par
translated: For example, gold that is made workable by great effort through heating, cutting and rubbing is very beautiful when worked into ornaments and so on.

original: brjod pa gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid med do zhes rang gi phyogs sgrub pa dang / gzhan gyi phyogs sun dbyung ba la sogs pas bsgrubs na gsar las brdungs su byas pa bzhin dga' ba'i mchog skyed pas sgrub pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: brjod pa gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid med do zhes rang gi phyogs sgrub pa dang / gzhan gyi phyogs sun dbyung ba la sogs pas bsgrubs na gsar las brdungs su byas pa bzhin dga' ba'i mchog skyed pas sgrub pa zhes bshad do //
translated: The expression is the absence of intrinsic reality. When one establishes this by refuting the position of others and establishing one's own position, it generates the highest joy, like a newly minted ornament, and so it is called establishment.

original: rgyu mtshan ni gang la rten nas mi 'jug pa ste /🔽mngon par brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi ming de nyid kyi rten gyi dngos po gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gzung ba'i cha yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni gang la rten nas mi 'jug pa ste / mngon par brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi ming de nyid kyi rten gyi dngos po gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gzung ba'i cha yin no //
translated: The reason is that which one does not engage in dependence on anything else.🔽 The dependent nature, the basis of that very name that is the nature of expression, is the aspect of the apprehended.

original: dngos po de yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba snang ba tsam gyi rang rig pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po de yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba snang ba tsam gyi rang rig pa yin te /
translated: That entity is dependent origination, mere appearance, and self-awareness.

original: de ni bye brag tu shes par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: de ni bye brag tu shes par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: It is merely an object of specific knowledge.

original: rang rig pa de la ni 'jig rten mtshar cig log par rtogs pa med pas bye brag tu shes par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: rang rig pa de la ni 'jig rten mtshar cig log par rtogs pa med pas bye brag tu shes par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: Since there is no mistaken understanding of self-awareness in the world, it is merely an object of specific knowledge.

original: de dang chos mthun par dpe padma ste /
analyzed: de dang chos mthun par dpe padma ste /
translated: The example that is similar to that is a lotus.

original: dper na 'bad pa med par nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis kha bye ba'i padma dga' ba'i mchog bskyed pa de bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i dngos po 'bad pa med par shes par byas pa yang dga' ba'i mchog skyed pas bye brag tu shes @41b par
analyzed: dper na 'bad pa med par nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis kha bye ba'i padma dga' ba'i mchog bskyed pa de bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i dngos po 'bad pa med par shes par byas pa yang dga' ba'i mchog skyed pas bye brag tu shes @41b par
translated: For example, just as the supreme joy is produced by the sun's rays opening the lotus without effort, so too, the supreme joy is produced by the understanding of the reality of dependent origination without effort.

original: bya ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bya ba zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained as the object to be understood.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dngos po tsam de nyid sems dang sems pas byung ba 'dzin pa'i char rab tu skye ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dngos po tsam de nyid sems dang sems pas byung ba 'dzin pa'i char rab tu skye ba yin te /
translated: Discernment is the arising of conceptual thought in the form of apprehending that very mere thing of dependent origination, along with the mind and mental factors.

original: tshul bzhin du rnam par rtog pa dam pa'i chos nyan pa'i rgyu las byung ba bdag gis bsam par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du rnam par rtog pa dam pa'i chos nyan pa'i rgyu las byung ba bdag gis bsam par bya ba yin no //
translated: It is to be contemplated by oneself, arising from the cause of listening to the true Dharma, which is proper discernment.

original: ji skad du chos mngon pa kun las btus pa las chos la rab tu brtson pa chos rnams dpyod par byed pa na /
analyzed: ji skad du chos mngon pa kun las btus pa las chos la rab tu brtson pa chos rnams dpyod par byed pa na /
translated: As it is said in the Abhidharma-samuccaya: When one who is diligent in the Dharma analyzes the dharmas,

original: rigs pa du zhig gis dpyod par byed ce na /
analyzed: rigs pa du zhig gis dpyod par byed ce na /
translated: by how many principles does one analyze?

original: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa ste /
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa ste /
translated: the principle of dependence, the principle of efficacy, the principle of logical possibility, and the principle of reality.🔽

original: rigs pa bzhis so //
analyzed: rigs pa bzhis so //
translated: The four principles are the principle of dependence, the principle of efficacy, the principle of logical possibility, and the principle of reality.

original: rigs pa 'di bzhis tshul bzhin du rnam par brtags na kun nas nyon mongs pa spong ba dang / rnam par byang ba dang / mthun par yang 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rigs pa 'di bzhis tshul bzhin du rnam par brtags na kun nas nyon mongs pa spong ba dang / rnam par byang ba dang / mthun par yang 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: When one properly analyzes with these four principles, one will come to agree with the abandonment of the afflictions and the purification of afflictions.

original: de dang chos mthun par dpe g-yos legs pa'i kha zas te /
analyzed: de dang chos mthun par dpe g-yos legs pa'i kha zas te /
translated: The example that is similar to that is well-prepared food.

original: dper na g-yos legs pa'i kha zas kha dog dang ro la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa bkres pas nyen pa rnams kyis zos na dga' ba'i mchog bskyed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na g-yos legs pa'i kha zas kha dog dang ro la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa bkres pas nyen pa rnams kyis zos na dga' ba'i mchog bskyed pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, when those who are afflicted by hunger eat well-prepared food that is perfect in color, taste, and so on, it generates supreme joy.

original: theg pa chen po'i chos bdud rtsi dang 'dra ba 'di yang dam pa'i chos nyan pas bkres pa tshul bzhin du rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis dpyad na dga' ba'i mchog skyed pas bsam par bya ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos bdud rtsi dang 'dra ba 'di yang dam pa'i chos nyan pas bkres pa tshul bzhin du rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis dpyad na dga' ba'i mchog skyed pas bsam par bya ba zhes bshad do //
translated: This Mahāyāna Dharma, which is like nectar, is to be contemplated, like food, when one analyzes it with the correct view.

original: de bzhin nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
translated: Thusness is inconceivable,

original: bsam pa'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir dang so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir dang so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is beyond the domain of thought and is to be realized personally.

original: ji skad du theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
translated: As the Mahāyāna-saṃgraha explains:

original: chos kyi sku ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: The dharmakāya has the characteristic of being inconceivable.

original: de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa de 'jig rten na dpe med pa dang / rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pas so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa de 'jig rten na dpe med pa dang / rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pas so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that pure thusness is without example in the world and is the domain of personal realization, it is not the domain of sophistry.

original: de dang chos mthun par dpe phrin yig ste /
analyzed: de dang chos mthun par dpe phrin yig ste /
translated: A letter is an example that is similar to that.

original: dper na phrin yig legs par mkhas pa rnams kyi lag tu son na don log pa'i rnam par rtogs pa spangs pa'i sgo nas mchog tu dga' ba skyed pa de bzhin du /🔽de bzhin nyid so so @42a * //🔽rang gis rig par bya ba rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa yang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sa dang po thob pa'i dus nas bzung ste /
analyzed: dper na phrin yig legs par mkhas pa rnams kyi lag tu son na don log pa'i rnam par rtogs pa spangs pa'i sgo nas mchog tu dga' ba skyed pa de bzhin du / de bzhin nyid so so @42a * // rang gis rig par bya ba rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa yang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sa dang po thob pa'i dus nas bzung ste /
translated: For example, when a letter arrives in the hands of those who are skilled in reading it, they avoid the misconception of a wrong meaning and give rise to supreme joy.

original: dga' ba zag pa med pa dpe med pa skyed par byed de /
analyzed: dga' ba zag pa med pa dpe med pa skyed par byed de /
translated: Similarly, suchness, which is to be personally experienced and is utterly beyond the domain of sophistry, gives rise to the uncontaminated, incomparable joy of the buddhas and bodhisattvas from the time they attain the first ground.

original: byis pa de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa rnams kyi bsam pa'i yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes pa bshad do //
analyzed: byis pa de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa rnams kyi bsam pa'i yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes pa bshad do //
translated: It is explained that it is inconceivable because it is utterly beyond the domain of thought of those who are childish and have not realized suchness.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i ngo bo ni yongs su grub pa rtogs pa'i don so so rang gis rig par bya ba byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i ngo bo ni yongs su grub pa rtogs pa'i don so so rang gis rig par bya ba byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: The essence of the nonconceptual intuition that is the factor of enlightenment is the reality of the perfected, which is the object of individual intuitive knowledge.

original: yang ci'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dra ba las /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dra ba las /
translated: Why, in the identity of the perfected nature,

original: de bzhin nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab par bshad la /🔽rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la sogs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab par bshad la / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la sogs pa /
translated: is suchness declared to be inconceivable,🔽but the factors of enlightenment, such as the nonconceptual intuition,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: are not?

original: de ni de ltar bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni de ltar bden mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: de bzhin nyid ni nam yang de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa rnams kyis rang gis rig par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni nam yang de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa rnams kyis rang gis rig par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: suchness is never to be intuitively realized by those who do not understand reality.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid dag ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid dag ste /
translated: The factors of enlightenment are the essence of mind and mental activities.

original: zag pa med pa de dag de kho na nyid rtogs pa rnams kyi so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: zag pa med pa de dag de kho na nyid rtogs pa rnams kyi so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin mod kyi /
translated: Although those uncontaminated dharmas are to be personally experienced by those who realize reality,

original: de yang thos pa dang bsam pa'i gnas skabs na de kho na nyid ma rtogs kyang chos kyi sku'i rgyu mthun pa theg pa chen po'i dam pa'i chos mnyam pas tshul bzhin rab tu sbyor ba rnams kyis so so rang gis rig par bya ba dang mthun par
analyzed: de yang thos pa dang bsam pa'i gnas skabs na de kho na nyid ma rtogs kyang chos kyi sku'i rgyu mthun pa theg pa chen po'i dam pa'i chos mnyam pas tshul bzhin rab tu sbyor ba rnams kyis so so rang gis rig par bya ba dang mthun par
translated: even though reality is not realized at the stage of hearing and reflection, they are properly applied by those who are properly engaged in the Mahāyāna, the excellent Dharma that is the natural outflow of the dharmakāya.

original: 'gyur ro // ji skad du theg pa chen po bsdus pa las yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du ji lta bu yin par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // ji skad du theg pa chen po bsdus pa las yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du ji lta bu yin par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: As the Mahāyāna Compendium states, “How should one know the nature of the fully present reality?

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnam pa bzhi pa bstan pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnam pa bzhi pa bstan pas rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be known through the teaching of the four aspects of purification.

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnam pa bzhi bstan pa la rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba ni de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnam pa bzhi bstan pa la rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba ni de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the teaching of the four aspects of purification, natural purification is suchness and so forth.

original: dri ma dang bral bas rnam par byang ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dri ma dang bral bas rnam par byang ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Purification through freedom from stains is as follows.

original: de nyid sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is free from all obscurations.

original: de 'thob pa'i lam gyis rnam par byang ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thams cad do //
analyzed: de 'thob pa'i lam gyis rnam par byang ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thams cad do //
translated: The purification by the path that attains it is all the factors of enlightenment.

original: @42b de skye ba'i dmigs pa ni rnam par byang ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: @42b de skye ba'i dmigs pa ni rnam par byang ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The object of its arising is purification,

original: theg pa chen po'i dam pa'i chos bstan pa'o zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i dam pa'i chos bstan pa'o zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: as it is said, “the teaching of the true Dharma of the Great Vehicle.”

original: 'di ltar de ni rnam par byang ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni rnam par byang ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, it is the sign of purification.

original: kun brtags pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: kun brtags pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not the imagined,

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: but because it is the natural outflow of the extremely pure dharmadhatu,

original: gzhan gyi dbang yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang yang ma yin no //
translated: it is not the dependent.

original: de'i phyir thos pa dang bsam pa'i gnas skabs na byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa zag pa med pa dang / mthun pas zag pa med pa bzhin nye bar gdags te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thos pa dang bsam pa'i gnas skabs na byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa zag pa med pa dang / mthun pas zag pa med pa bzhin nye bar gdags te /
translated: Therefore, in the state of hearing and reflection, the factors of enlightenment are designated as uncontaminated, like the uncontaminated factors of enlightenment,

original: 'di ni khyad par yin par mngon no //
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par yin par mngon no //
translated: and this is clearly the difference.

original: de ltar re zhig theg pa chen po dngos po lnga dang chos mthun par bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po lnga gser las brdungs byas pa la sogs pa'i dpe lnga dang bcas te bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig theg pa chen po dngos po lnga dang chos mthun par bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po lnga gser las brdungs byas pa la sogs pa'i dpe lnga dang bcas te bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the five things to be accomplished, such as the Great Vehicle, are explained along with the five examples, such as beaten gold, in terms of the five things.

original: rnam pa gcig tu ngo bo nyid gsum du bshad do //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu ngo bo nyid gsum du bshad do //
translated: In one way, they are explained in terms of the three natures.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: re zhig bsgrub par bya ba zhes smos pa gang yin pa de'i bshad pa ni ji skad du theg pa chen po bsdus pa las sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis theg pa chen po shin tu rgyas pa bstan pa gang yin pa'i bstan pa de la kun
analyzed: re zhig bsgrub par bya ba zhes smos pa gang yin pa de'i bshad pa ni ji skad du theg pa chen po bsdus pa las sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis theg pa chen po shin tu rgyas pa bstan pa gang yin pa'i bstan pa de la kun

analyzed: rigs kyi bu ni slu ba gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa yin no //

analyzed: gsol @43b pa ;

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mi slu ba zhes bgyi pa 'di ci lags /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyi gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid ces bgyi ba de ci lags /
translated: He said: “Blessed One, what is this ‘suchness’?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos 'di ni so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: “Son of noble family, this Dharma is to be realized by each one for themselves.

analyzed: chos 'di yi ge dag gis gdags par ni mi nus so //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: chos 'di ni yi ge thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
translated: This Dharma is beyond all letters.

original: chos 'di ni mngon par brjod pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa ste /
analyzed: chos 'di ni mngon par brjod pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa ste /
translated: This Dharma is beyond all expressions,

analyzed: ngag gi spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa / rang gi lam thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa / spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: beyond the domain of speech,🔽beyond all paths,🔽free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: rtog ge thams cad dang bral pa ste /
analyzed: rtog ge thams cad dang bral pa ste /

original: brtag par bya ba ma yin pa /🔽rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa /
analyzed: brtag par bya ba ma yin pa / rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa /

analyzed: rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'o // byis pa'i yul las yang dag par 'das pa ste /
translated: beyond the domain of speculation.🔽It is beyond the domain of the childish,

original: byis pa'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
translated: beyond the domain of the childish activities.

original: rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa ste /

analyzed: chos kyi dbyings bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //

translated: Thus, this phenomenon called “suchness” is called “inconceivable” by the childish because it is beyond all the domains of conceptualization, speculation, and consciousness. The analogy of the letter should be understood in the same way as the previous analogy.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid so so rang gis rig par bya ba rtogs pa'i don de dang chos mthun par dpe rin po che'i sgrom ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid so so rang gis rig par bya ba rtogs pa'i don de dang chos mthun par dpe rin po che'i sgrom ste /
translated: The analogy of the jewel chest is similar to the meaning of the realization of the nonconceptual wisdom that is the essence of the factors of awakening, which is to be realized individually by oneself.

original: dper na rin po che'i sgrom kha gab ba phye na dga' ba'i mchog bskyed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rin po che'i sgrom kha gab ba phye na dga' ba'i mchog bskyed pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, when the lid of a jewel chest is opened, it produces the highest joy.

original: 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' de kho na nyid kyi don rtogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa rnam par mi rtog pa la sogs pas rgyud gsal bar byas pa rnams la @44a * //
analyzed: 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' de kho na nyid kyi don rtogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa rnam par mi rtog pa la sogs pas rgyud gsal bar byas pa rnams la @44a * //
translated: This is also the great joy of the bodhisattva who has realized the meaning of reality, since his stream of consciousness is clarified by the factors of enlightenment, such as the absence of discrimination, etc.

original: dga' ba chen po bskyed pas yongs su grub pa rtogs pa'i don so so rang gis rig par byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: dga' ba chen po bskyed pas yongs su grub pa rtogs pa'i don so so rang gis rig par byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid du bshad do //
translated: It is explained as the nature of the factors of enlightenment, which is the realization of the meaning of the perfected nature, which is the individual intuitive knowledge.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum du bshad pa ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum du bshad pa ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the three natures.

original: de nas gang zag rnam par gzhag pas bshad pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de nas gang zag rnam par gzhag pas bshad pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Now, what is the explanation of the person in terms of the establishment of the person?

original: 'di na gang zag rnam pa gsum zhig snang ste /
analyzed: 'di na gang zag rnam pa gsum zhig snang ste /
translated: Here, three kinds of persons are seen:

original: mi shes pa dang / the tshom can dang / log par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: mi shes pa dang / the tshom can dang / log par shes pa rnams so //
translated: the ignorant, the doubtful, and the wrongly knowing.

original: de la log par 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa rnams dang the tshom can rnams la ni log par 'dzin pa dang the tshom bsal ba'i phyir 'di kho na theg pa chen po yin gyi /
analyzed: de la log par 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa rnams dang the tshom can rnams la ni log par 'dzin pa dang the tshom bsal ba'i phyir 'di kho na theg pa chen po yin gyi /
translated: For those who are attached to wrong graspings and those who are doubtful, in order to remove their wrong graspings and doubts, one should establish them in the Dharma of the Mahayana, saying, “This alone is the Mahayana,

original: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes theg pa chen po'i chos bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes theg pa chen po'i chos bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: not the other.”

original: de dang chos mthun par dpe gser te /
analyzed: de dang chos mthun par dpe gser te /
translated: The example of gold is similar to that,

original: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: as should be understood from the previous.

original: mi shes pa rnams la ni bye brag tu shes par bya ba yin bas de dang chos mthun par dpe padma ste snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa rnams la ni bye brag tu shes par bya ba yin bas de dang chos mthun par dpe padma ste snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The example of the lotus is similar to that, in order to make known the distinctions to the ignorant, as should be understood from the previous.

original: de ltar zhugs pa'i gang zag de dag nyid kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas rnams spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhugs pa'i gang zag de dag nyid kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas rnams spang bar bya ste /
translated: Those persons who have thus entered should abandon the inconceivable abodes.

original: ji skad du sangs rgyas kyi bya ba sgrub pa'i phrin las bsam gyis mi khyab po //
analyzed: ji skad du sangs rgyas kyi bya ba sgrub pa'i phrin las bsam gyis mi khyab po //
translated: As it is said, “The activity of accomplishing the Buddha’s deeds is inconceivable.”

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po thams cad sna tshogs mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i las bsam gyis mi khyab po //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po thams cad sna tshogs mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i las bsam gyis mi khyab po //
translated: The inconceivable karma that produces all external things,🔽the inconceivable karma that is endowed with the application of jewels,

original: nor bu dang / sman dang / mkhyud dpyad kyi sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i las bsam gyis mi khyab po zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: nor bu dang / sman dang / mkhyud dpyad kyi sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i las bsam gyis mi khyab po zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: medicines, and spells.

original: de la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas rnams la sems na sems bslad pa'i gnas dag tu 'gyur bas bsam gyis mi khyab par bshad do //
analyzed: de la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas rnams la sems na sems bslad pa'i gnas dag tu 'gyur bas bsam gyis mi khyab par bshad do //
translated: Since the mind is disturbed when it is applied to such inconceivable things, they are explained as inconceivable.

original: de'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, in order to abandon the inconceivable,🔽great joy arises from reflecting on the object of reflection,

original: bsam par bya ba'i gnas sems pa'i phyir dga' ba chen po skye bas dpe phrin yig dang kha zas te /
analyzed: bsam par bya ba'i gnas sems pa'i phyir dga' ba chen po skye bas dpe phrin yig dang kha zas te /
translated: like a letter or food.

original: snga ma dang mthun par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma dang mthun par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood in accordance with the previous example.

original: gang zag de dag nyid tshul bzhin du rab tu sbyor na yongs su grub pa rtogs pa'i don so so rang gis rig par byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag de dag nyid tshul bzhin du rab tu sbyor na yongs su grub pa rtogs pa'i don so so rang gis rig par byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If those persons apply themselves properly, they will realize the reality of the perfected nature, which is the object of individual self-knowledge, and they will realize the nature of the elements that are conducive to enlightenment.

original: de dang chos mthun par dpe rin po che'i sgrom @44b ste ;🔽dper na rin po che'i sgrom kha gab phye ste /
analyzed: de dang chos mthun par dpe rin po che'i sgrom @44b ste ; dper na rin po che'i sgrom kha gab phye ste /
translated: The analogy for that is a chest of jewels.

original: rin po che dag snang na dga' ba bskyed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rin po che dag snang na dga' ba bskyed pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, when a chest of jewels is opened and the jewels are seen, joy is produced.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams kyis theg pa chen po'i chos sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba'i chos nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnas lta bu gang dag yin pa de dag bsal bas dga' ba chen po yang skye la /🔽rgyud kyang gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams kyis theg pa chen po'i chos sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba'i chos nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnas lta bu gang dag yin pa de dag bsal bas dga' ba chen po yang skye la /🔽rgyud kyang gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, when the elements that are conducive to enlightenment clear away the afflictions and the obscurations to the objects of knowledge, which are like the obscurations to the jewels, great joy is produced and the continuum is also clarified.

original: de'i phyir don lnga pa yongs su grub pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi ngo bo nyid so so rang gis rig par bya ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir don lnga pa yongs su grub pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi ngo bo nyid so so rang gis rig par bya ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the fifth object, the perfected, is called the nature of the factors of enlightenment, which is to be personally experienced.

original: de ni gang zag rnam par gzhag pas bshad pa yin no //🔽theg pa chen po las ni gdul ba'i skye bo la ltos te /
analyzed: de ni gang zag rnam par gzhag pas bshad pa yin no // theg pa chen po las ni gdul ba'i skye bo la ltos te /
translated: This is the explanation in terms of the classification of persons.

original: bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa'i don gyi khyad par de dag tsam zhig ston te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa'i don gyi khyad par de dag tsam zhig ston te /
translated: In the Mahayana, those objects such as the established, etc., are taught in the scriptures in terms of the disciples,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs pa'i don ni sgrub par byed do ;
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs pa'i don ni sgrub par byed do ;
translated: and the meaning of realitylessness, etc., is established.

original: / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid du bsdus pa sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin dang ni bye brag tu shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid du bsdus pa sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin dang ni bye brag tu shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: The nature of mind and mental functions, which is included in the relative reality, is to be specifically known.

original: de dag nyid mi dge ba'i chos yongs su spangs pa dang / dge ba'i chos sgom pas bsam par bya ba yin pas na bsam par bya ba dag tu bstan to //
analyzed: de dag nyid mi dge ba'i chos yongs su spangs pa dang / dge ba'i chos sgom pas bsam par bya ba yin pas na bsam par bya ba dag tu bstan to //
translated: Those very mind and mental functions are to be reflected upon by abandoning nonvirtuous phenomena and cultivating virtuous phenomena, and thus they are taught as objects of reflection.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bya ba bsgrub pa dang / phyi rol gyi dngos bo sna tshogs mngon par 'grub par byed pa dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas su gyur ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bya ba bsgrub pa dang / phyi rol gyi dngos bo sna tshogs mngon par 'grub par byed pa dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas su gyur ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bshad do //
translated: The accomplishment of the Buddha's activities and the accomplishment of the various external things are called inconceivable because they are inconceivable abhūta.

original: yongs su grub pa rtogs pa'i don so so rang gis rig par bya ba byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams yin te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa rtogs pa'i don so so rang gis rig par bya ba byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams yin te /
translated: The realization of the perfected nature is the object of individual self-awareness, which is the factors conducive to enlightenment.

original: mdo sde'i rgyan 'dis rnam par bkrol lo //
analyzed: mdo sde'i rgyan 'dis rnam par bkrol lo //
translated: This is the explanation of the Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras.

original: chos lnga po 'di dag gis ni chos thams cad yang dag par bsdus par bstan la /
analyzed: chos lnga po 'di dag gis ni chos thams cad yang dag par bsdus par bstan la /
translated: These five topics show that all phenomena are subsumed.

original: 'di dag yang dag par rnam par bkrol bas gser la sogs pa dang chos mthun par mkhas pa rnams dga' ba bskyed de /
analyzed: 'di dag yang dag par rnam par bkrol bas gser la sogs pa dang chos mthun par mkhas pa rnams dga' ba bskyed de /
translated: And by explaining them correctly, the wise generate joy in them through their similarity to gold and so on.

original: de ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: This is the summarized meaning.

original: don shes pa don ston par ni chos de brgyan par byed kyi /
analyzed: don shes pa don ston par ni chos de brgyan par byed kyi /
translated: Those who know the meaning teach the meaning and ornament that Dharma.

original: gzhan gdu bu dang dpung rgyan la sogs pas ma yin pas de'i phyir phyogs snga ma gang gi tshe chos de rang bzhin gyis yon tan @45a * //
analyzed: gzhan gdu bu dang dpung rgyan la sogs pas ma yin pas de'i phyir phyogs snga ma gang gi tshe chos de rang bzhin gyis yon tan @45a * //
translated: Since it is not the case that it is bound by bracelets, armlets, and so on, therefore, when the opponent says that phenomena are essentially unproduced,🔽

original: dang ldan pa yin na /
analyzed: dang ldan pa yin na /
translated: Since it is not the case that it is adorned by other things such as bracelets and armlets, therefore, the opponent asks, “When that phenomenon is endowed with intrinsic virtue,

original: ji ltar de brgyan par byed ces bya ba gleng bar byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar de brgyan par byed ces bya ba gleng bar byed do //
translated: how can it be adorned?”

original: de yongs su spang ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom par byed de /
analyzed: de yongs su spang ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom par byed de /
translated: In order to completely abandon that, the verse is composed:

original: gzugs rgyan ces bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar gdong gi gzugs bzang po brgyan pa me long gi nang du song na /
analyzed: gzugs rgyan ces bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar gdong gi gzugs bzang po brgyan pa me long gi nang du song na /
translated: “Form is not an ornament” and so on. Just as the beautiful form of a face, when adorned, enters a mirror

original: shin tu dga' ba bskyed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: shin tu dga' ba bskyed pa de bzhin du /
translated: and generates great delight,

original: theg pa chen po'i chos kyi gzugs sa dang phrul tu phyin pa la sogs pa thun mong ma yin pa bstan pa rang bzhin gyis yon tan dang ldan pa 'di yang don bstan pa'i me long shin tu dri ma med pa'i nang du snang na dga' ba skyed
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos kyi gzugs sa dang phrul tu phyin pa la sogs pa thun mong ma yin pa bstan pa rang bzhin gyis yon tan dang ldan pa 'di yang don bstan pa'i me long shin tu dri ma med pa'i nang du snang na dga' ba skyed
translated: in the same way, this form of the Mahāyāna Dharma, which is endowed with intrinsic virtue, such as the stages and perfections, and is taught as not shared in common, when it appears in the mirror of the teaching of the meaning, which is completely stainless, generates delight.

original: pas brgyan pa yin no //
analyzed: pas brgyan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is an ornament.

original: nga ni sman la sogs pa'i dpe gsum gyis chos kyi bsngags pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: nga ni sman la sogs pa'i dpe gsum gyis chos kyi bsngags pa ston par byed do //
translated: I teach the praise of the Dharma by means of the three examples of medicine, etc.

original: sman gyi rigs la la 'di 'dra ste /
analyzed: sman gyi rigs la la 'di 'dra ste /
translated: Some kinds of medicine are like this:

original: gang gi tshe ba snam sa na ni sna'i dbang po tshim par mi byed cing skyo ba skyed la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ba snam sa na ni sna'i dbang po tshim par mi byed cing skyo ba skyed la /
translated: when it is smelled, it does not satisfy the nose faculty and produces disgust.

original: sman de nyid gang gi tshe lce'i dbang pos myangs na ni ro phun sum tshogs pas lce'i dbang po tshim par byed cing dga' ba yang skyed /
analyzed: sman de nyid gang gi tshe lce'i dbang pos myangs na ni ro phun sum tshogs pas lce'i dbang po tshim par byed cing dga' ba yang skyed /
translated: But when that very medicine is tasted by the tongue faculty, it satisfies the tongue faculty with its perfect taste and also produces joy.

original: spyad de 'ju ba na rim gyis lus la yod pa'i nad thams cad kyang sel bar byed do //
analyzed: spyad de 'ju ba na rim gyis lus la yod pa'i nad thams cad kyang sel bar byed do //
translated: When it is digested, it gradually removes all the illnesses in the body.

original: de bzhin du theg pa chen po'i chos gnyis su gnas pa yang go rims bzhin du sman dku la zhim pa dang 'dra bar mi dga' ba skyed par byed pa dang dga' bskyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du theg pa chen po'i chos gnyis su gnas pa yang go rims bzhin du sman dku la zhim pa dang 'dra bar mi dga' ba skyed par byed pa dang dga' bskyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: In the same way, the Mahāyāna Dharma, which is twofold, produces, respectively, the displeasure like the bitter medicine and the joy like the sweet medicine.

original: rab 'byor sangs rgyas med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor sangs rgyas med do //
translated: Subhūti, there are no Buddhas.

original: chos med do //
analyzed: chos med do //
translated: There is no Dharma.

original: dge 'dun med do zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge dag thos nas bsnams nar btu dku ba'i sman bzhin du skyo ba skyed do //🔽gang gi tshe dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang 'phrad nas /
analyzed: dge 'dun med do zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge dag thos nas bsnams nar btu dku ba'i sman bzhin du skyo ba skyed do // gang gi tshe dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang 'phrad nas /
translated: When they hear the names, phrases, and letters such as there is no Sangha, they are discouraged, as if they had gathered a bitter herb.

original: ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge 'di dag gi don ni sgra ji bzhin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i don rtogs pa de'i tshe myangs na zhim pa'i sman myangs pa bzhin du dga' ba skyed la /
analyzed: ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge 'di dag gi don ni sgra ji bzhin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i don rtogs pa de'i tshe myangs na zhim pa'i sman myangs pa bzhin du dga' ba skyed la /
translated: But when they meet a spiritual teacher and understand the meaning of the Mahayana, that is, that the meaning of these names, phrases, and letters is not literal, then they are delighted, as if they had found a delicious medicine.

original: thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i rim gyis bsgoms na nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nad nye bar zhi bar byed pas sgrib pa spangs ba'i rgyu nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i rim gyis bsgoms na nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nad nye bar zhi bar byed pas sgrib pa spangs ba'i rgyu nyid du bstan to //
translated: When they cultivate it by the process of hearing, reflection, and meditation, it cures the diseases of the afflictions and the obstructions to omniscience, and so it is taught to be the cause of the elimination of the obstructions.

original: rgyal po mnyes par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyal po mnyes par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase the king who is difficult to please is explained in the following.

original: @45b yab dang sras mjal ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: @45b yab dang sras mjal ba'i mdo las /
translated: In the Meeting of Father and Son Sutra,

original: 'char byed kyis ji skad du /
analyzed: 'char byed kyis ji skad du /
translated: Udayana said:

original: rgyal po rnams ni bsnyen par dka' ba lags te /
analyzed: rgyal po rnams ni bsnyen par dka' ba lags te /
translated: Kings are difficult to please,

original: mnyes par bgyid dka' ba lags so //
analyzed: mnyes par bgyid dka' ba lags so //
translated: and once pleased, they are difficult to reward.

original: nam zhig mnyes par bgyis na ji ltar 'dod pa'i don stsol bar bgyid pa lags so zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nam zhig mnyes par bgyis na ji ltar 'dod pa'i don stsol bar bgyid pa lags so zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: But when they are pleased, they give whatever you want.

original: de bzhin du theg pa chen po'i chos kyang mnyes par dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du theg pa chen po'i chos kyang mnyes par dka' ba yin te /
translated: In the same way, the Dharma of the Great Vehicle is difficult to please,

original: ji skad du 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtsho'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtsho'i mdo las /
translated: as the noble Sāgaramati Sūtra says,

original: blo gros rgya mtsho sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni rnyed par sla'o //
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni rnyed par sla'o //
translated: “Sāgaramati, it is easy to say, ‘I will become a Buddha.’

original: tshogs rnams yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba ni dka'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: tshogs rnams yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba ni dka'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: But it is difficult to accomplish the collections.”

original: gang gi tshe go cha'i brtson 'grus la sogs pa'i brtson 'grus las brtsams pas mgu bar byed pa de'i tshe yon tan khyad par can mngon par shes pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyis dbang phyug rnyed par 'gyur bas dbang 'byor ba'i rgyu nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe go cha'i brtson 'grus la sogs pa'i brtson 'grus las brtsams pas mgu bar byed pa de'i tshe yon tan khyad par can mngon par shes pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyis dbang phyug rnyed par 'gyur bas dbang 'byor ba'i rgyu nyid du bstan to //
translated: When one delights by beginning the effort of armoring, etc., then one finds mastery of the qualities, the superknowledges, the strengths, the fearlessnesses, etc.

original: rin po che rigs dang ldan pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing dbyibs kyi tshad la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rin po che rigs dang ldan pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing dbyibs kyi tshad la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: A jewel is naturally radiant, and has a perfect shape, size, etc.

original: rin po che de lta bu skye bo lta mi shes pa'i lag tu son na skye bo lta mi shes pa de'i sems yongs su mgu bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rin po che de lta bu skye bo lta mi shes pa'i lag tu son na skye bo lta mi shes pa de'i sems yongs su mgu bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: When such a jewel falls into the hands of a person who does not know how to value it, it does not delight the person who does not know how to value it.

original: de nyid skye bo lta shes pa'i lag tu son na skye bo de rab tu dga' ba mchog gis mgu bar byed cing gser la sogs pa gzhan mang po'i rgyur yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid skye bo lta shes pa'i lag tu son na skye bo de rab tu dga' ba mchog gis mgu bar byed cing gser la sogs pa gzhan mang po'i rgyur yang 'gyur ro //
translated: But when it falls into the hands of a person who knows how to value it, it delights that person with its supreme beauty and becomes the cause of many other jewels, gold, etc.

original: de bzhin du theg pa chen po'i chos 'di yang skye bo lta mi shes pa don mngon par mi shes pa'i lag tu son na dga' ba mi skyed kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du theg pa chen po'i chos 'di yang skye bo lta mi shes pa don mngon par mi shes pa'i lag tu son na dga' ba mi skyed kyi /
translated: Likewise, when this Dharma of the Great Vehicle comes into the hands of people who do not know how to look at it, who do not understand its meaning, it does not give rise to joy.

original: gang gi tshe 'di nyid skye bo lta shes pa'i lag tu son par gyur pa de'i tshe dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba'i mchog kyang skyed la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di nyid skye bo lta shes pa'i lag tu son par gyur pa de'i tshe dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba'i mchog kyang skyed la /
translated: But when it comes into the hands of people who know how to look at it, then it gives rise to the highest joy and delight.

original: 'phags pa'i nor dad pa dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / gtong ba dang / shes rab dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa la nye bar spyod pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pas 'phags pa'i nor la spyod pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i nor dad pa dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / gtong ba dang / shes rab dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa la nye bar spyod pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pas 'phags pa'i nor la spyod pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan to //
translated: And it is shown to be the very cause for the enjoyment of the wealth of the Aryas, because it is the reason for the enjoyment of the wealth of the Aryas, faith, morality, learning, generosity, wisdom, conscience, and shame.

original: da ni chos kyi yon tan brjod pa sgrub pa'i skabs yin te /🔽spyod yul ma yin zhes bya ba ni la la 'di snyam du theg pa chen po 'di ni rtog @46a * //
analyzed: da ni chos kyi yon tan brjod pa sgrub pa'i skabs yin te / spyod yul ma yin zhes bya ba ni la la 'di snyam du theg pa chen po 'di ni rtog @46a * //
translated: Now, the occasion is the accomplishment of the expression of the qualities of the Dharma.

original: ge pa rnams kyis gzhan dag bslu bar bya ba'i phyir bkod pa yin te /
analyzed: ge pa rnams kyis gzhan dag bslu bar bya ba'i phyir bkod pa yin te /
translated: Some think, This Great Vehicle was set forth by logicians in order to deceive others.

original: 'di ltar de dag la yang tshul 'di lta bu dmigs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la yang tshul 'di lta bu dmigs so //
translated: For, in the same way, this method is also observed in their scriptures.

original: de bas na kho bo ni der dogs so zhes bya bar sems na /
analyzed: de bas na kho bo ni der dogs so zhes bya bar sems na /
translated: Therefore, we suspect that this is the case.

original: de ltar dogs par byar mi rung ba de nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar dogs par byar mi rung ba de nyid de /
translated: But it is not proper to suspect this,

original: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i tshul zab cing rgya che ba dang ldan pa de lta bu ni mu stegs can gyi bstan bcos dag la mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i tshul zab cing rgya che ba dang ldan pa de lta bu ni mu stegs can gyi bstan bcos dag la mi dmigs so //
translated: for such a method, profound and vast, of the stages and perfections, is not observed in the treatises of the tīrthikas.

original: gzhan yang khyod pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa la dad pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyod pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa la dad pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if you have faith in the teaching of the perfections,

original: ji ltar 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa dang / blo gros rgya mtsho dang / dkon mchog sprin dang / lag bzangs la sogs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa dang / blo gros rgya mtsho dang / dkon mchog sprin dang / lag bzangs la sogs pa'i mdo las /
translated: then how can you think, after hearing the teaching of the perfections in the noble Aksayamatinirdesa, Sagaramatinirdesa, Ratnameghasutra, and Suddhamntirjalasutra,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa thos nas 'di ni rtog ge pas bkod pa yin no zhes bya bar sems dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa thos nas 'di ni rtog ge pas bkod pa yin no zhes bya bar sems dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: that this is the composition of logicians?

original: bdag med pa la sogs pa'i tshig gi don gang yin pa dag la ma mos pa de dag ni gang zag la sogs pa bstan pa bzhin du sgra ji bzhin pa'i don ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag med pa la sogs pa'i tshig gi don gang yin pa dag la ma mos pa de dag ni gang zag la sogs pa bstan pa bzhin du sgra ji bzhin pa'i don ma yin te /
translated: Those who do not believe in the meaning of the words “selflessness” and so on should not take them literally, as if they were teaching the person and so on.

original: de dag byis pa'i skye bos kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid du ngo bo nyid med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag byis pa'i skye bos kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid du ngo bo nyid med pa yin gyi /
translated: They are not the reality of the self imagined by the childish.🔽They are not the object of the wisdom of the āryas and the wisdom attained subsequently to it.

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes dang de'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyi yul nyid du ni ma yin pas gnas ma yin par dogs par ma byed cig / yod dang med na yod med dang / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes dang de'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyi yul nyid du ni ma yin pas gnas ma yin par dogs par ma byed cig / yod dang med na yod med dang / zhes bya ba la /
translated: Do not doubt that they are not the basis of the words.

original: yod pa dang med pa ni yod dang med do //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa ni yod dang med do //
translated: “ Existence and nonexistence, existence and nonexistence” means🔽existence and nonexistence.

original: de yod dang med na go rims bzhin du yod pa'i phyir dang / med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yod dang med na go rims bzhin du yod pa'i phyir dang / med pa'i phyir te /
translated: If they exist or do not exist, they exist and do not exist, respectively.

original: gal te theg pa chen po cung zad gcig yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te theg pa chen po cung zad gcig yod na ni /
translated: If the Mahāyāna exists in the least,

original: de yod dang 'di sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin par grub ste /
analyzed: de yod dang 'di sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin par grub ste /
translated: then it is established that it exists and that it is the word of the Buddha.

original: 'di las gzhan pa'i theg pa chen po med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni yod na yod pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di las gzhan pa'i theg pa chen po med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni yod na yod pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is an explanation of existence as existence, because there is no other Mahayana.

original: 'on te med na ni de med dang nyan thos kyi theg pa yang med de /
analyzed: 'on te med na ni de med dang nyan thos kyi theg pa yang med de /
translated: But if it does not exist, then the Sravakayana does not exist,

original: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa med par nyan thos kyi theg pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa med par nyan thos kyi theg pa med do //
