translated: because there is no Sravakayana without the Bodhisattvayna.

original: 'di ni med na med pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni med na med pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is an explanation of nonexistence as nonexistence.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis bsdus pa'i ston pa yang chung la zhes bya ba ni gzar bu gang tsam byin pas gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis bsdus pa'i ston pa yang chung la zhes bya ba ni gzar bu gang tsam byin pas gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The Teacher is also small, being included in the collections of merit and knowledge.🔽And he is engaged in the Mahayana sutras of his own vehicle.

original: rang gi theg pa chen po'i @46b mdo sde la yang 'jug pa kho na'o zhes bya ba 'di'i sbyar ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi theg pa chen po'i @46b mdo sde la yang 'jug pa kho na'o zhes bya ba 'di'i sbyar ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the connection here?

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa rnams na re sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung gi mtshan nyid ni nag po bstan pa dang / chen po bstan pa las gang mdo sde la yang 'jug /'dul ba la yang snang /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa rnams na re sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung gi mtshan nyid ni nag po bstan pa dang / chen po bstan pa las gang mdo sde la yang 'jug /'dul ba la yang snang /
translated: The śrāvaka vehicle says: The definition of the speech of the Bhagavat Buddha is that which is included in the sūtra collection and appears in the vinaya,

original: chos nyid dang yang mi 'gal ba'o zhes bstan te /
analyzed: chos nyid dang yang mi 'gal ba'o zhes bstan te /
translated: and does not contradict reality.

original: de ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin na theg pa chen po 'di ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par ston pa'i phyir mdo sde la yang mi 'jug la /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin na theg pa chen po 'di ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par ston pa'i phyir mdo sde la yang mi 'jug la /
translated: If that is the word of the Buddha, then this Mahāyāna is not included in the sūtra collection because it teaches that all phenomena lack entityness.

original: sangs rgyas med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas med do //
translated: It says, “There is no buddha.”

original: chos med do //
analyzed: chos med do //
translated: It says, “There is no dharma.”🔽It says, “There is no saṅgha.”🔽If it recites such things, it is included in the vinaya.

original: dge 'dun med do zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'don na ltung byed dang bcas par 'gyur bas 'dul ba la yang mi snang ngo zhes zer ba la sogs pa ni de dag gi tshig gi skabs yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun med do zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'don na ltung byed dang bcas par 'gyur bas 'dul ba la yang mi snang ngo zhes zer ba la sogs pa ni de dag gi tshig gi skabs yin no //
translated: This is the context of their words.

original: de dag la 'di 'dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag la 'di 'dri bar bya ste /
translated: They should be asked this:

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde ni gang la mi 'jug /'dul ba ni gang la mi snang /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde ni gang la mi 'jug /'dul ba ni gang la mi snang /
translated: In what way is the Mahāyāna sūtra collection not included? In what way does it not appear in the vinaya?

original: re zhig gal te 'phags pa thams cad yod par smra ba'i lung gi mdo sde la yang mi 'jug go //
analyzed: re zhig gal te 'phags pa thams cad yod par smra ba'i lung gi mdo sde la yang mi 'jug go //
translated: If you say that the scriptures of the Āryasthavira are not included in the scriptures of the Āryasāmmitīyas,

original: 'dul ba la yang mi snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'dul ba la yang mi snang ngo zhe na /
translated: then the latter are not included in the Vinaya.

original: de ni sde pa bcva brgyad kyi mdo sde mang po rnams phan tshun 'gal te /
analyzed: de ni sde pa bcva brgyad kyi mdo sde mang po rnams phan tshun 'gal te /
translated: The scriptures of the eighteen schools are mutually contradictory.

original: 'phags pa mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa rnams ni stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'i mdo sde rnams mi brjod do ;
analyzed: 'phags pa mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa rnams ni stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'i mdo sde rnams mi brjod do ;
translated: The Āryasammitīyas do not recite the sūtras that contain the doctrine of emptiness.

original: /'phags pa dge 'dun phal chen sde pa rnams ni srid pa bar ma ston pa'i mdo sde rnams spong ngo //
analyzed: /'phags pa dge 'dun phal chen sde pa rnams ni srid pa bar ma ston pa'i mdo sde rnams spong ngo //
translated: The Āryamahāsaṃghikas reject the sūtras that teach the intermediate existence.

original: de bzhin du mdo sde gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang sde pa tha dad pa rnams kyi phan tshun 'gal bas de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo sde gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang sde pa tha dad pa rnams kyi phan tshun 'gal bas de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: In the same way, other sūtras are mutually contradictory in the different schools, so they are not the word of the Buddha.

original: 'dul ba dang / chos mngon pa cho ga tha dad pa dang / gzhung lugs tha dad pas phan tshun 'gal ba de dag kyang phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba dang / chos mngon pa cho ga tha dad pa dang / gzhung lugs tha dad pas phan tshun 'gal ba de dag kyang phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The Vinaya, Abhidharma, and the different rituals and scriptural systems are mutually contradictory, and therefore are not the word of the Buddha.

original: 'on te bdag nyid kyi sde pa rnams la rang gi sde ba'i mdo sde la 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bdag nyid kyi sde pa rnams la rang gi sde ba'i mdo sde la 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are the entryway into the sūtras of your own Buddhist schools,

original: theg pa chen po yang rang gi theg pa chen po'i mdo sde la yang 'jug pa kho na'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po yang rang gi theg pa chen po'i mdo sde la yang 'jug pa kho na'o //
translated: then the Mahāyāna is also the entryway into the sūtras of the Mahāyāna.

original: nyon mongs pa 'dul ba la sogs pa la yang snang ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'dul ba la sogs pa la yang snang ngo //
translated: It also appears to be the subduer of afflictions and so on.

original: zab cing rgya che ba'i chos nyid dang yang mi 'gal te /
analyzed: zab cing rgya che ba'i chos nyid dang yang mi 'gal te /
translated: It is not contradictory to the profound and vast Dharma.

original: byang chub chen po 'thob par 'gyur ba'i chos nyid ni 'di kho na yin na /🔽ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi bka' @47a * //
analyzed: byang chub chen po 'thob par 'gyur ba'i chos nyid ni 'di kho na yin na / ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi bka' @47a * //
translated: This is the Dharma that leads to the attainment of great awakening.

original: nyid ma yin /
analyzed: nyid ma yin /
translated: How could it not be the word of the Buddha?

original: 'on te sde pa thams cad kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa de sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin no zhe na ni sde pa thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir theg pa chen po kho na sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'on te sde pa thams cad kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa de sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin no zhe na ni sde pa thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir theg pa chen po kho na sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: But if you say that the Buddha’s word is that which is accepted by all schools, then the Mahayana is the Buddha’s word because it is accepted by all schools.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the Śrāvakayāna.

original: de bas na mtshan nyid dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mtshan nyid dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it does not contradict the characteristics of the Buddha’s word, the Mahayana is the word of the Buddha.

original: de las gzhan dang gzhan med ces bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i theg pa chen po yang med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de las gzhan dang gzhan med ces bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i theg pa chen po yang med pa'i phyir la /
translated: There is no other, apart from that, is said because there is no other vehicle apart from that,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because there are no śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas.

original: gzhan dang gzhan zhes smos pa ni theg pa chen po dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan zhes smos pa ni theg pa chen po dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The words other and other refer to the Mahayana and the Śrāvakayāna and the Pratyekabuddhayāna.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dgongs pa ni shin tu zab ces bya ba la sogs dgongs pa ni bsam pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dgongs pa ni shin tu zab ces bya ba la sogs dgongs pa ni bsam pa ste /
translated: The thought of the Bhagavat Buddhas is very profound, etc. Thought is intention.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bsam pa dang / bag la nyal yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir dgongs pa mang pos chos ston pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dgongs pa ni zab ces bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bsam pa dang / bag la nyal yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir dgongs pa mang pos chos ston pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dgongs pa ni zab ces bya'o //
translated: The thought of the Bhagavat Buddhas is profound because the Bhagavat Buddhas teach the Dharma with many thoughts, because they know the intentions and the hidden intentions.

original: ring du rjes su zhugs pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul ni ring du rjes su zhugs pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul te /
analyzed: ring du rjes su zhugs pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul ni ring du rjes su zhugs pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul te /
translated: The domain of the knowledge that penetrates far is the domain of the knowledge that penetrates far.

original: gang la thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i ye shes 'jug pa yod pa de spang par bya bar rigs na de med pa na go ji ltar spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang la thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i ye shes 'jug pa yod pa de spang par bya bar rigs na de med pa na go ji ltar spang bar bya'o //
translated: If it is reasonable to abandon that in which the knowledge that penetrates far is present, then how can it be abandoned when it is not present?

original: de las de'i 'bras bu chos 'thob po zhes bya ba'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'i 'bras bu rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes te de dag 'thob bo //
analyzed: de las de'i 'bras bu chos 'thob po zhes bya ba'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'i 'bras bu rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes te de dag 'thob bo //
translated: The result of that is the attainment of the Dharma, i.e., the result of right view is the attainment of liberation and the knowledge of liberation.

original: re zhig gal te bdag gis 'di mi shes pas skrag pa'i gnas yin no zhe na /
analyzed: re zhig gal te bdag gis 'di mi shes pas skrag pa'i gnas yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is a matter for fear because I do not know it,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: that is not right.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'di ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur ma byas pa rnams kyis rtogs par mi nus so //🔽rtogs par dka' ba 'di nyid sems la bzhag nas sems dang bcas pas theg pa chen po rtogs par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur ma byas pa rnams kyis rtogs par mi nus so // rtogs par dka' ba 'di nyid sems la bzhag nas sems dang bcas pas theg pa chen po rtogs par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not possible for those who have not accumulated the roots of virtue, who have not honored the spiritual benefactors, to understand it.

original: mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba bzhin du dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur bya ba la 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba bzhin du dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur bya ba la 'bad par bya'o //
translated: Having set your mind on this very difficulty of understanding, you should strive to honor the spiritual benefactors as if your head and clothes were on fire, in order to understand the Great Vehicle with a mind that is intent on it.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here is a verse:

original: gal @47b te thabs tshul mkhas pas blo rnams ma dub na //
analyzed: gal @47b te thabs tshul mkhas pas blo rnams ma dub na //
translated: If you do not tire of the effort to understand through skillful means,

original: skye bo thabs la mkhas pa'i spyod pa'i rjes su 'brangs //
analyzed: skye bo thabs la mkhas pa'i spyod pa'i rjes su 'brangs //
translated: you will follow the conduct of the skillful in the world.

original: gal te de yang mi 'dod mchog dga' bral ba yin //
analyzed: gal te de yang mi 'dod mchog dga' bral ba yin //
translated: If you do not want that, you will be deprived of the highest joy.

original: phongs pa mang du yongs su spyod pa lta gon gyis //
analyzed: phongs pa mang du yongs su spyod pa lta gon gyis //
translated: Be on your guard against the many misfortunes that will come.

original: 'on te sangs rgyas kyang tshig gi don zab mo thugs su chud pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te sangs rgyas kyang tshig gi don zab mo thugs su chud pa ma yin na /
translated: But if the Buddha himself did not understand the profound meaning of the words,🔽why would he teach the profound?

original: de ci'i phyir zab mo ston par 'gyur zhes skrag pa'i gnas yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zab mo ston par 'gyur zhes skrag pa'i gnas yin no zhe na /
translated: This is a source of fear.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not a valid objection.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why not?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi mtshan nyid 'di ni don dang mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi mtshan nyid 'di ni don dang mthun pa yin te /
translated: The Blessed One’s character is consistent with his meaning.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa'i phyir dang / shes bya thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kha bye ba'i phyir sangs rgyas yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa'i phyir dang / shes bya thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kha bye ba'i phyir sangs rgyas yin no //
translated: He is a Buddha because he has eliminated the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, together with their propensities, and because his unobstructed intuition has opened up to all objects of knowledge.

original: gal te sems can 'di lta bus kyang khyad par dag thugs su ma chud na bdag cag la sogs pas lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: gal te sems can 'di lta bus kyang khyad par dag thugs su ma chud na bdag cag la sogs pas lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: If even such a being as this did not understand the distinctions, what need is there to speak of ourselves and others?

original: de la yang skrag par rigs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la yang skrag par rigs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not reasonable to be afraid of that.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur bya ba kho na la 'bad par gyis shig dang / de nas ci sangs rgyas kyis zab mo thugs su chud dam 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba bdag nyid kyis shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur bya ba kho na la 'bad par gyis shig dang / de nas ci sangs rgyas kyis zab mo thugs su chud dam 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba bdag nyid kyis shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: You should strive only to serve the spiritual friend, and then you will know for yourself whether or not the Buddha has penetrated the profound.

original: 'on te ci'i phyir zab mo rtog ge pa'i spyod yul ma yin zhes skrag pa'i gnas yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ci'i phyir zab mo rtog ge pa'i spyod yul ma yin zhes skrag pa'i gnas yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you ask why the profound is not the domain of logicians, it is because it is a source of fear.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not reasonable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rtog ge gsal ba la 'bad par bya'i skrag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog ge gsal ba la 'bad par bya'i skrag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: You should strive for clear logic, not for fear.

original: de ltar na theg pa chen po'i chos 'di ni rtog ge pa rnams kyi spyod yul yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na theg pa chen po'i chos 'di ni rtog ge pa rnams kyi spyod yul yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, this Dharma of the Great Vehicle is not the domain of logicians.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pas na /
translated: And because that is so,

original: bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos la sogs pas bstod pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos la sogs pas bstod pa /
translated: the Buddha is praised by the bodhisattvas and the śrāvakas, etc.

original: thub pa skyes mchog dgongs pa ni //🔽rtog ge pa yi yul ma lags //
analyzed: thub pa skyes mchog dgongs pa ni // rtog ge pa yi yul ma lags //
translated: The thought of the Sage, the best of beings,🔽is not the domain of logicians.

original: byis pa'i spyod yul ma lags te //
analyzed: byis pa'i spyod yul ma lags te //
translated: It is not the domain of the childish.

original: sems dang sems byung rnams las 'das //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung rnams las 'das //
translated: It is beyond mind and mental factors.🔽Master Matrceta also says:

original: slob dpon ma khol gyi zhal snga nas kyis kyang bdag ni rtog ge pa yin na /
analyzed: slob dpon ma khol gyi zhal snga nas kyis kyang bdag ni rtog ge pa yin na /
translated: If even the Sravakas, who are logicians,

original: nyan thos rtog pa po gang dag yin pa de dag kyang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa nus pa rdugs so snyam nas /🔽bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa /🔽gal te skal chen de @48a * //🔽dag kyang ni khyod la mthu rdugs na //
analyzed: nyan thos rtog pa po gang dag yin pa de dag kyang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa nus pa rdugs so snyam nas / bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa / gal te skal chen de @48a * // dag kyang ni khyod la mthu rdugs na //
translated: are impeded in their power and fearlessness, etc.,

original: bdag 'dra srid pa'i phyi sa'i srin bus bsam skabs ga la mchis //
analyzed: bdag 'dra srid pa'i phyi sa'i srin bus bsam skabs ga la mchis //
translated: then what can be said of one like me, a worm in the filth of existence?

original: yid kyi nyes pa rang bzhin gdug pa ste //
analyzed: yid kyi nyes pa rang bzhin gdug pa ste //
translated: The faults of the mind are naturally vicious.

original: mi rigs pa yi gzugs la'ang mi rigs na //
analyzed: mi rigs pa yi gzugs la'ang mi rigs na //
translated: If it is improper even for an improper form,

original: zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa'i gzugs phan pa ma yin pa la sogs pa byed pa sgra la sogs pa gang yin pa de la yang khong khro ba bskyed par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa'i gzugs phan pa ma yin pa la sogs pa byed pa sgra la sogs pa gang yin pa de la yang khong khro ba bskyed par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: it is improper to generate anger even toward sound, etc., which are improper forms that do not benefit.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos mngon pa kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: chos mngon pa kun las btus pa las /
translated: In the Abhidharma-samuccaya,

original: ji skad du nyon mongs pa'i skabs nas /
analyzed: ji skad du nyon mongs pa'i skabs nas /
translated: As was explained in the chapter on the afflictions.

original: mtshan nyid kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like in terms of its characteristics?

original: chos gang zhig skye ba na rab tu ma zhi bar skye la /
analyzed: chos gang zhig skye ba na rab tu ma zhi bar skye la /
translated: When a phenomenon arises, it arises as a lack of peace.🔽And when it has arisen, the continuum of mind arises as a lack of peace.

original: gang zhig skyes nas kyang sems kyi rgyud rab tu ma zhi bar 'byung ba de ni nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhig skyes nas kyang sems kyi rgyud rab tu ma zhi bar 'byung ba de ni nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: That is the characteristic of the afflictions.

original: de lta bas na gang zhig skyes na sems kyi gnas skabs 'di 'dra bar 'gyur ba khong khro ba ni dgra la sogs pa phan pa ma yin pa la sogs pa la zhugs pa dag la yang bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang zhig skyes na sems kyi gnas skabs 'di 'dra bar 'gyur ba khong khro ba ni dgra la sogs pa phan pa ma yin pa la sogs pa la zhugs pa dag la yang bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, when anger arises, one should not give rise to a mental state like this, even with regard to enemies and so on who are engaged in non-beneficial activities and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang mdo sde de dang de dag las lhangs  por bkag ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang mdo sde de dang de dag las lhangs  por bkag ste /
translated: The Bhagavān also clearly prohibited this in this and that sūtra.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sog le lta bu la sogs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sog le lta bu la sogs pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Bhagavān said in the Sūtra on the Saw and so on:

original: sdong dum tshig pa la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: sdong dum tshig pa la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: Even with regard to a burnt stump.

original: gang the tshom za ba de la sems dang bcas pas ji ltar khong khro ba bskyed par rigs /
analyzed: gang the tshom za ba de la sems dang bcas pas ji ltar khong khro ba bskyed par rigs /
translated: How can one who is doubtful about something have a mind that is angry?

original: de nyid kyi phyir mkhas pa rnams //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mkhas pa rnams //
translated: For this very reason, the wise

original: grog mkhar du ni lag bcug nas //
analyzed: grog mkhar du ni lag bcug nas //
translated: do not put their hand into an anthill,

original: yon tan cung zhig rnyed mi 'gyur //
analyzed: yon tan cung zhig rnyed mi 'gyur //
translated: because they do not obtain even a little benefit.

original: gal te sbrul zhig yod gyur na //
analyzed: gal te sbrul zhig yod gyur na //
translated: If there is a snake,

original: byis pa dag ni phung bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gdon to //
analyzed: byis pa dag ni phung bar 'gyur // zhes gdon to //
translated: the fool is destroyed.

original: gzhan dag kyang /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang /
translated: Others also say:

original: 'jig rten pha rol the tshom ma yang //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol the tshom ma yang //
translated: The wise do not doubt the next world,

original: mdzangs pa rnams kyis sdig pa spang //
analyzed: mdzangs pa rnams kyis sdig pa spang //
translated: and they abandon evil.

original: brgya la med na'ang der zad mod //
analyzed: brgya la med na'ang der zad mod //
translated: If there is no next world, that is the end of it.

original: gal te yod na med lta brlag / ces zer ro //🔽re zhig mkhas pas ni gzu bo'i gzhung bzung la skye bo mkhas pa mgu bar 'gyur ba'i rigs pa 'di khong du chud par byas pa dang / ci 'di khong khro ba'i gzhi yin nam /
analyzed: gal te yod na med lta brlag / ces zer ro // re zhig mkhas pas ni gzu bo'i gzhung bzung la skye bo mkhas pa mgu bar 'gyur ba'i rigs pa 'di khong du chud par byas pa dang / ci 'di khong khro ba'i gzhi yin nam /
translated: But if there is, the view that there is not is destroyed.🔽The wise, for their part, should take up an impartial position and understand this reasoning that pleases the wise.

original: 'on te dad pa'i gzhi yin zhes bya ba 'di bdag nyid kyis shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te dad pa'i gzhi yin zhes bya ba 'di bdag nyid kyis shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: They should know for themselves whether this is a basis for anger or a basis for faith.

original: rigs pa khas mi len na ni blo the tshom can rang bzhin gyis kha na @48b ma tho ba dang bcas pa khong khro ba spang bar 'dod pa btang snyoms su bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa khas mi len na ni blo the tshom can rang bzhin gyis kha na @48b ma tho ba dang bcas pa khong khro ba spang bar 'dod pa btang snyoms su bya'o //
translated: If one does not accept the reasoning, then one should be indifferent, since the mind that is doubtful by nature has a sin, and one wishes to abandon anger.

original: theg pa chen po sgrub pa'i skabs so /
analyzed: theg pa chen po sgrub pa'i skabs so /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the practice of the Great Vehicle.🔽It was explained that one adorns the Dharma by teaching the meaning to those who understand the meaning.🔽And when the Dharma is naturally endowed with good qualities, how can it be adorned?

original: // / don shes pa don ston pas chos brgyan par byed do zhes bshad pa dang / gang gi tshe chos de rang bzhin gyis yon tan dang ldan pa yin na ji ltar brgyan par byed ces bya ba'i klan ka 'di yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // / don shes pa don ston pas chos brgyan par byed do zhes bshad pa dang / gang gi tshe chos de rang bzhin gyis yon tan dang ldan pa yin na ji ltar brgyan par byed ces bya ba'i klan ka 'di yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to completely avoid this objection, it is said:

original: gzugs rgyan rang bzhin yon tan ldan pa me long nang song na //
analyzed: gzugs rgyan rang bzhin yon tan ldan pa me long nang song na //
translated: When a form endowed with natural good qualities enters a mirror,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said to be adorned.

original: 'di kho nas 'di rgyan nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di kho nas 'di rgyan nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: This alone shows that it is an adornment.

original: chos kyi bsngags pa ni sman la sogs pa'i dpe gsum gyis bshad do //
analyzed: chos kyi bsngags pa ni sman la sogs pa'i dpe gsum gyis bshad do //
translated: The praise of the Dharma is explained by three examples, such as medicine.

original: de'i 'og tu kha cig theg pa chen po 'di sangs rgyas kyi bka' yang ma yin na /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu kha cig theg pa chen po 'di sangs rgyas kyi bka' yang ma yin na /
translated: After that, some say: If this Great Vehicle is not the word of the Buddha,

original: de la yon tan 'di lta ga la yod ces log par zhugs pa la chos la dbang ba bsngags par yon tan brjod pa bsgrub pa'i skabs su ji ltar theg pa chen po 'di kho na yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar theg
analyzed: de la yon tan 'di lta ga la yod ces log par zhugs pa la chos la dbang ba bsngags par yon tan brjod pa bsgrub pa'i skabs su ji ltar theg pa chen po 'di kho na yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar theg
translated: In the context of establishing the praise of mastery over Dharma, it is said that the Mahayana is the only vehicle, not another.

original: pa chen po bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: pa chen po bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the Mahayana should be established.🔽This is the only path for establishing the Mahayana and attaining buddhahood, not another.

original: theg pa chen po bsgrubs pa dang sangs rgyas nyid thob par byed pa'i lam ni 'di kho na yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes rangs par gyur pa gang dag sangs rgyas nyid don du gnyer ba de dag la theg pa chen po'i mchog bstan pas ji
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsgrubs pa dang sangs rgyas nyid thob par byed pa'i lam ni 'di kho na yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes rangs par gyur pa gang dag sangs rgyas nyid don du gnyer ba de dag la theg pa chen po'i mchog bstan pas ji
translated: Those who delight in this and aspire to buddhahood, for them the supreme Mahayana is taught.

original: ltar na sangs rgyas la sogs pa dkon mchog dag la skyabs su 'gro bar 'gyur ba de ltar skyabs su 'gro ba'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: ltar na sangs rgyas la sogs pa dkon mchog dag la skyabs su 'gro bar 'gyur ba de ltar skyabs su 'gro ba'i dbang du byas te /
translated: Just as they go for refuge to the jewels of the Buddha and so on, they should go for refuge in that way.

original: rang dang gzhan la legs par byed pa sangs rgyas nyid don du gnyer bas chos la 'dzud do //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan la legs par byed pa sangs rgyas nyid don du gnyer bas chos la 'dzud do //
translated: Those who aspire to the welfare of self and other and strive for buddhahood should be introduced to the Dharma.

original: nges pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni smon lam yin par bshad do //
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni smon lam yin par bshad do //
translated: The word “certainty” is explained as a vow.

original: theg pa mchog la skyabs su 'gro ba ni /
analyzed: theg pa mchog la skyabs su 'gro ba ni /
translated: Taking refuge in the supreme vehicle

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i grags pa dag gi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i grags pa dag gi rgyu yin no //
translated: is the cause of mundane and supramundane fame.

original: de dag gi nyes pa dang / yon tan la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de dag gi nyes pa dang / yon tan la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of non-discrimination regarding their faults and virtues.

original: de la 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la bye brag med do zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis 'khor ba'i nyes pa dang / snying rjes mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan la mi rtog go //
analyzed: de la 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la bye brag med do zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis 'khor ba'i nyes pa dang / snying rjes mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan la mi rtog go //
translated: Here, there is no distinction between cyclic existence and nirvana means that, through wisdom, one does not discriminate the faults of cyclic existence, and through compassion, one does not discriminate the virtues of nirvana.

original: de kho na'i dngos po don du gnyer ba ste zhes bya ba ni skyabs 'os kyi dngos po ste /
analyzed: de kho na'i dngos po don du gnyer ba ste zhes bya ba ni skyabs 'os kyi dngos po ste /
translated: Seeking the reality of that means the reality of the worthy object of refuge.

original: bdag kyang sangs rgyas su gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag kyang sangs rgyas su gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: It is “May I become a Buddha.”

original: @49a * // 'khor los sgyur ba'i bu mtshan nyid ji lta bu dang ldan pa zhig 'khor los sgyur ba'i rigs rgyud mi gcod par rung zhe na /
analyzed: @49a * // 'khor los sgyur ba'i bu mtshan nyid ji lta bu dang ldan pa zhig 'khor los sgyur ba'i rigs rgyud mi gcod par rung zhe na /
translated: What are the characteristics of a universal monarch’s son who is fit to continue the lineage of universal monarchs?

original: gal te 'khor los sgyur ba kho na btsun mo dam pa la sa bon 'jog par byed kyi /
analyzed: gal te 'khor los sgyur ba kho na btsun mo dam pa la sa bon 'jog par byed kyi /
translated: If the king were to deposit his seed only in the womb of his chief queen,

original: ngan pa dang bran mo la sogs pa la ma yin pa dang / pha dang ma phun sum tshogs pa'i sa bon de yang gal te mngal gyi gnas su son pa na rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan la sogs pa'i gnod pas ma nyams pa yin /
analyzed: ngan pa dang bran mo la sogs pa la ma yin pa dang / pha dang ma phun sum tshogs pa'i sa bon de yang gal te mngal gyi gnas su son pa na rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan la sogs pa'i gnod pas ma nyams pa yin /
translated: and not in the wombs of inferior women or slave women, and if that seed were to be destroyed in the womb by the humors of wind, bile, or phlegm,

original: gang gi tshe 'khor los sgyur ba'i bu de zla ba tshang nas bde blag tu legs par btsas pa de'i tshe yang ma ma bzang mo'i lag tu son pa yin te /🔽de ltar rim gyis bskyed pa ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rigs rgyun mi gcod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'khor los sgyur ba'i bu de zla ba tshang nas bde blag tu legs par btsas pa de'i tshe yang ma ma bzang mo'i lag tu son pa yin te / de ltar rim gyis bskyed pa ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rigs rgyun mi gcod par byed pa yin no //
translated: then when the son of the universal monarch is born after ten months, and is placed in the hands of the wet nurse,🔽then the lineage of universal monarchs would be broken.

original: de bzhin du 'di la yang theg pa chen po'i chos la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems bskyed pa ni sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi 'chad par byed pa'i sa bon yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la yang theg pa chen po'i chos la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems bskyed pa ni sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi 'chad par byed pa'i sa bon yin no //
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattvas’ generation of the intention to achieve enlightenment, based on the teachings of the Great Vehicle, is the seed that prevents the lineage of the buddhas from being broken.

original: de yang gal te sangs rgyas kyi rigs can kho na zhig sems skyed par byed kyi rigs med pa dang ma nges pa'i rigs can yang ma yin pa dang / sa bon de'i ma yang gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: de yang gal te sangs rgyas kyi rigs can kho na zhig sems skyed par byed kyi rigs med pa dang ma nges pa'i rigs can yang ma yin pa dang / sa bon de'i ma yang gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa dang /
translated: and if the mother of that seed is the perfection of wisdom and not something else,🔽and if the womb is endowed with the accumulations of merit and wisdom,

original: gal te yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa mngal gyi gnas yin pa dang / de la yang gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba'i chos rnams kyis bar chad ma byas te /
analyzed: gal te yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa mngal gyi gnas yin pa dang / de la yang gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba'i chos rnams kyis bar chad ma byas te /
translated: and if those are not impaired by factors that are discordant with them,🔽and if the nurse is compassion, which is the cause of generating the thought of awakening,🔽and if the birth is from the womb of the perfection of wisdom,

original: de ltar ma nyams pa yin pa dang / skye gnas kyang gal te snying rje ma ma yin pa de yang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug par skyong ba'i phyir skyed par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: de ltar ma nyams pa yin pa dang / skye gnas kyang gal te snying rje ma ma yin pa de yang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug par skyong ba'i phyir skyed par byed pa yin na /
translated: and if the nurse is compassion, which protects until the ultimate nirvana,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' legs par skyes pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi 'chad par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' legs par skyes pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi 'chad par byed pa yin no //
translated: then the bodhisattva is well born and perpetuates the lineage of the buddhas.

original: sna tshogs zhes smos pa ni 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i mtshan pas ches gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes smos pa ni 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i mtshan pas ches gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “various” is mentioned because he is clearly indicated by the marks of a universal monarch, etc.

original: stsogs pa zhes smos pa ni brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa zhes smos pa ni brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The term “etc.” includes Indra, Brahma, etc.

original: blon po chen po zhes smos pa ni blon po chen po'i khyad par bstan pas byang chub sems dpa'i khyad par ston @49b par byed do //
analyzed: blon po chen po zhes smos pa ni blon po chen po'i khyad par bstan pas byang chub sems dpa'i khyad par ston @49b par byed do //
translated: The term “great minister” indicates the bodhisattva’s preeminence by showing the preeminence of the great minister.

original: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sems can mang po'i don zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sems can mang po'i don zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “always and uninterruptedly for the sake of many beings”

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni skye ba brgyud pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni skye ba brgyud pa'o //
translated: The term “always” refers to a succession of lives.

original: rgyun mi 'chad ces bya ba ni skad cig ma brgyud pa ste /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad ces bya ba ni skad cig ma brgyud pa ste /
translated: The term “uninterruptedly” refers to a succession of moments.

original: dper na smra ba po nyin re zhing lan re sbyin pa spyin pa la rtag tu sbyin pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper na smra ba po nyin re zhing lan re sbyin pa spyin pa la rtag tu sbyin pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: For example, a speaker who gives a gift every day is called “a constant giver.”

original: gzhan zhig gis nyin re zhing lan cig ma yin gyi rgyun chags su yang dang yang sbyin pa sbyin na rgyun mi 'chad par sbyin pa sbyin pa'o zhes bya'o zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhig gis nyin re zhing lan cig ma yin gyi rgyun chags su yang dang yang sbyin pa sbyin na rgyun mi 'chad par sbyin pa sbyin pa'o zhes bya'o zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
translated: Another says: If one gives a gift continuously, not just once but repeatedly every day, that is called 'giving a gift continuously.'

original: sems can mang po'i don byed pa ni sems can rgya chen po'i don byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can mang po'i don byed pa ni sems can rgya chen po'i don byed pa'o //
translated: The benefit of many beings is the benefit of a great many beings.

original: mang po zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni mtha' yas pa dang / yangs pa dang / rgya chen po'i rnam grangs yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: mang po zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni mtha' yas pa dang / yangs pa dang / rgya chen po'i rnam grangs yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: This word many should be seen as a synonym for infinite, vast, and great.

original: sems can mang po rnams kyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can mang po rnams kyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it benefits a great many beings.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na sems can thams cad bdag nyid du khas blangs pas sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po rab tu zhi ba zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sa dang po thob pa'i dus na chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba rtogs so //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na sems can thams cad bdag nyid du khas blangs pas sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po rab tu zhi ba zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sa dang po thob pa'i dus na chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba rtogs so //
translated: The pacification of the great mass of suffering is as follows: At the time of realization, all beings are accepted as oneself, and thus the great mass of suffering is pacified. Thus, at the time of attaining the first ground, one realizes the all-pervasiveness of the dharmadhatu.

original: de rtogs pas sems can thams cad dang bdag mnyam pa nyid 'thob po //
analyzed: de rtogs pas sems can thams cad dang bdag mnyam pa nyid 'thob po //
translated: By realizing that, one attains the sameness of oneself and all sentient beings.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sa dang po'i nges pa'i tshig ci'i phyir sa dang po rab tu dga' ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sa dang po'i nges pa'i tshig ci'i phyir sa dang po rab tu dga' ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the first stage is called the Joyous.

original: des dang por rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa thob pa'i phyir ro zhes 'chad par gyur te /
analyzed: des dang por rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa thob pa'i phyir ro zhes 'chad par gyur te /
translated: Because, for the first time, one attains the perfection of one's own and others' goals.

original: rtogs pa des bdag dang sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal rab tu zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: rtogs pa des bdag dang sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal rab tu zhi bar byed do //
translated: By that realization, one pacifies the suffering of oneself and all sentient beings.

original: rtogs pa'i 'dis bdag dang gzhan dag gi sdug bsngal rab tu zhi bar byed pas na rab tu zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i 'dis bdag dang gzhan dag gi sdug bsngal rab tu zhi bar byed pas na rab tu zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: By this realization, one pacifies the suffering of oneself and others, and so it is called the Paced.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sa dang po la sdug bsngal gyi phung po nye bar zhi bas 'jigs pa lnga las yang dag par 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sa dang po la sdug bsngal gyi phung po nye bar zhi bas 'jigs pa lnga las yang dag par 'das pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, on the first stage, one transcends the five fears, because the mass of suffering is pacified.

original: sa dang po la ji ltar bdag gi sdug bsngal rab tu zhi bar byas pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi don bya'o snyam pa lhag pa'i bsam pa 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang po la ji ltar bdag gi sdug bsngal rab tu zhi bar byas pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi don bya'o snyam pa lhag pa'i bsam pa 'thob pa'o //
translated: On the first stage, one attains the superior intention, thinking, “Just as I have pacified my own suffering, so I will work for the benefit of all sentient beings.”

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i dus na blo mchog gi bde ba'o zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pa thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i dus na blo mchog gi bde ba'o zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pa thob pa'i phyir /
translated: The joy of the highest mind is at the time of attaining the acceptance that phenomena are not produced, on the eighth stage, because one attains spontaneous nonconceptual intuition.

original: blo mchog gi bde ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: blo mchog gi bde ba zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the joy of the highest mind.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mchog ces bya ba smos so //🔽sa de la mngon @50a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mchog ces bya ba smos so // sa de la mngon @50a * //
translated: For that very reason, it is called the highest.🔽On that stage, the great vehicle is attained,

original: bar 'du byed pa med par rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir dpe grub bo che 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bar 'du byed pa med par rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir dpe grub bo che 'byung ngo //
translated: because it proceeds spontaneously without the need for conscious effort.

original: srid pa dang zhi ba dag las rnam par grol zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srid pa dang zhi ba dag las rnam par grol zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is liberated from existence and from peace.

original: srid pa las rnam par grol ba ni /
analyzed: srid pa las rnam par grol ba ni /
translated: Liberated from existence means

original: 'di ltar 'khor ba'i skyon gyis mi gos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor ba'i skyon gyis mi gos pa'o //
translated: that it is not defiled by the faults of cyclic life.

original: zhi ba las rnam par grol ba ni 'di ltar nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba las rnam par grol ba ni 'di ltar nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Liberated from peace means that, unlike the Sravakas, he does not lean toward Nirvana.

original: dge ba dang dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni don gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba dang dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni don gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The roots of virtue and virtue are not different in meaning.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya che ba nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa gang yin pa dge ba rnam pa bzhi bshad pa gang yin pa de yang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten ma yin pa la sogs pa yin te /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya che ba nyid ni 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya che ba nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa gang yin pa dge ba rnam pa bzhi bshad pa gang yin pa de yang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten ma yin pa la sogs pa yin te / dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya che ba nyid ni 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: The four kinds of virtue that were taught in the above passage on the greatness of the roots of virtue are mundane and supramundane.🔽The greatness of the roots of virtue is mundane.

original: don che ba nyid ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: don che ba nyid ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: The vastness of the roots of virtue is supramundane.

original: tshad med pa nyid ni yongs su smin par byas pa ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa nyid ni yongs su smin par byas pa ste /
translated: The immeasurability of the roots of virtue is the full maturation of sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dge ba yongs su smin par byed pa de ni sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par gyis tshad med pa'i phyir tshad med pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dge ba yongs su smin par byed pa de ni sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par gyis tshad med pa'i phyir tshad med pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas' maturation of virtue is immeasurable because it is immeasurable through the distinctions of its special qualities such as the stages, perfections, powers, and fearlessnesses.

original: zad mi shes pa nyid kyis so zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ni dbang 'byor pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: zad mi shes pa nyid kyis so zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ni dbang 'byor pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: That which was explained as inexhaustibility should be understood as mastery,

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa na yang mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa na yang mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is inexhaustible even in the nirvana without remainder.🔽The essence of going for refuge is the desire for buddhahood, i.e., the vow: May I become a refuge for all beings,

original: sangs rgyas nyid 'dod pas khas len pa ni skyabs su 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni skyabs 'os su khas len pa nyid kyis bdag kyang skyabs 'os su gyur cig / sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi bar🔽bya'o zhes bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid 'dod pas khas len pa ni skyabs su 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni skyabs 'os su khas len pa nyid kyis bdag kyang skyabs 'os su gyur cig / sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi bar🔽bya'o zhes bya ba yin gyi /
translated: and may I pacify all the sufferings of all beings.

original: nyan thos ltar dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song bas 'khor ba las grol bar gyur kyang ci ma rung zhes bdag nyid bskyab pa'i phyir skyabs su 'gro ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos ltar dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song bas 'khor ba las grol bar gyur kyang ci ma rung zhes bdag nyid bskyab pa'i phyir skyabs su 'gro ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that one goes for refuge in order to save oneself, thinking, “How good it would be to be liberated from cyclic existence, like the disciples!”

original: sems can rnams la phan pa dang / bde bar byed ces bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan pa dang / bde bar byed ces bya ba la /
translated: One should benefit and make happy sentient beings.

original: phan pa byed pa ni tshe phyi ma pa'i lha la sogs pa'i bde ba la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: phan pa byed pa ni tshe phyi ma pa'i lha la sogs pa'i bde ba la sbyor ba'o //
translated: One benefits them by establishing them in the happiness of gods and humans in the next life.

original: bde ba byed pa ni mthong ba'i chos kha na la bde ba la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba byed pa ni mthong ba'i chos kha na la bde ba la sbyor ba'o //
translated: One makes them happy by establishing them in the happiness of this life.

original: nges par 'byung bar bya ba la @50b theg pa thams cad kyis ston pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ni ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum ston par byed pas sems can thams cad kyi ston par 'gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
analyzed: nges par 'byung bar bya ba la @50b theg pa thams cad kyis ston pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ni ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum ston par byed pas sems can thams cad kyi ston par 'gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
translated: One is endowed with the quality of being a teacher of all vehicles in the sense of being a teacher of all sentient beings, because one teaches the three vehicles.

original: // brdar btags pa'i skyabs su 'gro ba ni /
analyzed: // brdar btags pa'i skyabs su 'gro ba ni /
translated: The conventional refuge is

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad nas 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad nas 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: that which arises from contact with a spiritual teacher.

original: chos nyid kyis thob pa ni rtogs pa'i dus na ste /
analyzed: chos nyid kyis thob pa ni rtogs pa'i dus na ste /
translated: Attainment by nature is at the time of realization.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rags pa dang / phra ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rags pa dang / phra ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: Therefore, there is a difference in coarseness and subtlety.🔽And in the accomplishment of the aims of others, it is by intention, because of the pervasion by compassion.

original: gzhan gyi don sgrub pa yang bsam pa'i sgo nas ni snying rje khyab pas so zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen pos 'gro ba khyab par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don sgrub pa yang bsam pa'i sgo nas ni snying rje khyab pas so zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen pos 'gro ba khyab par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that great compassion pervades the world.🔽And in the accomplishment of the aims of others, it is by application, because of the expansion of the teaching of the universal vehicle.

original: sbyor ba'i sgo nas ni theg pa chen po'i chos rgyas par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'i rgyud byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can dag la bsnyad pa'i phyir rgyas par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sgo nas ni theg pa chen po'i chos rgyas par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'i rgyud byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can dag la bsnyad pa'i phyir rgyas par byas pa yin te /
translated: This means that it is expanded for those who are to be trained and who belong to the bodhisattva family.

original: rgya bskyed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgya bskyed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “expansion” is “increase.”🔽The universal vehicle is the teaching of the great beings.

original: theg pa chen po ni 'phags pa chen po rnams kyi chos yin no zhes bya ba la 'phags pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni 'phags pa chen po rnams kyi chos yin no zhes bya ba la 'phags pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: “Great beings” means the Buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: nyan thos rnams kyang 'phags pa yin pas de las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir chen po zhes bya ba ni sgrar sbyar ro //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyang 'phags pa yin pas de las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir chen po zhes bya ba ni sgrar sbyar ro //
translated: The word great is added to the word noble in order to distinguish these from the noble listeners.

original: 'phags pa che ba ni 'phags pa chen po ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa che ba ni 'phags pa chen po ste /
translated: The word great is added to the word noble in order to distinguish these from the noble listeners.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The noble great ones are the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: theg pa chen po ni de dag gi chos yin pas /
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni de dag gi chos yin pas /
translated: The great vehicle is their Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi /
translated: It is the great vehicle of the great bodhisattvas,

original: theg pa chen po kho na yin gyi chung ngu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po kho na yin gyi chung ngu ni ma yin no //
translated: not the lesser vehicle.

original: skyabs su 'gro ba'i skabs so /
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba'i skabs so /
translated: This concludes the section on going for refuge.

original: // / skyabs su 'gro ba'i 'og tu rigs kyi skabs yin te /
analyzed: // / skyabs su 'gro ba'i 'og tu rigs kyi skabs yin te /
translated: The section on the spiritual gene comes after the section on going for refuge.

original: 'di'i 'brel ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the connection here?

original: skyabs su 'gro ba 'dir song don chen te //
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba 'dir song don chen te //
translated: This going for refuge has great meaning,

original: de ni tshad med yon tan tshogs 'phel 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni tshad med yon tan tshogs 'phel 'gyur //
translated: for it increases the collection of immeasurable good qualities.

original: 'gro ba 'di la snying rje bsam pas khyab //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di la snying rje bsam pas khyab //
translated: It pervades this world with thoughts of compassion

original: mtshungs med 'phags chen chos kyang rgyas par byed //
analyzed: mtshungs med 'phags chen chos kyang rgyas par byed //
translated: and spreads the Dharma of the unequaled great noble ones.

original: ces bshad ma theg pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni skyabs su 'gro ba don che ba nyid rang dang gzhan gyis don bsgrub pa dag bstan to //🔽rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa de lta bu de ni nges @51a * //
analyzed: ces bshad ma theg pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni skyabs su 'gro ba don che ba nyid rang dang gzhan gyis don bsgrub pa dag bstan to // rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa de lta bu de ni nges @51a * //
translated: This verse, which is not concluded, shows that going for refuge is of great benefit, since it accomplishes the aims of self and other.

original: pa med par sangs rgyas nyid don du gnyer ba thams cad kyi yin nam /
analyzed: pa med par sangs rgyas nyid don du gnyer ba thams cad kyi yin nam /
translated: Is this perfection of the aims of self and other for all who seek Buddhahood without exception?

original: 'on te nges pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te nges pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: Or is there some exception?

original: smras pa / yod do //
analyzed: smras pa / yod do //
translated: It is said: There is an exception.

original: nges pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: nges pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the exception?

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yon tan gyi tshogs 'byor pa dang ldan pa 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs can yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yon tan gyi tshogs 'byor pa dang ldan pa 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs can yin gyi /
translated: This perfection of the aims of others, endowed with the wealth of the aggregate of virtues, is for one who is of the lineage of the Buddhas,

original: gzhan gyi ni ma yin pas de'i phyir skyabs su 'gro ba'i 'og tu rigs kyi skabs yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni ma yin pas de'i phyir skyabs su 'gro ba'i 'og tu rigs kyi skabs yin no //
translated: but not for others. Therefore, after going for refuge, the chapter on the lineages is presented.

original: ma nges pa'i rigs can gyi ni gal te na yin la //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i rigs can gyi ni gal te na yin la //
translated: One who is of the unfixed lineage may or may not attain it.

original: gal te na ma yin pas gdon mi za bar ma smos so //
analyzed: gal te na ma yin pas gdon mi za bar ma smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is not mentioned without exception.

original: sangs rgyas nyid de'i skal ba yod pa na rigs yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid de'i skal ba yod pa na rigs yin te /
translated: The potential is the existence of the fortune for attaining buddhahood.

original: rigs ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon yin no //
analyzed: rigs ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon yin no //
translated: The potential is the seed of all the qualities of a buddha.

original: sa bon med par yang 'bras bu ma mthong ste /
analyzed: sa bon med par yang 'bras bu ma mthong ste /
translated: A result is never seen without a seed.

original: de'i phyir de 'thob pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i don du skyabs su 'gro ba'i 'og tu rigs yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de 'thob pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i don du skyabs su 'gro ba'i 'og tu rigs yin no //
translated: Therefore, after going for refuge, the potential is mentioned in order to indicate the fortune for attaining that result.

original: sems can rnams ni khams sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni khams sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sentient beings are of various natures.

original: khams kyi dbye ba dpag tu med de /
analyzed: khams kyi dbye ba dpag tu med de /
translated: The divisions of natures are immeasurable.

original: ji skad du ba ru ra'i mdo las bshad pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji skad du ba ru ra'i mdo las bshad pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As it is explained in the Varuṣa Sūtra.

original: de las / bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag / dper na ba ru ra'i phung po 'phang du dpag tshad tsam /
analyzed: de las / bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag / dper na ba ru ra'i phung po 'phang du dpag tshad tsam /
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Monks, suppose there were a pile of varuṣa seeds one yojana in height.

original: rgyar yang dpag tshad tsam zhig yod par gyur la ;
analyzed: rgyar yang dpag tshad tsam zhig yod par gyur la ;
translated: It were to be compressed so that it were one yojana in width.

original: ba ru ra'i phung po de las 'ga' zhig gis lo brgya 'das shing ba ru ra re re zhig blangs te /
analyzed: ba ru ra'i phung po de las 'ga' zhig gis lo brgya 'das shing ba ru ra re re zhig blangs te /
translated: Then suppose someone were to take one seed from that pile of varuṣa seeds every hundred years.

original: ba ru ra 'di ni khams che ge mo zhig tu dor ro //
analyzed: ba ru ra 'di ni khams che ge mo zhig tu dor ro //
translated: This varuṣa seed was cast into such and such a realm.

original: ba ru ra 'di ni khams che ge mo zhig tu dor ro zhes de skad zer na /
analyzed: ba ru ra 'di ni khams che ge mo zhig tu dor ro zhes de skad zer na /
translated: If someone were to say, “This myrobalan fruit has been thrown into such and such a region,”

original: ba ru ra'i phung po de ni myur ba kho nar zad pa dang yongs su gtugs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ba ru ra'i phung po de ni myur ba kho nar zad pa dang yongs su gtugs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: the mass of myrobalan fruit would quickly be exhausted and used up,

original: khams ni de ltar yongs su gtugs pa ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: khams ni de ltar yongs su gtugs pa ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: but not so the elements.

original: gsung rab las byung ba'i khams kyi don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gsung rab las byung ba'i khams kyi don gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of element as it occurs in the scriptures?

original: mig la sogs pa'i khams kyi dbye ba bstan pa dang / khams mang po'i mdo dang sbyar na ni /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i khams kyi dbye ba bstan pa dang / khams mang po'i mdo dang sbyar na ni /
translated: If the presentation of the divisions of the elements such as the eye is applied to the Sūtra on the Many Elements,

original: khams kyi dbye ba rnam pa mang po zhig yod do //
analyzed: khams kyi dbye ba rnam pa mang po zhig yod do //
translated: there are many divisions of the elements.

original: rigs kyi skabs 'dir ni rigs sa bon yin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi skabs 'dir ni rigs sa bon yin te /
translated: In this context of lineage, lineage is a seed.

original: khams dang rgyu zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: khams dang rgyu zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so //
translated: Element and cause are synonyms.

original: ji ltar sems can rnams la 'dod chags la sogs pa spyad pa'i bye brag gis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i @51b chos skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba gang yin pa so so rang rang gi rgyud kyi khyad par chos du ma'i nus pa dang ldan pa dag yod pa
analyzed: ji ltar sems can rnams la 'dod chags la sogs pa spyad pa'i bye brag gis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i @51b chos skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba gang yin pa so so rang rang gi rgyud kyi khyad par chos du ma'i nus pa dang ldan pa dag yod pa
translated: Just as there are various potentials in the mindstreams of sentient beings, which are the causes for the arising of phenomena such as attachment,

original: de bzhin du theg pa gsum gyi rigs kyi khyad par yang yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du theg pa gsum gyi rigs kyi khyad par yang yod par 'gyur te /
translated: so too there are different potentials for the three vehicles.

original: rigs tha dad pa med par ni theg pa tha dad par 'os pa ma yin pas theg pa gsum gyi rigs tha dad pa yod do //
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa med par ni theg pa tha dad par 'os pa ma yin pas theg pa gsum gyi rigs tha dad pa yod do //
translated: Since it is not tenable that there are different vehicles without different lineages, there are different lineages for the three vehicles.

original: rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs ni yang dag par bsgrubs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs ni yang dag par bsgrubs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The naturally existing lineage is that which is fully accomplished.

original: skye mched drug gi khyad par thog ma med pa'i dus can gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba can gang yin pa de lta bu yod do //
analyzed: skye mched drug gi khyad par thog ma med pa'i dus can gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba can gang yin pa de lta bu yod do //
translated: There is a special quality of the six sense bases that has existed since beginningless time, which is the good fortune of attaining the complete enlightenment of unsurpassed buddhahood.

original: rang bzhin gyi rigs de lta bu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams gang gi tshe dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par len du bcug pa de'i tshe rigs de yang dag par bsgrubs pa🔽zhes bya'o // rang bzhin du gnas pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag par bsgrub pa'i rten du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi rigs de lta bu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams gang gi tshe dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par len du bcug pa de'i tshe rigs de yang dag par bsgrubs pa zhes bya'o // rang bzhin du gnas pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag par bsgrub pa'i rten du gyur pa yin no //
translated: At that time, the spiritual gene is developed.🔽The natural spiritual gene is the basis of the developed spiritual gene.

original: yang dag par bsgrubs pa ni rten pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrubs pa ni rten pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: The developed spiritual gene is the essence of the basis.

original: de ni rgyu'i dngos por yod do //
analyzed: de ni rgyu'i dngos por yod do //
translated: It exists as a cause,🔽but not as an effect.

original: 'bras bu'i dngos por med do zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi rigs de'i 'bras bu ni yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dngos por med do zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi rigs de'i 'bras bu ni yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs yin no //
translated: The effect of the natural spiritual gene is the developed spiritual gene.

original: de'i phyir de ni rgyu'i dngos por yod la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni rgyu'i dngos por yod la /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the natural spiritual gene exists as a cause,

original: 'bras bu'i dngos por med ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dngos por med ces bya ste /
translated: but not as an effect.

original: rgyur gyur pa'i rigs de ni nam yang 'bras bur 'gyur ba 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa'i rigs de ni nam yang 'bras bur 'gyur ba 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: The spiritual gene that is a cause is never fit to be an effect.

original: 'di ltar de dag la brten nas 'bras bur gyur pa stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa yon tan thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la brten nas 'bras bur gyur pa stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa yon tan thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, all the qualities of the results, such as the powers and the fearlessnesses, are accomplished in dependence on them.

original: rigs nges pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs su nges par gnas pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rigs nges pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs su nges par gnas pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The fixed potential is that which is fixed in the potentials of the sravaka, pratyekabuddha, and buddha.

original: nyan thos nyid thob par nges pa'i rigs gang yin pa de ni nam yang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas nyid 'thob pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos nyid thob par nges pa'i rigs gang yin pa de ni nam yang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas nyid 'thob pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The potential that is fixed as the sravaka will never become the cause of the pratyekabuddha or buddha.

original: de bzhin du rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs dag kyang sbyar bar bya'o //🔽ma nges pa'i rkyen gyi @52a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs dag kyang sbyar bar bya'o // ma nges pa'i rkyen gyi @52a * //
translated: The same should be applied to the pratyekabuddha and buddha potentials.

original: dbang gis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs rnams kyi rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang gis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs rnams kyi rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: The unfixed potential becomes the cause of the sravaka, pratyekabuddha, and buddha potentials through the power of conditions.

original: dper na ri'i phyogs gang dag las gdon mi za bar gser 'ba' zhig 'byung gi //
analyzed: dper na ri'i phyogs gang dag las gdon mi za bar gser 'ba' zhig 'byung gi //
translated: For example, from whatever side of a mountain one approaches it, one will certainly find only gold.

original: dngul 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: dngul 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin la /
translated: One will not find silver.

original: zangs 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin pa de lta bu yang yod la /
analyzed: zangs 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin pa de lta bu yang yod la /
translated: There are also those that are not just copper.

original: phyogs gang zhig 'jim gong dril ba la sogs pa'i bcos legs bya ba'i dbang gis gdon mi za bar res 'ga' gser 'byung la /
analyzed: phyogs gang zhig 'jim gong dril ba la sogs pa'i bcos legs bya ba'i dbang gis gdon mi za bar res 'ga' gser 'byung la /
translated: In some places, due to the power of good preparation, such as kneading clay, gold is produced without doubt,

original: res 'ga' dngul la sogs pa 'byung bar yang yod pa de lta bu'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' dngul la sogs pa 'byung bar yang yod pa de lta bu'o //
translated: and in some places silver and so on are produced.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rigs nges pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rigs nges pa ni /
translated: For that very reason, those of definite lineage

original: rkyen rnams kyis mi 'phrogs la ma nges pa ni 'phrogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rkyen rnams kyis mi 'phrogs la ma nges pa ni 'phrogs pa yin no //
translated: are not carried away by conditions, while those of indefinite lineage are carried away.

original: yo byad kyis phongs pa zhes bya ba ni dbul na sbyin pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la mi 'jug go //
analyzed: yo byad kyis phongs pa zhes bya ba ni dbul na sbyin pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la mi 'jug go //
translated: Lacking resources means that if one is poor, one does not engage in the bodhisattva conduct such as generosity.

original: gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa ni bran la sogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa ni bran la sogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Being under the control of others means being a slave and so on.

original: der skyes pa'i sems can rnams zhes bya ba ni ngan song du skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: der skyes pa'i sems can rnams zhes bya ba ni ngan song du skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Beings born there means those born in the lower realms.

original: 'od gsal ba dang dri ma med pa'i gnas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba dang dri ma med pa'i gnas su 'gyur la /
translated: The luminous and stainless abodes

original: 'od gsal ba ni gsal ba la bya'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ni gsal ba la bya'o //
translated: means the luminous is to be understood as clear.

original: la la ni dri ma cung zad chags kyang 'od gsal bas gang la dri ma cung zad kyang chags pa med pa de ni dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: la la ni dri ma cung zad chags kyang 'od gsal bas gang la dri ma cung zad kyang chags pa med pa de ni dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Some are slightly tainted but clear, and some are not tainted at all.

original: yang na gser 'od gsal ba kha cig bsregs na kha dog ngan par 'gyur bas gang la bsregs kyang kha dog ngan par 'gyur ba med pa de ni dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //🔽nyon mongs pa'i dri ma med pa 'thob pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni rigs de nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len dang bral zhing mi ldan pa thob pa'i gnas yin pa'am /
analyzed: yang na gser 'od gsal ba kha cig bsregs na kha dog ngan par 'gyur bas gang la bsregs kyang kha dog ngan par 'gyur ba med pa de ni dri ma med pa zhes bya'o // nyon mongs pa'i dri ma med pa 'thob pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni rigs de nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len dang bral zhing mi ldan pa thob pa'i gnas yin pa'am /
translated: Or, some gold is clear but becomes discolored when heated, and some is not discolored when heated.

original: yang na rigs de nyon mongs pa spangs na zag pa med pa'i chos dri ma med pa rnams kyis 'thob pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi gnas yin pas na nyon mongs pa'i dri ma med pa 'thob pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rigs de nyon mongs pa spangs na zag pa med pa'i chos dri ma med pa rnams kyis 'thob pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi gnas yin pas na nyon mongs pa'i dri ma med pa 'thob pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: The basis for the attainment of the stainlessness of the afflictions means that this gotra is the basis for attaining the separation from the negative conditioning of the afflictions, or it is the basis for the attainment of the stainlessness of the uncontaminated dharmas when the afflictions are abandoned.🔽Thus, it is called the basis for the attainment of the stainlessness of the afflictions.

original: byang chub chen po'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'i gnas skabs byang chub chen po ni rin po che dri ma med pa lta bu yin te /
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'i gnas skabs byang chub chen po ni rin po che dri ma med pa lta bu yin te /
translated: Great enlightenment is the ultimate stage, like a stainless jewel.

original: de ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mjug thogs su 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mjug thogs su 'byung ba yin no //
translated: It arises immediately after the vajra like concentration.

original: ye shes @52b shes chen po ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes @52b shes chen po ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes la sogs pa'o //
translated: Great intuition is the intuition of accomplishing activities, etc.🔽In this matter, it is explained that one who is not of the spiritual lineage and who abides in the non-transcendence of suffering is without the lineage.

original: don 'di la ni rigs med pa la gnas pa yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can yin par bshad do zhes bya ba na med pa zhes bya ba 'di la lar ni smad pa la mthong ste /
analyzed: don 'di la ni rigs med pa la gnas pa yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can yin par bshad do zhes bya ba na med pa zhes bya ba 'di la lar ni smad pa la mthong ste /
translated: In some cases, the term “without” is seen to mean contemptible,

original: chung ma ngan pa la chung ma med do zhes bya ba dang ; bu ngan pa la bu med do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: chung ma ngan pa la chung ma med do zhes bya ba dang ; bu ngan pa la bu med do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: as in “a bad wife is not a wife” and “a bad son is not a son.”

original: la lar ni cung zad yod pa'i don la ste /
analyzed: la lar ni cung zad yod pa'i don la ste /
translated: In some cases, it means a little bit,

original: bu mo lto med ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bu mo lto med ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: as in “a girl without a womb.”

original: la lar ni med pa la mthong ste /
analyzed: la lar ni med pa la mthong ste /
translated: In some cases, it means non-existence,🔽as in “the non-existence of a self.”

original: rnyed pa med ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa med ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: “There is no lineage” means that there is no lineage.

original: med ces bya ba 'di ni smad pa dang med pa la blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: med ces bya ba 'di ni smad pa dang med pa la blta bar bya ste /
translated: “There is no lineage” should be understood as a deprecation of non-existence.

original: la la gcig tu nyes par spyod nges yod //
analyzed: la la gcig tu nyes par spyod nges yod //
translated: Some are definitely destined for error.

original: ces bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: This is from the beginning up to

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dman pa yod pa tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dman pa yod pa tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni /
translated: “there is a low root of virtue, but the collection is incomplete.”

original: de'i dus su yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i phyir rig med par bshad pa yin pas med pa zhes bya ba 'di ni smad pa la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dus su yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i phyir rig med par bshad pa yin pas med pa zhes bya ba 'di ni smad pa la blta bar bya'o //
translated: This is explained as “no lineage” because of not attaining final nirvāṇa at that time. Therefore, “no lineage” should be understood as a deprecation of non-existence.

original: la la gcig tu nyes par spyod nges yod //
analyzed: la la gcig tu nyes par spyod nges yod //
translated: Some are definitely destined for error.

original: ces bya ba ni las byed par nges pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni las byed par nges pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is explained from the perspective of those who are definitely destined to perform karma.

original: gcig tu las byed par nges pa gang gis gdon mi za bar ma la sogs pa gsod par 'gyur ba de ni /
analyzed: gcig tu las byed par nges pa gang gis gdon mi za bar ma la sogs pa gsod par 'gyur ba de ni /
translated: Those who are definitely destined to perform karma are those who will definitely kill their mother and so on.

original: gnas skabs de na rigs yod du zin kyang ma la sogs pa bsad pa'i las smad pas rigs med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs de na rigs yod du zin kyang ma la sogs pa bsad pa'i las smad pas rigs med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Even though they have the lineage at that time, they are said to have no lineage because of the deprecation of the karma of killing their mother and so on.

original: dkar po'i chos kun tu bcom pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i chos kun tu bcom pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied in the appropriate manner to the destruction of all good qualities.

original: rgyu dang bral ba'i yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can zhes bya ba'i med pa zhes bya ba 'di ni med pa la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang bral ba'i yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can zhes bya ba'i med pa zhes bya ba 'di ni med pa la blta bar bya'o //
translated: The non-existence of the non-transmigration of those who are devoid of the cause should be understood as a non-existence.

original: zab cing rgya che ba'i don mi shes pa bzhin du mos pa rgya chen po 'byung zhes bya ba ni sgra tsam thos pa kho nas mos kyi /
analyzed: zab cing rgya che ba'i don mi shes pa bzhin du mos pa rgya chen po 'byung zhes bya ba ni sgra tsam thos pa kho nas mos kyi /
translated: The arising of vast aspiration without understanding the meaning of the profound and the vast is the aspiration that arises merely from hearing the words,

original: don yongs su shes pa las ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: don yongs su shes pa las ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: and not from understanding the meaning.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyi mchog ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos kyi phun sum tshogs pa bas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa mchog dang / phul dang / rab dang / rab mchog yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyi mchog ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos kyi phun sum tshogs pa bas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa mchog dang / phul dang / rab dang / rab mchog yin no //
translated: The highest of the two is the excellence of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, which is the highest, the best, the most excellent, and the most sublime, in comparison with the excellence of the mundane and the Sravakas.

original: byang chub gang la yon tan shin tu rgya chen po yod pa de ni yon tan shin tu rgya che ba'i byang chub bo //🔽yon tan @53a * //🔽shin tu rgya che ba'i byang chub nyid shing yin pas na /
analyzed: byang chub gang la yon tan shin tu rgya chen po yod pa de ni yon tan shin tu rgya che ba'i byang chub bo // yon tan @53a * // shin tu rgya che ba'i byang chub nyid shing yin pas na /
translated: That enlightenment which has very extensive qualities is the enlightenment of very extensive qualities.🔽The enlightenment of very extensive qualities is a tree,

original: yon tan shin tu rgya che byang chub shing ngo //
analyzed: yon tan shin tu rgya che byang chub shing ngo //
translated: therefore it is the tree of the enlightenment of very extensive qualities.

original: yang na byang chub nyid shing yin pas byang chub shing ngo //
analyzed: yang na byang chub nyid shing yin pas byang chub shing ngo //
translated: Or else, enlightenment itself is a tree, therefore it is the tree of enlightenment.

original: yon tan shin tu rgya che ba rnams kyi byang chub kyi shing yin pas na yon tan shin tu rgya che byang chub kyi shing ngo //
analyzed: yon tan shin tu rgya che ba rnams kyi byang chub kyi shing yin pas na yon tan shin tu rgya che byang chub kyi shing ngo //
