translated: It is the tree of enlightenment of those who have very extensive qualities, therefore it is the tree of the enlightenment of very extensive qualities.

original: de bskyed pa ni yon tan shin tu rgya che ba byang chub kyi shing bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de bskyed pa ni yon tan shin tu rgya che ba byang chub kyi shing bskyed pa'o //
translated: It is generated, therefore it is the generation of the tree of the enlightenment of very extensive qualities.

original: de'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i phyir te /
translated: For that reason,

original: yon tan shin tu rgya che byang chub shing bskyed phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan shin tu rgya che byang chub shing bskyed phyir ro //
translated: because it generates the tree of the enlightenment of very extensive qualities.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'og nas rigs de rtsa ba yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'og nas rigs de rtsa ba yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the lineage, as will be explained below.

analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal chen po zhi ba thob bya'i phyir //
translated: For the sake of attaining the great peace of happiness and suffering,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir go rims ji lta ba bzhin blta bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir go rims ji lta ba bzhin blta bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: This is not to be understood in the order given in the verse.

analyzed: 'on kyang de ni bde ba chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal chen po zhi bar bya ba'i phyir rtsa ba yin no //
translated: Rather, it is the root of the attainment of great bliss and the pacification of great suffering.

original: de lta bas na rigs 'di byang chub kyi shing de lta bu'i rtsa ba yin pa dang / rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pas /
analyzed: de lta bas na rigs 'di byang chub kyi shing de lta bu'i rtsa ba yin pa dang / rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pas /

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan bde byed pa 'bras bu zhes bshad de /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan bde byed pa 'bras bu zhes bshad de /
translated: It is the cause of the benefit and happiness of self and other, and is therefore called the fruit.

original: yon tan shin tu rgya che byang chub shing bskyed phyir //
analyzed: yon tan shin tu rgya che byang chub shing bskyed phyir //
translated: It is the cause of the generation of the tree of enlightenment, which has vast good qualities.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi don to //
translated: This is the benefit for oneself.

original: gzhan ni gzhan gyi don to //🔽rigs kyi skabs so /🔽// / rigs kyi 'og tu sems bskyed pa'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan gyi don to // rigs kyi skabs so / // / rigs kyi 'og tu sems bskyed pa'i skabs yin te /

original: 'di'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /

analyzed: yon tan shin tu rgya che byang chub shing bskyed phyir //

original: phun sum tshogs pa de lta bu de ni skye bo phal po ches longs spyod par yang 'gyur bas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' la rang bzhin gyi rigs la gnas pa yod na gnyis 'grub par 'gyur🔽ro // gnyis 'grub pa de yang sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i rim @53b gyis 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa de lta bu de ni skye bo phal po ches longs spyod par yang 'gyur bas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' la rang bzhin gyi rigs la gnas pa yod na gnyis 'grub par 'gyur🔽ro // gnyis 'grub pa de yang sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i rim @53b gyis 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: The root of the Great Vehicle is the spiritual gene, because it is the cause of the great enlightenment and of the great evolutionary development of beings.🔽The root

original: byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa la sogs pa yang rigs yod na 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa la sogs pa yang rigs yod na 'gyur te /
translated: Also, the generation of the thought of enlightenment, etc., occurs if the lineage exists.

original: gang la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yod pa de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed par byed pas de'i phyir rigs kyi 'og tu sems bskyed pa'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: gang la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yod pa de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed par byed pas de'i phyir rigs kyi 'og tu sems bskyed pa'i skabs yin no //
translated: The generation of the thought of enlightenment occurs in one who has the bodhisattva lineage, and therefore, after the lineage, the occasion of the generation of the thought is appropriate.

original: yang na sems bskyed pa ni don du gnyer ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na sems bskyed pa ni don du gnyer ba yin no //
translated: Or, the generation of the thought is the pursuit.

original: gang zhig don du gnyer zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig don du gnyer zhe na /
translated: What is pursued?

original: byang chub chen po ste /
analyzed: byang chub chen po ste /
translated: Great enlightenment.

original: sems can gyi don byed par 'dod pa ni des de'i thabs su 'gyur ba byang chub chen po 'dod la /
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed par 'dod pa ni des de'i thabs su 'gyur ba byang chub chen po 'dod la /
translated: One who desires to benefit sentient beings desires great enlightenment, since that is the means for that.

original: rigs kyi stobs kyis sems bskyed pa yang mi zlogs  pa'i chos can du 'gyur bas don 'di yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir rigs kyi 'og tu sems bskyed pa'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi stobs kyis sems bskyed pa yang mi zlogs  pa'i chos can du 'gyur bas don 'di yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir rigs kyi 'og tu sems bskyed pa'i skabs yin no //
translated: And the generation of the thought by the power of the lineage is the quality of being irreversible. In order to demonstrate this point, after the lineage, the occasion of the generation of the thought is appropriate.

original: sems 'byung ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems 'byung ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The arising of the thought is the generation of the thought.

original: 'byung ba dang bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni don tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni don tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: The terms “arising” and “generation” are not different in meaning.

original: sems pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems bskyed pa ste /🔽sems pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems bskyed pa ste / sems pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The generation of the mind that has the nature of intention.

original: sems bskyed pa rnam par gtan la dbab pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa rnam par gtan la dbab pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The generation of the mind that has the nature of intention.🔽The Determination of the Generation of the Mind

original: sems bskyed pa dri ba sngon du btang ba'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa la sems bskyed pa rnam par gtan la dbab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa dri ba sngon du btang ba'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa la sems bskyed pa rnam par gtan la dbab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The determination of the generation of the mind is the determination that precedes the question, “What is the generation of the mind?”

original: dri ba sngon du btang ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dri ba sngon du btang ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the question that precedes it?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa rnam pa bzhi pa 'di'i rtsa ba ni gang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa rnam pa bzhi pa 'di'i rtsa ba ni gang /
translated: “What is the root of the four types of generation of the mind of the bodhisattvas?

original: bsam pa ni gang /
analyzed: bsam pa ni gang /
translated: What is their aim?

original: mos pa ni gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mos pa ni gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: What is their devotion?”

original: snying rje chen po ni sems bskyed pa'i rtsa ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snying rje chen po ni sems bskyed pa'i rtsa ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Great compassion is the root of the generation of the mind.

original: de ni 'gro ba 'khyud de 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'gro ba 'khyud de 'dug pa yin no //
translated: It is the one who embraces the world and remains.

original: gal te snying rje chen po rtsa ba yin par ma gyur na /
analyzed: gal te snying rje chen po rtsa ba yin par ma gyur na /
translated: If great compassion were not the root,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams nam yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams nam yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Bodhisattvas would never generate the thought of unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: sems can la mi lta bas nyan thos dag bzhin du mya ngan ldas 'das pa la gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can la mi lta bas nyan thos dag bzhin du mya ngan ldas 'das pa la gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they do not consider sentient beings, they would be intent on nirvana like the Sravakas.

original: so so rang gi sa la sbyor bas gang zhig sa gang la zhugs pa'i sa de ni de'i mthar thug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa dang sa la sbyor ba nas bzung ste bsgom pa mthar thug par 'gro ba'i phyir mthar thug pa zhes bya ste
analyzed: so so rang gi sa la sbyor bas gang zhig sa gang la zhugs pa'i sa de ni de'i mthar thug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa dang sa la sbyor ba nas bzung ste bsgom pa mthar thug par 'gro ba'i phyir mthar thug pa zhes bya ste
translated: The ultimate of each stage is the stage on which one has entered, because one has taken up the practice of that stage and one has gone to the ultimate of meditation.

original: / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa sems pa'i khyad par gyi mthar thug pa ni sa yin par brjod do //
analyzed: / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa sems pa'i khyad par gyi mthar thug pa ni sa yin par brjod do //
translated: The ultimate of the special volition associated with that is called a stage.

original: yang dag par @54a * //
analyzed: yang dag par @54a * //
translated: The generation of the thought of enlightenment that arises from pure giving is the generation of the thought of enlightenment that arises from the power of the perfections.

original: blangs pa brda las byung ba'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pas smras pa bzlas pa'i tshul gyis mnos pa'o //
analyzed: blangs pa brda las byung ba'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pas smras pa bzlas pa'i tshul gyis mnos pa'o //
translated: The generation of the thought of enlightenment that arises from verbal expression is the generation of the thought of enlightenment that is taken up by the method of repeating the words of a spiritual friend and so on.

original: sangs rgyas nyid la sems mnyam pa nyid ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid la sems mnyam pa nyid ni /
translated: The equality of mind with regard to buddhahood

original: de'i chos kyi dbyings dang bdag dbyer med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni chos kyi sku dang tha mi dad pa thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i chos kyi dbyings dang bdag dbyer med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni chos kyi sku dang tha mi dad pa thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: is because of realizing that its dharmadhatu is undifferentiated from one's own. This means that one attains nondifferentiation with regard to the dharmakaya.

original: ji skad du sa dang po la bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi sa dang nye bar gyur to zhes 'byung ba lta bu yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du sa dang po la bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi sa dang nye bar gyur to zhes 'byung ba lta bu yin te /
translated: As it is said, “On the first stage, one thinks, ‘I am close to the buddha stage.’ ”

original: nye ba nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir tha mi dad par mos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye ba nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir tha mi dad par mos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of realizing closeness, one becomes convinced of nondifferentiation.

original: sangs rgyas nyid mchog ces smos pas ni rang sangs rgyas bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid mchog ces smos pas ni rang sangs rgyas bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of “the supremacy of buddhahood” is to exclude the pratyekabuddha.

original: de la skye ba ni sa bon dang / ma dang / mngal dang / ma ma'i bye brag las rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la skye ba ni sa bon dang / ma dang / mngal dang / ma ma'i bye brag las rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therein, birth should be understood from the point of view of seed, mother, womb, and nurse.

original: de la zhes bya ba'i bdun pa ni dmigs kyis dbye ba'i don yin te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba'i bdun pa ni dmigs kyis dbye ba'i don yin te /
translated: Therein is a seventh case, meaning a specification.

original: skye ba rgya che ba la sogs pa don drug sngar bstan pa de dag las skye ba bkar te sa bon la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du ston to //
analyzed: skye ba rgya che ba la sogs pa don drug sngar bstan pa de dag las skye ba bkar te sa bon la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du ston to //
translated: The six topics taught above, beginning with the extensive generation, are taught in particular by the distinctions of seed and so on, with generation being singled out.🔽Faith in the Dharma is the seed.

original: chos la mos pa sa bon dang // zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa chen po gang yin pa de ni sa bon no //
analyzed: chos la mos pa sa bon dang // zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa chen po gang yin pa de ni sa bon no //
translated: The great faith in the Mahayana Dharma is the seed.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The supreme perfection is the perfection of wisdom.

original: bsam gtan las byung bde ba mngal //
analyzed: bsam gtan las byung bde ba mngal //
translated: The womb is the bliss arisen from concentration.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnas pas gnas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnas pas gnas bstan pa yin te /
translated: This teaches the womb as the abode.

original: mngal gyi gnas ni bsam gtan dag yin no //
analyzed: mngal gyi gnas ni bsam gtan dag yin no //
translated: The womb is the concentrations.

original: rgya chen po ni smon lam chen po bcu mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgya chen po ni smon lam chen po bcu mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Extensive refers to the accomplishment of the ten great aspirations.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa sa bcu pa las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa sa bcu pa las 'di lta ste /
translated: As the noble Dasabhumika Sutra teaches,

original: sangs rgyas ma lus pa las mchod pa dang / rim gro lhag ma med pa mtha' dag bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ma lus pa las mchod pa dang / rim gro lhag ma med pa mtha' dag bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to make offerings and services to all the buddhas without exception,

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa /
translated: It is endowed with the most excellent of all aspects.

original: mos pa rgya chen pos rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: mos pa rgya chen pos rnam par dag pa /
translated: It is purified by vast devotion.

original: chos kyi dbyings ltar rgya che ba /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ltar rgya che ba /
translated: It is as vast as the realm of phenomena.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa /
translated: It extends to the end of the realm of space.

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa /
translated: It reaches the end of the future.

original: bskal pa grangs med par sangs rgyas 'byung ba /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med par sangs rgyas 'byung ba /
translated: It is the appearance of the buddhas for countless eons.🔽It is the uninterrupted aspiration to make offerings and to render great service to all the buddhas.

original: bgrangs pa thams cad la mchod pa dang / rim gro chen po bya ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i smon lam dang po mngon par bsgrub po zhes gsungs @54b pa lta bu yin te /
analyzed: bgrangs pa thams cad la mchod pa dang / rim gro chen po bya ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i smon lam dang po mngon par bsgrub po zhes gsungs @54b pa lta bu yin te /
translated: This is the first aspiration that he accomplishes.

original: sa dang po la de lta bu la sogs pa smon lam bcu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa dang po la de lta bu la sogs pa smon lam bcu 'byung ngo //
translated: Such are the ten aspirations that occur on the first stage.🔽Purity of attitude is due to the knowledge that enlightenment is near.

original: bsam pa dag pa ni byang chub dang nye bar shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sa dang po rtogs pa'i dus na bsam pa dag pa thob ste /
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa ni byang chub dang nye bar shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sa dang po rtogs pa'i dus na bsam pa dag pa thob ste /
translated: When the first stage is realized, purity of attitude is attained.

original: de thob pas de 'di snyam du bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi sa dang nye bar gyur to snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de thob pas de 'di snyam du bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi sa dang nye bar gyur to snyam du sems so //
translated: Having attained it, one thinks, “I am near to the stage of the buddhas.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa dang po ni sa dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa dang po ni sa dang mtshungs te /
translated: The first generation of the thought of enlightenment of the bodhisattvas is like the earth,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang / de'i tshogs 'phel ba'i rten du gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang / de'i tshogs 'phel ba'i rten du gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because it is the support for the increase of all the qualities of the Buddha and their accumulations.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi sa la mchog tu mthar phyin par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi sa la mchog tu mthar phyin par gyur pa yin te /
translated: The qualities of the Buddha are the supreme culmination on the Buddha ground,

original: de dag dang de dag gi tshogs rnams thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dang de dag gi tshogs rnams thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are obtained through the acquisition of their accumulations.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i sa la sems skyed par byed pa'i sems bskyed pa de ni rten du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i sa la sems skyed par byed pa'i sems bskyed pa de ni rten du gyur pa yin te /
translated: Thus, when the bodhisattva generates the thought of enlightenment on the stage of action through faith, that generation of the thought is the support,

original: gang gi phyir sa la brten nas rtsva dang / gel ba dang / sman dang / nags tshal dag bzhin du de la brten nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang de dag gi tshogs rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir sems bskyed pa dang po ni sa dang mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa la brten nas rtsva dang / gel ba dang / sman dang / nags tshal dag bzhin du de la brten nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang de dag gi tshogs rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir sems bskyed pa dang po ni sa dang mtshungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the qualities of the Buddha and their accumulations are perfected in dependence on it, just as grass, bushes, herbs, and forests are perfected in dependence on the earth, therefore the first production of the thought is called “like the earth.”

original: phan pa'i bsam pa ni gang gis tshe rabs gzhan du yang phan pa dang sprod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: phan pa'i bsam pa ni gang gis tshe rabs gzhan du yang phan pa dang sprod par byed pa'o //
translated: The intention of benefit is that by which one provides benefit in other lives.

original: bde ba'i bsam pa ni gang gis tshe 'di kho na la bde ba dang sprod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i bsam pa ni gang gis tshe 'di kho na la bde ba dang sprod par byed pa'o //
translated: The intention of happiness is that by which one provides happiness in this very life.

original: gser bzang po dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: gser bzang po dang 'dra ste /
translated: It is like good gold,

original: 'gyur ba mi rten pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gser bzang po bsregs pa dang / bcad pa dang / bdar ba la sogs pas brtags na 'gyur ba mi brten pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa can yang gnas skabs thams cad du 'gyur ba mi rten to //
analyzed: 'gyur ba mi rten pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gser bzang po bsregs pa dang / bcad pa dang / bdar ba la sogs pas brtags na 'gyur ba mi brten pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa can yang gnas skabs thams cad du 'gyur ba mi rten to //
translated: Because it is not dependent on change. Just as good gold, when tested by burning, cutting, and rubbing, is not dependent on change, so also the bodhisattva’s generation of the will to be charitable and helpful in all situations is not dependent on change.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa ni gter chen po bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar med dag las dung la sogs pa gter chen po bzhi 'byung ba de dag ni byin te bor yang zad par mi 'gyur zhing 'jig rten
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa ni gter chen po bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar med dag las dung la sogs pa gter chen po bzhi 'byung ba de dag ni byin te bor yang zad par mi 'gyur zhing 'jig rten
translated: The generation of the will endowed with the perfection of giving is like a great treasure. Just as from the four great treasures of conch shells, etc., in the ocean, when they are opened and used, there is no end to the supply, and they satisfy the whole world

original: yang tshim par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: yang tshim par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: with their wealth,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang chos dang zang zing la sogs pa'i longs spyod kyis sems can dpag tu med pa tshim par byed cing sbyin pa de @55a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang chos dang zang zing la sogs pa'i longs spyod kyis sems can dpag tu med pa tshim par byed cing sbyin pa de @55a * //
translated: so also the bodhisattvas, with their enjoyments of Dharma, material goods, etc., satisfy countless beings, and that giving of theirs

original: yang phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su zad par yang mi 'gyur bas mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su zad par yang mi 'gyur bas mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is also called “inexhaustible” because it does not come to an end in the realm of nirvāṇa without residual conditioning.

original: mi shigs pa nyid kyis sra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni le los mi shigs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mi shigs pa nyid kyis sra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni le los mi shigs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: It is “hard” because it is indestructible, that is, it cannot be destroyed by laziness.

original: sman gyi rgyal po lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sman gyi rgyal po lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is like the king of medicines.

original: ji ltar sman gyi rgyal po mthong ba na /
analyzed: ji ltar sman gyi rgyal po mthong ba na /
translated: Just as the king of medicines, when seen,

original: bsnams pa dang / myangs pa dang / reg pa la sogs pas nad thams cad nye bar zhi bar byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bsnams pa dang / myangs pa dang / reg pa la sogs pas nad thams cad nye bar zhi bar byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: smelled, tasted, or touched, alleviates all illnesses,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa yang mnyen pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pas rnam par sun 'byin pa dang / rnam par gnon pa dang spong pa la sogs pas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa yang mnyen pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pas rnam par sun 'byin pa dang / rnam par gnon pa dang spong pa la sogs pas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: in the same way, the generation of the mind endowed with the perfection of wisdom, by being gentle, by being intended, by being cultivated, and so on, by being a remedy, by being a counteragent, by being abandoned, and so on,

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pas /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pas /
translated: completely alleviates all the illnesses of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: sman gyi rgyal po lta bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sman gyi rgyal po lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “like the king of medicines.”

original: tshad med pa dang ldan pa ni mdza' bo chen po dang 'dra zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshad med pa dang ldan pa ni mdza' bo chen po dang 'dra zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one possessing the immeasurables is like a great friend.

original: byams pa dang ldan /
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan /
translated: He is endowed with love,

original: snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms ngag gnas skabs thams cad du sems can 'ga' yang yal bar 'dor bar mi 'gyur te /🔽bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms ngag gnas skabs thams cad du sems can 'ga' yang yal bar 'dor bar mi 'gyur te / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: compassion, joy, and equanimity. He never abandons any sentient being in any situation.🔽Because he takes as his object all situations, whether of happiness,

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs thams cad du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs thams cad du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: suffering, or neither,

original: ston pa dang ldan pa ni rgyal po chen po lta bu ste /
analyzed: ston pa dang ldan pa ni rgyal po chen po lta bu ste /
translated: The one possessing teaching is like a great king,

original: chud mi za ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /🔽dper na rgyal po rang gi rigs su gtogs pa la /
analyzed: chud mi za ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni / dper na rgyal po rang gi rigs su gtogs pa la /
translated: because he is the cause of non-loss.

original: bsnyen bkur legs pa nyid dang legs pa nyid ma yin par byed pa dag go //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur legs pa nyid dang legs pa nyid ma yin par byed pa dag go //
translated: For example, a king is the cause of the good and bad treatment of those who belong to his own class.

original: rim bzhin du chud mi za ba dang chud za ba'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du //
analyzed: rim bzhin du chud mi za ba dang chud za ba'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du //
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva is the cause of the non-loss and loss of the Dharma of disciples.

original: rton pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa yang chud za ba'i rgyu dang chud mi za ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rton pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa yang chud za ba'i rgyu dang chud mi za ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The generation of the Thought endowed with reliance is the cause of not wasting and the cause of not wasting.

original: ji ltar na chud za ba'i rgyu yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na chud za ba'i rgyu yin /
translated: How is it the cause of wasting?

original: ji ltar na chud mi za ba'i rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na chud mi za ba'i rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the cause of not wasting?

original: gal te gang zag dang / tshig 'bru dang / drang ba'i don gyi mdo dang / rnam par shes pa la rton par gyur na chud za ba'i rgyu yin no //🔽bzlog na chud mi za ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas chud mi za ba'i rgyu zhes bya'o //🔽zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa ni theg pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe sems @55b pa'i khyad par zung du 'brel bar 'byung bas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa yin pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' 'dis sems can gyi
analyzed: gal te gang zag dang / tshig 'bru dang / drang ba'i don gyi mdo dang / rnam par shes pa la rton par gyur na chud za ba'i rgyu yin no // bzlog na chud mi za ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas chud mi za ba'i rgyu zhes bya'o // zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa ni theg pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe sems @55b pa'i khyad par zung du 'brel bar 'byung bas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa yin pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' 'dis sems can gyi
translated: If one relies on the person, the letter, the Sūtras of interpretable meaning, and consciousness, it is the cause of wasting.🔽If one relies on the Dharma, the spirit, the Sūtras of definitive meaning, and wisdom, it is the cause of not wasting.

original: khur bde blag tu khyer ba de bas na theg pa lta bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khur bde blag tu khyer ba de bas na theg pa lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: Endowed with calm and insight is like a vehicle. When one is endowed with calm and insight because of the occurrence of the union of the two special mental states, then this Bodhisattva easily carries the burden of sentient beings. Therefore it is like a vehicle.

original: gzungs dang spobs pa dang ldan pa ni bkod ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: gzungs dang spobs pa dang ldan pa ni bkod ma lta bu ste /
translated: Endowed with retention and eloquence is like a fountain.🔽Like a fountain, it retains the water and pours it out inexhaustibly.🔽Similarly, retention retains the Dharma and its meaning that has been heard and pours it out inexhaustibly.

original: chu 'dzin cing mi zad par 'byin pa dang / chos mthun par thos pa dang / ma thos pa'i chos dang / don 'dzin cing mi zad par 'byin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzungs kyi stobs kyis thos pa'i chos dang don 'dzin par byed la spobs pa'i stobs kyis ma thos pa'i chos dang don 'dzin par byed pas na bkod ma lta bu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chu 'dzin cing mi zad par 'byin pa dang / chos mthun par thos pa dang / ma thos pa'i chos dang / don 'dzin cing mi zad par 'byin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzungs kyi stobs kyis thos pa'i chos dang don 'dzin par byed la spobs pa'i stobs kyis ma thos pa'i chos dang don 'dzin par byed pas na bkod ma lta bu zhes bya ste /
translated: Eloquence retains the Dharma and its meaning that has not been heard and pours it out inexhaustibly.

original: stod phyogs na chu'i dong dag la bkod ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stod phyogs na chu'i dong dag la bkod ma zhes bya'o //
translated: In the north country, a fountain is called a “water-holder.”

original: chos bshad pa dang ldan pa ni kun dga' ba'i sgra dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: chos bshad pa dang ldan pa ni kun dga' ba'i sgra dang 'dra ste /
translated: Endowed with the explanation of the Dharma is like a pleasant sound.🔽It makes the disciples who desire liberation hear what is pleasant.

original: thar pa 'dod pa'i gdul ba rnams la snyan pa thos par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa'i gdul ba rnams la snyan pa thos par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: All conditioned things are impermanent.

original: sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: All conditioned things are suffering.

original: bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa'o //
translated: All dharmas are without self.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba thos nas thar pa 'dod pa rnams bdud rtsis tshim par 'gyur ba dang 'dra bas kun dga' ba'i sgra dang 'dra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba thos nas thar pa 'dod pa rnams bdud rtsis tshim par 'gyur ba dang 'dra bas kun dga' ba'i sgra dang 'dra zhes bya'o //
translated: Nirvana is peace and, having heard this, those who desire liberation are satisfied with the nectar. Therefore, it is like a delightful sound.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa na /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa na /
translated: When one obtains the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas,

original: rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i ye shes rang gi ngang gis 'byung bas chos thams cad shes so //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i ye shes rang gi ngang gis 'byung bas chos thams cad shes so //
translated: because it arises spontaneously. This means that on the eighth ground, the bodhisattva, through the spontaneously arising wisdom that arises from karmic ripening, knows all dharmas as non-arisen.

original: sa dang po rtogs pa'i dus na yang 'dis de ltar shes mod kyi sa brgyad pa la ni rgya mtshor btang ba'i gru bo che dang chos mthun par rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba'i lam thob pa'i phyir mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang po rtogs pa'i dus na yang 'dis de ltar shes mod kyi sa brgyad pa la ni rgya mtshor btang ba'i gru bo che dang chos mthun par rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba'i lam thob pa'i phyir mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Although this bodhisattva knows it in that way at the time of realizing the first ground, on the eighth ground, it is called the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas because he obtains the path that arises spontaneously, like a large ship set out on the ocean.

original: ji ltar snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rnam pa 'byor ba thams cad sprin las 'byung ba ltar zhes bya ba ni ji ltar snod kyi 'jig rten sa la 'bru dang / sman dang / nags tshal la sogs pa 'byor ba thams cad sprin las 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rnam pa 'byor ba thams cad sprin las 'byung ba ltar zhes bya ba ni ji ltar snod kyi 'jig rten sa la 'bru dang / sman dang / nags tshal la sogs pa 'byor ba thams cad sprin las 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as all the wealth of the world of the environment, such as grain, medicine, forests, and so on, comes from the clouds,

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi 'byor ba mtho ris dang byang grol gyis phyug pa thams cad kyang shes rab dang snying rje'i thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa las byung bas sprin lta bu zhes @56a * //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi 'byor ba mtho ris dang byang grol gyis phyug pa thams cad kyang shes rab dang snying rje'i thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa las byung bas sprin lta bu zhes @56a * //
translated: so all the wealth of the world of sentient beings, such as the higher realms and liberation, comes from the generation of the thought of awakening endowed with the method of wisdom and compassion.🔽Therefore, it is called “like a cloud.”

original: bya'o ; / dpe nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa 'di ni 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las mi zad pa nyid du 'byung ba dang sbyar bar khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas
analyzed: bya'o ; / dpe nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa 'di ni 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las mi zad pa nyid du 'byung ba dang sbyar bar khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas
translated: This generation of the thought of awakening endowed with twenty-two similes should be understood as corresponding to the imperishability that occurs in the noble Aksayamatinirdesa Sutra.

original: bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: In the noble Aksayamatinirdesa Sutra,

original: sems bskyed pa dang / bsam pa dang / sbyor ba dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshad med pa dag dang / mngon par shes pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa dang / bsam pa dang / sbyor ba dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshad med pa dag dang / mngon par shes pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang /
translated: the generation of the spirit of enlightenment, the attitude, the application, the superior resolve, the perfections, the immeasurables, the superknowledges, the means of gathering disciples, the analytical knowledges,

original: rton pa dang / bsod nams dang ; ye shes kyi tshogs dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / gzungs dang / spobs pa dang / chos bshad pa dang / bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang /
analyzed: rton pa dang / bsod nams dang ; ye shes kyi tshogs dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / gzungs dang / spobs pa dang / chos bshad pa dang / bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang /
translated: the reliances, the collections of merit and knowledge, the factors of enlightenment, calm abiding and insight, the powers of retention and meditative concentration, the explanation of the teachings, the path of progress,🔽skill in liberative art, and so on.

original: thabs la mkhas pa dang / de la sogs pa go rims bzhin du 'byung ste /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa dang / de la sogs pa go rims bzhin du 'byung ste /
translated: These are the topics in the order in which they occur.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i sems bskyed pa 'di dag kyang go rims 'di kho nas sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i sems bskyed pa 'di dag kyang go rims 'di kho nas sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: These topics on the generation of the spirit of enlightenment should be understood in this order.

original: ngan 'gro dang yongs su skyo bas 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir sems bskyed pa bsngags par tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa dang dus mnyam pa nyid na sems de 'gro ba thams cad kyis bsngags par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ngan 'gro dang yongs su skyo bas 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir sems bskyed pa bsngags par tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa dang dus mnyam pa nyid na sems de 'gro ba thams cad kyis bsngags par bya ba yin te /
translated: At the very moment of generating the thought, that thought is to be praised by all beings.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang gi tshe na khyod kyi thugs //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na khyod kyi thugs //
translated: When your thought

original: dang po skyes pa de'i tshe //🔽khyod ni 'jig rten 'di dag gi //
analyzed: dang po skyes pa de'i tshe // khyod ni 'jig rten 'di dag gi //
translated: First arose,🔽You became the object of worship

original: mchod gnas bla na bzhugs pa lags //
analyzed: mchod gnas bla na bzhugs pa lags //
translated: For all the worlds.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: And so on.

original: sems bskyed pa bsngags par bya ba la /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa bsngags par bya ba la /
translated: In the praise of the generation of the thought,

original: de yod na rab tu bsngags pa'i sems dang ldan pa sa dang po rtogs pa'i dus nas bzung ste ngan song dag gis 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod na rab tu bsngags pa'i sems dang ldan pa sa dang po rtogs pa'i dus nas bzung ste ngan song dag gis 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: when it exists, the one who has the thought of highest praise, from the moment he realizes the first stage, is not afraid of the lower realms.

original: byang chub sems dpa' brtse ba dang ldan pa'i phyir sems can gyi bya ba mang pos yongs su skyo bas 'jigs par mi 'gyur bas ngan song dang yongs su skyobs 'jigs pa med pa zhes bya'o //🔽skye ba skyed mos tshal du 'go ba lta bur mthong ba'i phyir rgyud pa'i dus na sdug bsngal gyis mi 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni don gyi rnam pa phun sum tshogs pa dag la gang gi tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brtse ba dang ldan pa'i phyir sems can gyi bya ba mang pos yongs su skyo bas 'jigs par mi 'gyur bas ngan song dang yongs su skyobs 'jigs pa med pa zhes bya'o // skye ba skyed mos tshal du 'go ba lta bur mthong ba'i phyir rgyud pa'i dus na sdug bsngal gyis mi 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni don gyi rnam pa phun sum tshogs pa dag la gang gi tshe /
translated: Because the bodhisattva is compassionate, he is not afraid of being bothered by the many activities of sentient beings. Therefore, he is said to be fearless with regard to the lower realms and being bothered.

original: chom rkun dang / chu dang me la @56b sogs pas rgud par byas pa de'i tshe de dag rgud na rgyud pas 'jigs pa med do //
analyzed: chom rkun dang / chu dang me la @56b sogs pas rgud par byas pa de'i tshe de dag rgud na rgyud pas 'jigs pa med do //
translated: He is not afraid of suffering at the time of the continuum, because he sees birth as a garden. When the continuum is afflicted by thieves, water, fire, and so on, he is not afraid of the continuum being afflicted.

original: yo byad kyis phongs na 'chi bar 'gyur na gang zhig legs par byed pa'i las byas pas skye ba skyed mos tshal gyi dga' ston lta bur lta ba de ji ltar sdug bsngal dag gis 'jigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yo byad kyis phongs na 'chi bar 'gyur na gang zhig legs par byed pa'i las byas pas skye ba skyed mos tshal gyi dga' ston lta bur lta ba de ji ltar sdug bsngal dag gis 'jigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one is destitute of necessities, one dies. But one who has done good karma sees birth as a garden festival. How could he be afraid of suffering?

original: nyan thos kyi brtson 'grus pas brtson 'grus brgya 'gyur du bya ba'i rigs zhes bya la /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi brtson 'grus pas brtson 'grus brgya 'gyur du bya ba'i rigs zhes bya la /
translated: The effort of the bodhisattva should be a hundred times greater than the effort of the disciples.

original: brgya zhes smos pa ni grangs bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brgya zhes smos pa ni grangs bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The word “hundred” is used to indicate an unlimited number.

original: des brtson 'grus tshad med pa bya dgos so //
analyzed: des brtson 'grus tshad med pa bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, the effort of the bodhisattva should be unlimited.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi 'ching ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyon mongs pa dang / las dang skye ba'i ngo bo nyid dag gis shin tu bcings pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi 'ching ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyon mongs pa dang / las dang skye ba'i ngo bo nyid dag gis shin tu bcings pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “They are bound by various bonds of self and others, by the afflictions, actions, and births.”

original: mtshams med pa yi las rnams dang // nyon mongs drag dang ngan 'gro dang // sgra mi snyan dang 'du shes med //🔽sems can sgrib pa gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: mtshams med pa yi las rnams dang // nyon mongs drag dang ngan 'gro dang // sgra mi snyan dang 'du shes med // sems can sgrib pa gsum du 'dod //
translated: The five actions of immediate retribution, the intense afflictions, the miserable realms, Uttarakuru, and the non-ideation

original: ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba yin te /
translated: are considered the three obstructions for sentient beings.

original: 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i lam la sgrib pa'i phyir 'jig rten 'khor bar 'khyam par byed pas 'ching ba dag ces bya'o //🔽sems bskyed pa'i skabs so /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i lam la sgrib pa'i phyir 'jig rten 'khor bar 'khyam par byed pas 'ching ba dag ces bya'o // sems bskyed pa'i skabs so /
translated: These are called “bonds” because they bind sentient beings to wandering in cyclic existence and obstruct the noble path.🔽This was the chapter on the generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: // / sems bskyed pa'i 'og tu sgrub pa'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: // / sems bskyed pa'i 'og tu sgrub pa'i skabs yin te /
translated: The chapter on practice follows the chapter on the generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: 'di'i 'brel pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the connection here?

original: byang chub sems dpas mgo la sems can gyi khur chen po thogs nas pha rol gnon pa dal ba ni mi mdzes kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas mgo la sems can gyi khur chen po thogs nas pha rol gnon pa dal ba ni mi mdzes kyi /
translated: It is not becoming for a bodhisattva who has taken up the great burden of beings on his head to be slow in being heroic.🔽It is proper for him to be a hundred times more energetic than the disciples.

original: des nyan thos kyi brtson 'grus brgya 'gyur du bya ba'i rigs zhes bshad ma thag pa yin te /
analyzed: des nyan thos kyi brtson 'grus brgya 'gyur du bya ba'i rigs zhes bshad ma thag pa yin te /
translated: This has just been explained.

original: sgrub pa med par sems bskyed pa tsam kho nas ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa med par sems bskyed pa tsam kho nas ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob pa ma yin no //
translated: But unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is not attained just by generating the Thought without practice.

original: de'i phyir sems bskyed nas gdon mi za bar bsgrubs pas bsgrub par bya dgos pas sems bskyed pa'i 'og tu bsgrub pa'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems bskyed nas gdon mi za bar bsgrubs pas bsgrub par bya dgos pas sems bskyed pa'i 'og tu bsgrub pa'i skabs yin no //
translated: Therefore, after generating the Thought, one must practice without fail, and so the section on practice comes after the section on generating the Thought.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sgrub pa'i gnas chen po ni sems bskyed pa la gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sgrub pa'i gnas chen po ni sems bskyed pa la gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: And for that very reason, the great stage of practice is the stage of generating the Thought.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas de la brten te bsgrub pa la rab tu sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas de la brten te bsgrub pa la rab tu sbyor ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas generate the thought of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment and, on that basis, apply themselves to the practice.

original: sems bskyed pa yod du zin kyang bsgrub pa dang ldan pas gzhan gyi don 'grub kyi /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa yod du zin kyang bsgrub pa dang ldan pas gzhan gyi don 'grub kyi /
translated: Even if they have generated the thought, they accomplish the aims of others through the practice.

original: sgrub pa dang mi ldan @57a * //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang mi ldan @57a * //
translated: But not through the practice alone.

original: pas ni ma yin pas sems bskyed pa'i 'og tu sgrub pa'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: pas ni ma yin pas sems bskyed pa'i 'og tu sgrub pa'i skabs yin no //
translated: Therefore, after generating the thought, the practice is the next topic.

original: yang na byang chub kyi sems bskyed nas bslab par bya'o zhes mjug thogs su bslab pa bstan pa de dmigs pa gang gis mjug pa de brjod dgos pas de'i phyir mjug thogs su bslab pa'i dmigs pa khyad par can no //
analyzed: yang na byang chub kyi sems bskyed nas bslab par bya'o zhes mjug thogs su bslab pa bstan pa de dmigs pa gang gis mjug pa de brjod dgos pas de'i phyir mjug thogs su bslab pa'i dmigs pa khyad par can no //
translated: Or else, after generating the thought of enlightenment, one should train. Thus, the training is taught immediately after that. Since it is necessary to state the object of that training immediately after that, therefore, immediately after that, the special object of the training is stated.

original: bslab pa'i dmigs pa khyad par can yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: bslab pa'i dmigs pa khyad par can yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the special object of the training?

original: gzhi lnga'o // gzhi lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi lnga'o // gzhi lnga gang zhe na /
translated: The five bases. What are the five bases?

original: rang dang / gzhan gyi don dang / de kho na nyid kyi don dang / mthu dang / yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub po //
analyzed: rang dang / gzhan gyi don dang / de kho na nyid kyi don dang / mthu dang / yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub po //
translated: one's own aim, the aim of others, the aim of reality, power, the maturation of beings, and supreme enlightenment.

original: ji ltar na 'di ni nyan thos kyi theg pa las khyad par zhugs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di ni nyan thos kyi theg pa las khyad par zhugs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that this surpasses the vehicle of the sravakas?

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i bslab pa'i dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i bslab pa'i dmigs pa ni /
translated: The object of the training of the sravakas, etc.

original: rang gi don dang / de kho na nyid kyi don gang zag la bdag med pa dang / mthu chung ba dang / bdag yongs su smin par byed pa dang / de'i 'bras bu byang chub dman pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi don dang / de kho na nyid kyi don gang zag la bdag med pa dang / mthu chung ba dang / bdag yongs su smin par byed pa dang / de'i 'bras bu byang chub dman pa yin no //
translated: is one's own aim, the aim of reality, the selflessness of the person, small power, the maturation of oneself, and the inferior enlightenment which is the result of that.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i dmigs pa ni de las bzlog pa rang dang gzhan gyi don la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'phags pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i dmigs pa ni de las bzlog pa rang dang gzhan gyi don la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'phags pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The object of the training of the bodhisattvas is the opposite of that, and should be known as superior, with the distinction of one's own aim, the aim of others, etc.

original: yang gzhi lnga po 'di dag la ji ltar dmigs she na /
analyzed: yang gzhi lnga po 'di dag la ji ltar dmigs she na /
translated: Moreover, how is this fivefold basis to be taken as an object?

original: bzhi pa la ni rgyu nyid du'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni rgyu nyid du'o //
translated: The fourth is taken as a cause.

original: lnga pa la ni 'bras bu nyid du'o //
analyzed: lnga pa la ni 'bras bu nyid du'o //
translated: The fifth is the result itself.🔽Or else, having generated the Thought,

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems bskyed nas /🔽bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba gang la bslab par bya ba de bstan /
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems bskyed nas / bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba gang la bslab par bya ba de bstan /
translated: the Bodhisattvas should train.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don la sogs pa la bslab par bya ba yin pas ;
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don la sogs pa la bslab par bya ba yin pas ;
translated: The training is in the benefit of self and other, etc.

original: de'i phyir sems bskyed pa'i 'og tu bsgrub pa'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems bskyed pa'i 'og tu bsgrub pa'i skabs yin te /
translated: Therefore, after the generation of the Thought, the chapter on practice is appropriate,

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don la sogs pa 'di dag kyang sgrub pa dang ldan pa yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don la sogs pa 'di dag kyang sgrub pa dang ldan pa yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: because these benefit of self and other, etc. are endowed with practice, but not others.🔽Just these, in their order,

original: de dag nyid kyi go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: are the three verses:

original: gnas rtsom 'bras bu 'byung ba che bdag nyid //
analyzed: gnas rtsom 'bras bu 'byung ba che bdag nyid //
translated: The great self, the great undertaking, the great result.

original: ces bya ba tshig gsum po 'di dag / rtag tu len pa che dang bzod pa che //🔽don chen yang dag bsgrub pa'i bya ba byed //
analyzed: ces bya ba tshig gsum po 'di dag / rtag tu len pa che dang bzod pa che // don chen yang dag bsgrub pa'i bya ba byed //
translated: The three verses are to be applied to the three verses:🔽The great acceptance, the great forbearance,

original: ces bya ba'i tshig rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: the great performance of the accomplishment of the great meaning.

original: len pa chen po ste sems can thams cad nye bar len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni 'di ltar sems bskyed pas sems @57b can thams cad nye bar len par byed de /
analyzed: len pa chen po ste sems can thams cad nye bar len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni 'di ltar sems bskyed pas sems @57b can thams cad nye bar len par byed de /
translated: Thus, by generating the Thought, one appropriates all sentient beings,

original: sems can 'di rnams bdag gis bskyab po snyam du sems so zhes zer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can 'di rnams bdag gis bskyab po snyam du sems so zhes zer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one thinks, “I will protect these sentient beings.”

original: gzhan gyi don du bdag nyid la shin tu gdung bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag la phan pa dang bde ba'i don du bdag nyid la shin tu gdung bar byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du bdag nyid la shin tu gdung bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag la phan pa dang bde ba'i don du bdag nyid la shin tu gdung bar byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a great torment of oneself for the sake of others, because it is a torment of oneself for the sake of the welfare and happiness of others.

original: rjes su bstan pa dang / kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dag gis legs par ston pa zhes bya ba ni kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul gyis khyod kyi sems ni 'di lta bu yin no //
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa dang / kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dag gis legs par ston pa zhes bya ba ni kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul gyis khyod kyi sems ni 'di lta bu yin no //
translated: It is a good teacher, by means of the miracles of teaching and demonstration, because by the miracle of demonstration one says, “Your mind is like this,” and by the miracle of teaching one says, “You should do it like this.”

original: khyod kyi sems ni 'di snyam pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems kun brjod nas rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis gdams ngag thun mong ma yin pa de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i shes rab phyin ci ma log pa dang ldan pas rjes su
analyzed: khyod kyi sems ni 'di snyam pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems kun brjod nas rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis gdams ngag thun mong ma yin pa de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i shes rab phyin ci ma log pa dang ldan pas rjes su
translated: The instruction is in the special wisdom which understands reality, the unerring counsel, by means of the miracle of mind-reading, saying Your mind is like this and so on.

original: ston to // de la yon tan khyad par can yang dag par 'grub pa'i bar ni gzhan gyi don bya ba nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong pa yin no //
analyzed: ston to // de la yon tan khyad par can yang dag par 'grub pa'i bar ni gzhan gyi don bya ba nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong pa yin no //
translated: The attainment of special qualities up to the perfect accomplishment of the aims of others is the common aim of the disciples and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i don thun mong ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i don thun mong ma yin pa yin no //
translated: Birth in the Tathagata family and so on are the uncommon aims of the Bodhisattvas.

original: gal te rigs la gnas pa'i skye bo dang mthun zhing phyin ci ma log par 'chad par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te rigs la gnas pa'i skye bo dang mthun zhing phyin ci ma log par 'chad par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one is in accord with the person who is in the lineage, and if one teaches without error, then one is said to be in accord with the lineage.

original: rigs zhes smos pas ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can gyi skye bo bzung ngo //
analyzed: rigs zhes smos pas ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can gyi skye bo bzung ngo //
translated: By the word lineage here, one who is in the lineage of the disciples and so on is meant.

original: phyin ci ma log par 'chad par 'gyur ba zhes smos pas ni nyan thos la sogs pa de dag nyid las 'dod chags la sogs pa spyad pa spyod pa'i bye brag gis mi sdug pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba ston te /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par 'chad par 'gyur ba zhes smos pas ni nyan thos la sogs pa de dag nyid las 'dod chags la sogs pa spyad pa spyod pa'i bye brag gis mi sdug pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba ston te /
translated: The phrase they are taught without error indicates that the unattractiveness, etc., that will be explained are taught for those very śrāvakas, etc., who are engaged in the practice of attachment, etc.

original: bzlog pa ni phyin ci log tu 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni phyin ci log tu 'chad pa yin no //
translated: The opposite of that is taught in error.🔽Those who have entered the path do not grasp as mine

original: zhugs pa rnams la bdag gi bar 'dzin pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi bar 'dzin na khong khro ba dang rjes su chags pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhugs pa rnams la bdag gi bar 'dzin pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi bar 'dzin na khong khro ba dang rjes su chags pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If one grasps as mine, then one will have aversion and attachment.

original: don rnam par nges par bya ba la mkhas pa'i sgrub pa yin zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa dang / the tshom can dang ; log pa'i shes pa la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis mi shes pa la sogs pa sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don rnam par nges par bya ba la mkhas pa'i sgrub pa yin zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa dang / the tshom can dang ; log pa'i shes pa la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis mi shes pa la sogs pa sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the proof of skill in ascertaining the meaning, because it removes the ignorance, doubt, and wrong knowledge of those who are attached to ignorance, etc.

original: rigs su skye ba la sogs pa shin tu ring du song ba'i sgrub pa yin zhes bya ba ni gal te 'di sa dang po la rtogs pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs su skye ba la sogs pa shin tu ring du song ba'i sgrub pa yin zhes bya ba ni gal te 'di sa dang po la rtogs pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The practice of the bodhisattva is very far advanced in the birth in the family and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye ba yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye ba yin /
translated: One is born in the family of the Tathagata,
because one attains realization on the first stage.🔽One is skilled in the bodhisattva practice,

original: brgyad pa yan la sogs par lung bstan pa thob pa'i phyir lam mngon par 'du bya ba med par rang gi ngang gis 'byung bas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: brgyad pa yan la sogs par lung bstan pa thob pa'i phyir lam mngon par 'du bya ba med par rang gi ngang gis 'byung bas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la mkhas pa yin /
translated: because the path arises effortlessly by its very nature, beginning from the eighth stage, since one attains the prediction.🔽One is consecrated,

original: sa bcu pa la 'od zer dag gis dbang bskur pa thob pa'i phyir dbang bskur ba yin na de lta na gzhan dag rigs su skye ba la sogs par bya bar nus so //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la 'od zer dag gis dbang bskur pa thob pa'i phyir dbang bskur ba yin na de lta na gzhan dag rigs su skye ba la sogs par bya bar nus so //
translated: because one attains consecration by the rays of light on the tenth stage.🔽Because of impermanence.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la bde ba'i tshor ba ni skye ba'i dus na phan 'dogs pa yin la 'jigs pa'i dus na gnod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la bde ba'i tshor ba ni skye ba'i dus na phan 'dogs pa yin la 'jigs pa'i dus na gnod par byed pa yin te /
translated: The feeling of pleasure is helpful at the time of birth, but it is harmful at the time of death.

original: de bas na mi rtag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba'o //🔽zhi dga' rang gi len pa rab zhi la //
analyzed: de bas na mi rtag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba'o // zhi dga' rang gi len pa rab zhi la //
translated: Therefore, because of impermanence, it is said to be suffering.🔽The Sravakas delight in peace, the pacification of their own appropriation.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rnams ni so so rang gi bdag nyid kyis len pa nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rnams ni so so rang gi bdag nyid kyis len pa nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar byed de /
translated: The Sravakas pacify the afflictions that are their own appropriation.

original: nyon mongs pa nyid len pa yin pas na len pa nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa nyid len pa yin pas na len pa nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Since the afflictions are appropriation, they are the afflictions that are appropriation.

original: ji skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: As the Prajnaparamita says:

original: rab 'byor gal te gzugs dngos por 'gyur gyi dngos po med pa ma yin na /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te gzugs dngos por 'gyur gyi dngos po med pa ma yin na /
translated: Subhuti, if form were a thing and not a non-thing,🔽this perfection of wisdom would not surpass the world with its gods, humans and titans and go forth.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag ji ltar byis pa rnams kyis mngon par brjod cing 'dzin pa de kho na ltar 'di dag yongs su grub pa nyid du gyur cing dngos por gyur gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag ji ltar byis pa rnams kyis mngon par brjod cing 'dzin pa de kho na ltar 'di dag yongs su grub pa nyid du gyur cing dngos por gyur gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If these phenomena such as form were just as they are expressed and apprehended by the childish, they would be fully established and become things.

original: dngos po med pa ma yin na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis lha dang mi la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan cing nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ma yin na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis lha dang mi la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan cing nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were not non-things, this perfection of wisdom would not surpass and lead to the transcendence of the world with its gods, humans, and so forth.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byis pa dang mkhas pa dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad de kho na nyid mthong ba kho nar 'gyur te de ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: byis pa dang mkhas pa dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad de kho na nyid mthong ba kho nar 'gyur te de ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Because there would be no difference between the childish and the wise, everyone would see reality just as it is. As the Blessed One said:

original: dngos po rnams kyi yod pa nyid //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi yod pa nyid //
translated: The existence of things

original: ji ltar byis pas rnam brtags shing //
analyzed: ji ltar byis pas rnam brtags shing //
translated: Is just as imagined by the childish.

original: de ltar mthong de gal te yin //
analyzed: de ltar mthong de gal te yin //
translated: If that were how they are seen,

original: thams cad de nyid mthong bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: thams cad de nyid mthong bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Everyone would see reality.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag byis pas kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis med pa'i ngo bo yin pa de'i phyir @58b sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' tshul bzhin rab tu sbyor ba rnams la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye la
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag byis pas kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis med pa'i ngo bo yin pa de'i phyir @58b sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' tshul bzhin rab tu sbyor ba rnams la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye la
translated: Because these phenomena such as form are essenceless in the sense of being nonexistent by virtue of their own natures as imagined by the childish, therefore, for the buddhas and bodhisattvas who are properly engaged, nonconceptual wisdom arises.

original: / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyang theg pa chen po yin te /
analyzed: / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyang theg pa chen po yin te /
translated: And nonconceptual wisdom is the Great Vehicle.

original: rgyu 'di nyid kyis lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu 'di nyid kyis lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By this very cause, one will surpass the world with its gods, humans, and asuras and attain emancipation.

original: sgrub pa'i 'og tu de kho na nyid kyi skabs yin te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i 'og tu de kho na nyid kyi skabs yin te /
translated: After the chapter on practice comes the chapter on suchness.

original: 'di'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is its relation?

original: sgrub pa 'di ni srid dang 'gro ba kun //
analyzed: sgrub pa 'di ni srid dang 'gro ba kun //
translated: This practice surpasses all existences and migrations

original: zil gyis mnan 'gro zhi ba mchog dang ldan //
analyzed: zil gyis mnan 'gro zhi ba mchog dang ldan //
translated: and proceeds to the supreme peace.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad ma thag pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad ma thag pa yin te /
translated: This is the relation, as just explained.

original: che ba nyid de rnam pa bzhi char yang sgrub pa dang ldan pa de kho na nyid mthong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: che ba nyid de rnam pa bzhi char yang sgrub pa dang ldan pa de kho na nyid mthong ba yin gyi /
translated: The four kinds of greatness are possessed by one who has the realization of reality,

original: gzhan gyi ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni ma yin pas /
translated: but not by others.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa ni bshad ma thag pa yin no //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa ni bshad ma thag pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the accomplishment of one's own and others' aims has just been explained.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don la zhugs pa yang kun nas nyon mongs pa med par bya dgos pas de'i phyir mjug thogs su kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs de kho na nyid kyis ston to //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don la zhugs pa yang kun nas nyon mongs pa med par bya dgos pas de'i phyir mjug thogs su kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs de kho na nyid kyis ston to //
translated: One who is engaged in accomplishing one's own and others' aims must be free from defilement. Therefore, immediately following that, the method of nondefilement is taught by means of reality.

original: kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dag gis ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dag gis ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa yin te /
translated: It does not exist by the imagined and dependent realities. This is explained from the perspective of the reality realm,

original: de ni bslab pa'i dmigs pa nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: de ni bslab pa'i dmigs pa nyid du bshad do //
translated: for that is explained as the very object of the training.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyang lam gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyang lam gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: Nonconceptual intuition is the essence of the path and therefore is the perfected reality.

original: de ni tshigs su bcad pa 'dir ma smos te /
analyzed: de ni tshigs su bcad pa 'dir ma smos te /
translated: That is not mentioned in this verse.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni logs shig tu 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni logs shig tu 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Its characteristics will be explained separately.🔽Since the imagined, the dependent, and the perfected are not identical, they are not the same.

original: kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dag dang yongs su grub par gcig pa nyid med pas de bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i chos rnams ni yod pa ma yin pa las yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid du snang ba yin la
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dag dang yongs su grub par gcig pa nyid med pas de bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i chos rnams ni yod pa ma yin pa las yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid du snang ba yin la
translated: The imagined dharmas are the appearance of what is unreal from what is nonexistent.

original: / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bden pa yang dag pa phyin ci ma log pa yin te /
analyzed: / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bden pa yang dag pa phyin ci ma log pa yin te /
translated: The perfected nature is the truth, the reality, the non-erroneous.

original: des na 'di kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the imagined nature.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyang kun brtags pa de'i gzhir gyur pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid du snang ba yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyang kun brtags pa de'i gzhir gyur pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid du snang ba yin la /
translated: The dependent nature is the basis of the imagined, the dependent origination that appears as the nature of affliction.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni de las bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni de las bzlog pa yin te /
translated: The dharma-dhātu is the opposite of that.

original: de lta bas na @59a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na @59a * //
translated: Therefore, it is not the dependent nature.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the other-dependent nature.🔽Since they are neither the same nor different, they are not other.

original: de dag kho na dang gzhan pa nyid med pas gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de'i phyir gzhan nyid🔽du yang rnam par mi gzhag ste /
analyzed: de dag kho na dang gzhan pa nyid med pas gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de'i phyir gzhan nyid du yang rnam par mi gzhag ste /
translated: Since the other-dependent nature, which is free from the imagined nature, is the perfected nature, therefore they are not established as other.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Like impermanence, etc.🔽Because it remains just as it is when ceasing and arising.

original: 'gag pa dang skye ba na de bzhin gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings ni 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos 'gag pa na yang nyams pa med la /
analyzed: 'gag pa dang skye ba na de bzhin gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings ni 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos 'gag pa na yang nyams pa med la /
translated: The realm of the Dharma is not diminished when the phenomena of affliction, such as passion, etc., cease.

original: rnam par byang ba lam gyi ngo bo nyid kyi chos skye ba na yang 'phel ba med de /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba lam gyi ngo bo nyid kyi chos skye ba na yang 'phel ba med de /
translated: Nor is it increased when the phenomena of purification, which are of the nature of the path, arise.

original: nam mkha' la sprin dang khug rna glo bur pa 'ongs pa dang bral ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sprin dang khug rna glo bur pa 'ongs pa dang bral ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like space, which is not affected by the adventitious clouds and mist that come and go.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i phyin ci log dgag par zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i phyin ci log dgag par zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “the cessation of the error of the view of self” refers to the selflessness of persons.

original: re zhig bdag tu lta ba nyid ni bdag gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig bdag tu lta ba nyid ni bdag gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: The view of self is not the characteristic of a self.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag ni rtag pa dang thams cad na yod pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag ni rtag pa dang thams cad na yod pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa yin la /
translated: A self is said to be permanent and to exist in everything.

original: bdag tu lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba ste /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba ste /
translated: The view of self is the view of the perishable collection.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos thams cad ni yod pa ma yin pa mi rtag pa bdag nyid thob pa'i dus na yang byed pa dang bcas pa lta bur snang bas bya ba dang bcas pa yin te /🔽de lta bas na bdag tu lta ba nyid ni bdag gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos thams cad ni yod pa ma yin pa mi rtag pa bdag nyid thob pa'i dus na yang byed pa dang bcas pa lta bur snang bas bya ba dang bcas pa yin te / de lta bas na bdag tu lta ba nyid ni bdag gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: All mental states that are not real are like the appearance of activity in the impermanent self that is obtained at the time of its production.🔽Therefore, the view of self is not the characteristic of a self.

original: rnam pa 'di nyid kyis ngan par gnas pa yang bdag gi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di nyid kyis ngan par gnas pa yang bdag gi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: For the same reason, the view of the perishable collection is not the characteristic of a self.

original: ngan par gnas pa zhes smos pas ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga gzung ngo //
analyzed: ngan par gnas pa zhes smos pas ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase “abiding in a negative way” refers to the five appropriated aggregates.

original: 'di gnyis las gzhan pa'i bdag gi mtshan nyid kyang mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'am rjes su dpag pas dmigs te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis las gzhan pa'i bdag gi mtshan nyid kyang mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'am rjes su dpag pas dmigs te /
translated: The phrase “nor is the characteristic of a self that is different from these two” means that any existent thing is perceived either by direct perception or by inference.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni mngon sum gyis so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni mngon sum gyis so //
translated: Form, etc., is perceived by direct perception.

original: mig la sogs pa ni rjes su dpag pas so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni rjes su dpag pas so //
translated: The eye, etc., is perceived by inference.

original: bdag ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag bdag gis mi dmigs te /
analyzed: bdag ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag bdag gis mi dmigs te /
translated: The self is not perceived by direct perception or by inference.

original: de lta bas na bdag ni med kyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag ni med kyi /
translated: Therefore, the self does not exist.

original: sems kho na la bdag tu 'dogs par zad do //
analyzed: sems kho na la bdag tu 'dogs par zad do //
translated: The designation of self is made only in regard to the mind.

original: bdag tu lta ba gang yin pa de ni nor pa skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni thag pa la sprul du 'khrul pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba gang yin pa de ni nor pa skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni thag pa la sprul du 'khrul pa bzhin no //
translated: The view of self is a false imagination, like the imagination of a snake in regard to a rope.

original: thag pa yang nor @59b pa tsam zad pa yin zhes bya ba de ni thag pa la sprul du 'khrul pa dang bral bas lus dang sems nyam nga ba med pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: thag pa yang nor @59b pa tsam zad pa yin zhes bya ba de ni thag pa la sprul du 'khrul pa dang bral bas lus dang sems nyam nga ba med pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The statement “the rope is just the cessation of error” is like the absence of physical and mental distress in the absence of the error of a snake in a rope.

original: tsam zhes smos pa ni bdag gi dngos po med pa'i phyir nor pa tsam kho na yod kyi /
analyzed: tsam zhes smos pa ni bdag gi dngos po med pa'i phyir nor pa tsam kho na yod kyi /
translated: The word “just” is used to indicate that error alone exists, because the nature of a self does not exist.

original: bdag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: A self does not exist.

original: sdug bsngal la rang bzhin rgyun chags rtogs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rang bzhin rgyun chags rtogs mi 'gyur //
translated: One does not realize the nature of suffering as a continuous process.

original: zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang bcas pa'i ma rig pas bsgribs pa rtogs par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang bcas pa'i ma rig pas bsgribs pa rtogs par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The nature of suffering is the five appropriative aggregates. One does not realize that they are obscured by the ignorance that is associated with the view of the transitory collection.

original: rig min zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyis so //🔽rig nyid ces bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i shes pas nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa can gyis so //
analyzed: rig min zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyis so //🔽rig nyid ces bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i shes pas nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa can gyis so //
