translated: One does not realize it through the knowledge that is not pure.🔽One does not realize it through the knowledge that is pure.🔽One does not realize it through the knowledge that is not pure. This refers to the realization that is not attained through uncontaminated knowledge.🔽One does not realize it through the knowledge that is pure. This refers to the realization that is not attained through the knowledge that is associated with the outflows.

original: de ji ltar mthong ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi byas zhes bya ba'i lta ba 'di la brten zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / snom pa dang / myong ba dang / reg pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dbang phyug la sogs pas byas so zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de ji ltar mthong ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi byas zhes bya ba'i lta ba 'di la brten zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / snom pa dang / myong ba dang / reg pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dbang phyug la sogs pas byas so zhes pa ste /
translated: The phrase this view that it is created by another refers to the view that seeing and so on are created by God and so on.

original: mdzangs shing mkhas pa su zhig rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong nas dbang phyug la sogs pas byas par lta ba 'di la brten /
analyzed: mdzangs shing mkhas pa su zhig rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong nas dbang phyug la sogs pas byas par lta ba 'di la brten /
translated: What wise person, seeing dependent origination, would rely on this view that it is created by God and so on?

original: bdag med par zhi ba rung bar tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag med par zhi ba rung bar tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The peace of selflessness is tenable is the second verse.

original: bdag ces bya ba'i sgra ni gang zag la sogs pa'i rnam grangs la yang mthong ste /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba'i sgra ni gang zag la sogs pa'i rnam grangs la yang mthong ste /
translated: The term self is seen to be a synonym for person and so on.

original: bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / skye ba po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam grangs dag la'o //
analyzed: bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / skye ba po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam grangs dag la'o //
translated: It is a synonym for self, sentient being, living being, and so on.

original: chos dag la yang mthong ste /
analyzed: chos dag la yang mthong ste /
translated: It is also seen to be a synonym for phenomena.

original: chos ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bcas pa zhes bya bar shes so ;
analyzed: chos ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bcas pa zhes bya bar shes so ;
translated: The phrase “endowed with an intrinsic reality” should be understood as “endowed with a self.”

original: /'di las phyi rol pa phyin ci log tu gyur pa dag ni bdag med pa las bdag tu mngon par zhen la /
analyzed: /'di las phyi rol pa phyin ci log tu gyur pa dag ni bdag med pa las bdag tu mngon par zhen la /
translated: Those who are outside this teaching, who have fallen into error, cling to a self where there is no self.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams ni chos 'di dag ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gis dmigs pa de kho na bzhin du 'di dag bdag gi ngo bo nyid yod do zhes chos rnams la phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams ni chos 'di dag ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gis dmigs pa de kho na bzhin du 'di dag bdag gi ngo bo nyid yod do zhes chos rnams la phyin ci log ste /
translated: Those in the Śrāvaka Vehicle are in error with regard to phenomena, thinking that these phenomena have an intrinsic reality just as they are perceived by ordinary beings.

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa bdag tu lta ba dang chos su lta ba la gnas par dmigs pa de dag gal te bdag gam chos shig med na ji ltar na thar /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa bdag tu lta ba dang chos su lta ba la gnas par dmigs pa de dag gal te bdag gam chos shig med na ji ltar na thar /
translated: They think, “If there is no self or phenomena, how can there be liberation?🔽Who is liberated?”

original: su zhig ni thar zhes phyir rgol bar byed de /🔽de dag la byis pa so so'i skye bos kun brtags pa'i bdag dang chos @60a * //
analyzed: su zhig ni thar zhes phyir rgol bar byed de / de dag la byis pa so so'i skye bos kun brtags pa'i bdag dang chos @60a * //
translated: They argue in this way.

original: rnams med na thar gyi yod na ni ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnams med na thar gyi yod na ni ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: To them it is explained that liberation is possible when the self and phenomena imputed by ordinary beings do not exist, but not when they do exist.

original: 'di la don dam tshul gyis zhi ba dang // skye ba de gnyis khyad par ci yang med //
analyzed: 'di la don dam tshul gyis zhi ba dang // skye ba de gnyis khyad par ci yang med //
translated: There is no difference at all between these two in terms of ultimate reality.

original: ces bya ba ni don dam pa'i tshul bdag med par mnyam pa nyid kyis ni ji ltar 'khor ba gang zag dang byis pa'i skye bos kun brtags pa'i chos rnams kyi stong pa ltar mya ngan las 'das pa yang de dang 'dra la /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni don dam pa'i tshul bdag med par mnyam pa nyid kyis ni ji ltar 'khor ba gang zag dang byis pa'i skye bos kun brtags pa'i chos rnams kyi stong pa ltar mya ngan las 'das pa yang de dang 'dra la /
translated: In terms of ultimate reality, there is no difference at all between cyclic existence and nirvana, because of the sameness of selflessness.

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa de yang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la mnyam pa nyid du ldan te /
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa de yang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la mnyam pa nyid du ldan te /
translated: The selflessness of persons and things is equally related to both cyclic existence and nirvana.

original: 'khor ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'i yang yin pas rgyu 'dis na 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la khyad par ci yang med do //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'i yang yin pas rgyu 'dis na 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la khyad par ci yang med do //
translated: The reality of cyclic existence is the same as the reality of nirvana. For this reason, there is not the slightest difference between cyclic existence and nirvana.

original: skye ba ni 'khor ba yin te /
analyzed: skye ba ni 'khor ba yin te /
translated: Birth is cyclic existence.

original: de ni phyin ci log tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba la sogs pas skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni phyin ci log tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba la sogs pas skye ba yin no //
translated: It is born from the cause of error, which is incorrect mental activity.

original: skye ba de zad pa ni thar ba thob pa yin la /
analyzed: skye ba de zad pa ni thar ba thob pa yin la /
translated: The exhaustion of that birth is the attainment of liberation.

original: de yang dge ba byed pa tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i rgyus lam bsgom pa rnams kyi yin pas skye ba zad pa ni thar pa zhes bya'o //

original: don dam pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa thun mong ma yin pa'i dbang du byas pa sta /

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ji ltar chos la bdag med par rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i dbang du byas nas tshigs su bcad pa yin no //

original: sngar ni gang zag la bdag med par bshad pa yin no //

original: da ni chos la bdag med pa'o //

analyzed: 'di la phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i don ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: de nas ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs su 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de la brten pa'i nyes tshogs tshang tshing dang / dug sman chen pos dug bzhin sel bar byed // ces bya ba la / de la brten pa'i zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' gang la brten nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skyes pa de la brten nas skyes pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dug sman lta bu de la brten nas skyes pa nyes pa'i tshogs
translated: The great poison-neutralizing antidote removes the entire thicket of faults that are based on it.🔽“Based on it” means that the great poison-neutralizing antidote, which is nonconceptual wisdom, removes the entire thicket of faults that are based on it.

original: tshang tshing ring nas zhugs pa gang yin pa de sel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: tshang tshing ring nas zhugs pa gang yin pa de sel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The entire thicket of faults that are based on the bodhisattva, based on whom nonconceptual wisdom arises, are removed by the poison-neutralizing antidote, which is nonconceptual wisdom that arises based on him.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' don dam pa'i ye shes la zhugs pa des sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i dam pa'i chos legs par gzhag pa rtsa ba'i sems bsdus pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i chos kyi dbyings la blo gros gzhag ste zhes bya ba la rtsa sems bsdus pa'i chos
translated: Bodhisattvas who have entered ultimate pristine wisdom properly establish the excellent Dharma taught by the Buddha, they direct their intelligence to the dharmadhatu that is the object of the Dharma subsumed by the root mind.

original: la dmigs pa zhes ji ltar shes she na /

analyzed: 'di ltar 'di nyid las gdams ngag rjes su @61a * //

analyzed: thog ma kho nar sdom brtson te //

analyzed: rim gyis rnam par dpyod par byed //

original: ces 'chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ces 'chad par 'gyur te /

translated: These three verses and the following explain the six mental activities: the basic mental activity, the mental activity of subsequent analysis, the mental activity of thorough analysis, the mental activity of ascertainment, the mental activity of restraint, and the mental activity of hope.

original: de la rtsa ba'i sems ni mdo la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi ming la dmigs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba'i sems ni mdo la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi ming la dmigs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The basic mental activity is the mental activity that takes as its object the names of the teachings such as the scriptures.

original: mdo'i sde dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde la sogs pa'i chos la mdo'i sde zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mdo'i sde dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde la sogs pa'i chos la mdo'i sde zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is the mental activity that takes as its object the names of the teachings such as the scriptures, such as the Sutra Pitaka, the Ge ya Pitaka, etc. It is the mental activity that takes as its object the names of the teachings such as the Sutra Pitaka, the Ge ya Pitaka, etc.

analyzed: yang na theg pa chen po'i chos mtha' dag la sems gang gis dmigs pa de ni rtsa ba'i sems yin no //

original: tshig rab tu dbye ba dag las drangs te bsdus pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni las su rung ba yin no zhes rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams 'chad do //

translated: The Yogācāras explain that the mind that focuses on the summarized Dharma is the serviceability of the mind that is drawn from the analysis of the words.

original: bsdus pa'i chos la dmigs pa de'i chos kyi dbyings la blo gros bzhag nas dran pa gang dang gang skye ba'i dran pa 'jug pa de dag thams cad rtog pa tsam du khong du chud de /

translated: Having placed the mind in the reality of the summarized Dharma, all the mindfulness that arises is understood to be mere conceptualization.

original: de ltar na myur du yon tan rgya mtsho'i pha rol la sangs rgyas nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na myur du yon tan rgya mtsho'i pha rol la sangs rgyas nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: In that way, one quickly goes to the other side of the ocean of qualities, to buddhahood.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni ji ltar na bsgom pa'i lam gyi mthar thug par gyur pa sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'jug pa de bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni ji ltar na bsgom pa'i lam gyi mthar thug par gyur pa sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'jug pa de bzhin du bstan to //

analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di rnams kyi bsdus pa'i don ni dang pos ni tshogs kyi lam bstan to //
translated: The summary of the meaning of these verses is as follows. The first verse teaches the path of accumulation.

original: gnyis pa'i phyed kyis ni sbyor ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i phyed kyis ni sbyor ba'i lam mo //
translated: The first half of the second verse teaches the path of preparation.

original: gnyis pa'i phyed 'og mas ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i phyed 'og mas ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: The second half of the second verse is about the path of vision.

original: bzhi bas ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: bzhi bas ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: The fourth verse is about the path of cultivation.

original: lnga pas ni mthar thug pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: lnga pas ni mthar thug pa'i lam mo //
translated: The fifth verse is about the path of conclusion.

original: de kho na nyid kyi skabs so /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi skabs so /
translated: This concludes the chapter on reality.

original: // / de kho na nyid kyi skabs kyi 'og tu mthu'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: // / de kho na nyid kyi skabs kyi 'og tu mthu'i skabs yin te /
translated: The chapter on power comes after the chapter on reality.

original: 'di'i 'brel pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the connection here?

original: byang chub sems dpas ni rang gi don dang gzhan @61b gyi don gnyis bya dgos so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ni rang gi don dang gzhan @61b gyi don gnyis bya dgos so //
translated: The bodhisattva must accomplish two things: his own aim and the aim of others.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs pa ni rang gi don yin no //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs pa ni rang gi don yin no //
translated: Therein, the fulfillment of the Buddha qualities is his own aim.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni gzhan gyi don yin no //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni gzhan gyi don yin no //
translated: The development of living beings is the aim of others.

original: de kho na nyid rtogs pa las ni sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de kho na nyid rtogs pa las ni sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur la /
translated: From the realization of reality, the fulfillment of the Buddha qualities results.

original: de'i 'og tu de kho na nyid rtogs pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de kho na nyid rtogs pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la /
translated: After that, through the realization of reality, the development of living beings results.

original: yon tan khyad par can mngon par bsgrubs pas sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: yon tan khyad par can mngon par bsgrubs pas sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: And through the accomplishment of special qualities, the development of living beings is accomplished.

original: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can de dag kyang rjes la mngon par rtogs pa dang / mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pas grub pas de kho na nyid kyi skabs kyi 'og tu mthu'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can de dag kyang rjes la mngon par rtogs pa dang / mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pas grub pas de kho na nyid kyi skabs kyi 'og tu mthu'i skabs yin no //
translated: And since those special qualities such as the superknowledges are accomplished by the subsequent clear realization and the ultimate clear realization, the chapter on power comes after the chapter on reality.

original: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs su de kho na nyid kyi don bshad do //
analyzed: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs su de kho na nyid kyi don bshad do //
translated: Or else, the meaning of reality is explained as a means to the absence of defilement.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa yang ji srid du 'dul ba dag la dbang ma thob pa de srid du gdu la ba bsgo pa mi nyan pas yongs su skyo bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa yang ji srid du 'dul ba dag la dbang ma thob pa de srid du gdu la ba bsgo pa mi nyan pas yongs su skyo bar 'gyur te /
translated: And as long as one does not obtain mastery over the disciples, one cannot listen to the instructions, and so one becomes weary.

original: de dag dad par byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dad par byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is unable to inspire faith in them.

original: de'i phyir de kho na nyid kyi 'og tu yongs su mi skye ba'i thabs mthu'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na nyid kyi 'og tu yongs su mi skye ba'i thabs mthu'i skabs yin no //
translated: Therefore, the chapter on power comes after the chapter on reality as a means to the absence of weariness.

original: gzhan dag gi skye ba shes pa ni 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba mngon par shes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gi skye ba shes pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi skye ba shes pa ni 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba mngon par shes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gi skye ba shes pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it knowledge of the births of others,

original: des ni 'chi 'pho yang shes te /
analyzed: des ni 'chi 'pho yang shes te /
translated: but it also knows death,

original: du ba las me bzhin du gang na skye bshes pa yod pa de na 'chi 'pho shes pa yang gdon mi za bar yod pas skye ba shes pa kho na bshad do //
analyzed: du ba las me bzhin du gang na skye bshes pa yod pa de na 'chi 'pho shes pa yang gdon mi za bar yod pas skye ba shes pa kho na bshad do //
translated: because wherever there is knowledge of birth, there is knowledge of death, just as there is smoke wherever there is fire.🔽The words that beings speak in this and that place are the words that beings speak.

original: de dang de dag tu skyes pa rnams ji skad du smra ba'i tshig ces bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi tshig gang smra ba de dag byang chub sems dpa'i lha'i rna bas thos so //
analyzed: de dang de dag tu skyes pa rnams ji skad du smra ba'i tshig ces bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi tshig gang smra ba de dag byang chub sems dpa'i lha'i rna bas thos so //
translated: The bodhisattva hears those words with his divine ear.

original: sngon dge ba dang mi dge ba bskyed pa shes pa ni sngon gyi gnas mngon par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang zag gi tshe rabs snga ma gzhan dag la dge ba'am mi dge ba'i las gang zhig byas pa'i las bag chags kyi gnas skabs de shes
analyzed: sngon dge ba dang mi dge ba bskyed pa shes pa ni sngon gyi gnas mngon par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang zag gi tshe rabs snga ma gzhan dag la dge ba'am mi dge ba'i las gang zhig byas pa'i las bag chags kyi gnas skabs de shes
translated: This is knowledge of the state of the latent propensities of any virtuous or nonvirtuous karma that was previously committed in other former lives of a person.

original: pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba skyed pa shes pa'o //🔽ji ltar rnam par gnas pa yid la byed pa ni mngon par shes pa gang dang gang rnam pa gang gis skye bar 'gyur pa 'di lta ste /🔽rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes @62a * //
analyzed: pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba skyed pa shes pa'o // ji ltar rnam par gnas pa yid la byed pa ni mngon par shes pa gang dang gang rnam pa gang gis skye bar 'gyur pa 'di lta ste / rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes @62a * //
translated: Knowledge of the generation of former virtue and nonvirtue.

original: pa'i lus yang bar mos pa la sogs pa lta bu de lta de ltar yid la byed pa las tshul bzhin yid la byed pa skye la /
analyzed: pa'i lus yang bar mos pa la sogs pa lta bu de lta de ltar yid la byed pa las tshul bzhin yid la byed pa skye la /
translated: Attentiveness associated with the way things are is the correct attention that arises from the attentiveness associated with the way things are not, which in turn arises from the attentiveness associated with the way things are.

original: de las rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye bas /
analyzed: de las rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye bas /
translated: From that, nonconceptual gnosis arises.

original: ji ltar rnam gnas yid la byed pa las //🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam gnas yid la byed pa las //🔽zhes bya ste /
translated: From the attentiveness associated with the way things are,

original: rim pa 'dis dang / rgyu 'di dang byed rgyu 'dis mthu 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rim pa 'dis dang / rgyu 'di dang byed rgyu 'dis mthu 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By this process, by this cause, by this agency, power is achieved.

original: gang gis 'phags dang lha dang tshangs pa yi //
analyzed: gang gis 'phags dang lha dang tshangs pa yi //
translated: By which one abides in the states of the noble ones, the gods, and Brahma.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i mthu gang gis gnas pa dang / yang dag par 'chos par byed par byed pa dang / rnam par dag pa skyed par byed pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i mthu gang gis gnas pa dang / yang dag par 'chos par byed par byed pa dang / rnam par dag pa skyed par byed pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The states of the noble ones, gods, and Brahma are explained as follows: By which power just explained, one abides, one acts to correct, and one generates purification.

original: 'phags pa la sogs pa'i bde bar gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'phags pa la sogs pa'i bde bar gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The states of the noble ones and so on are as follows:

original: 'phags pa'i gnas pa ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gnas pa ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: The state of the noble ones is included in emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, the four noble truths, the stages, and the perfections.

original: lha'i gnas pa ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i gnas pa ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'o //
translated: The state of the gods is the dhyanas and formless [absorptions].

original: tshangs pa'i gnas ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms so //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms so //
translated: The state of Brahma is loving-kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rnams sgyu ma lta bu nyid du mthong la zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sgyu ma la yang dag pa ma yin pa glang po che dang / rta la sogs pa skye ba yang snang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rnams sgyu ma lta bu nyid du mthong la zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sgyu ma la yang dag pa ma yin pa glang po che dang / rta la sogs pa skye ba yang snang /
translated: Just as in an illusion, the arising of what is not real, such as elephants, horses, and so on, is seen,🔽and their destruction is also seen,

original: 'jig pa yang snang ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag ni 'chags par mthong la /
analyzed: 'jig pa yang snang ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag ni 'chags par mthong la /
translated: in the same way, the bodhisattva also sees the creation of other world-realms,

original: gzhan dag ni 'jig par mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'jig par mthong ngo //
translated: and sees the destruction of others.🔽Because he displays the play of infinite samādhis within the circle of the Buddha’s retinue.

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi nang du ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pas rnam par rol pa kun tu ston pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa 'jam dpal bcom ldan 'das kyi 'khor gyi nang du ting nge 'dzin
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi nang du ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pas rnam par rol pa kun tu ston pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa 'jam dpal bcom ldan 'das kyi 'khor gyi nang du ting nge 'dzin
translated: Just as the bodhisattva noble Mañjuśrī displays the play of infinite samādhis within the circle of the Blessed One’s retinue,

original: la snyoms par zhugs pa byang chub sems dpa' gang gis kyang ting nge 'dzin de las bslad par ma nus pa las bu mo blo gros bzang mos bslang ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: la snyoms par zhugs pa byang chub sems dpa' gang gis kyang ting nge 'dzin de las bslad par ma nus pa las bu mo blo gros bzang mos bslang ba lta bu ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who enters this meditative absorption cannot be disturbed by anyone, but the girl Bhadramatī can arouse him from it.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par rol pa theg pa chen po'i mdo sde las 'byung ba dag yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par rol pa theg pa chen po'i mdo sde las 'byung ba dag yin no //
translated: Such are the displays of meditative absorption that occur in the Mahāyāna sūtras.

original: mngon par shes pa ni drug ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa ni drug ste /
translated: The higher knowledges are six:

original: 'pho ba dang / mthun par thos pa dang / sems kyi spyod pa dang / 'jug pa dang / 'gro ba dang / @62b 'ong ba dang / des par 'byung ba'i sgo nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba dang / mthun par thos pa dang / sems kyi spyod pa dang / 'jug pa dang / 'gro ba dang / @62b 'ong ba dang / des par 'byung ba'i sgo nas rig par bya'o //
translated: the higher knowledge of magical powers, the higher knowledge of the divine ear, the higher knowledge of the knowledge of others’ minds, the higher knowledge of the recollection of former lives, the higher knowledge of the divine eye, and the higher knowledge of the destruction of the impurities.

original: rig pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: rig pa ni gsum ste /
translated: The three knowledges are:

original: sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa la ma rig pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa la ma rig pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the knowledge of the past, the knowledge of the future, and the knowledge of the present.

original: rnam par thar pa ni brgyad de /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa ni brgyad de /
translated: The eight liberations are:

original: gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
translated: The first liberation is the perception of form when one has the notion of form.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba ni /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba ni /
translated: The second liberation is the perception of the external form when one has the notion of internal form.

original: rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //🔽sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du bya ba nas rdzogs par byas te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o // sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du bya ba nas rdzogs par byas te /
translated: This is the second liberation.

original: gnas pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third liberation is the pleasant liberation, which is the bodily realization of the liberation of the pleasant.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth liberation is the sphere of infinite space.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth liberation is the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched ni drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth liberation is the sphere of nothingness.

original: yod min med min skye mched ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: yod min med min skye mched ni bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh liberation is the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth liberation is the attainment of cessation.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched ni brgyad de /
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched ni brgyad de /
translated: There are eight spheres of mastery.

original: nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung ngu kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams la lta zhing gzugs de dag zil gyi mnan nas shes /
analyzed: nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung ngu kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams la lta zhing gzugs de dag zil gyi mnan nas shes /
translated: The first sphere of mastery is when one with the internal perception of form sees small external forms of good and bad color, and having mastered those forms,

original: zil gyis mnan nas mthong ste /
analyzed: zil gyis mnan nas mthong ste /
translated: one sees them having mastered them.

original: de ltar 'du shes pa 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mche dang po'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'du shes pa 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mche dang po'o //
translated: This perception is the first sphere of mastery.

original: gzugs chen po la yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: gzugs chen po la yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The same is true for large forms.

original: 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung ngu kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams la lta zhing gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung ngu kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams la lta zhing gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes /
translated: With the perception of the internal as formless, one sees external forms, small, beautiful and ugly, and one knows those forms to be overcome.

original: zil gyis mnan nas mthong ste /
analyzed: zil gyis mnan nas mthong ste /
translated: One sees them to be overcome.

original: de ltar 'du shes pa de ni zil gyis mnan pa'i skye mched gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'du shes pa de ni zil gyis mnan pa'i skye mched gsum pa'o //
translated: The perception of that is the third sphere of mastery.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chen po kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams la lta zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chen po kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams la lta zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: With the perception of the internal as formless, one sees external forms, large, beautiful and ugly, and one knows those forms to be overcome.

original: bzhi ni sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dag go //
analyzed: bzhi ni sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dag go //
translated: The four are blue, yellow, red and white.

original: zad par gyi skye mched ni zad par sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dag go //🔽ting nge 'dzin ni dpa' bar 'gro ba la @63a * //
analyzed: zad par gyi skye mched ni zad par sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dag go // ting nge 'dzin ni dpa' bar 'gro ba la @63a * //
translated: The bases of mastery are the bases of mastery over earth, water, fire, wind, blue, yellow, red, white, infinite space, and infinite consciousness.

original: sogs pa dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The meditative absorptions are the meditative absorptions of the heroic walk, etc., which are immeasurable.

original: mthu dang che ba'i bdag nyid la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: mthu dang che ba'i bdag nyid la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between power and greatness?

original: mthu ni rang gi rten la yod pa'o //
analyzed: mthu ni rang gi rten la yod pa'o //
translated: Power is the possession of something in oneself.

original: che ba'i bdag nyid ni mthu dang ldan pa gzhan dag la pan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: che ba'i bdag nyid ni mthu dang ldan pa gzhan dag la pan par byed pa'o //
translated: Greatness is the benefit that one gives to others through one's power.🔽The chapter on power is completed.

original: mthu'i skabs rdzogs so /🔽// / mthu'i 'og tu yongs su smin pa'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: mthu'i skabs rdzogs so / // / mthu'i 'og tu yongs su smin pa'i skabs yin te /
translated: The chapter on maturity is completed.

original: de'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the connection between the chapter on power and the chapter on maturity?🔽It was said previously:

original: sngar / rgya che'i phyir dang zab pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sngar / rgya che'i phyir dang zab pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of its vastness and profundity,

original: yongs su smin dang rnam mi rtog //
analyzed: yongs su smin dang rnam mi rtog //
translated: there is maturity and nonimagination.

original: de phyir 'di las gnyis bstan te //
analyzed: de phyir 'di las gnyis bstan te //
translated: Therefore, two things are taught here:

original: de ni bla na med pa'i thabs //
analyzed: de ni bla na med pa'i thabs //
translated: That is the unsurpassed method.

original: zhes bshad pas mthu rgya chen po bstan pa mthong bas ni sems can rnams yongs su smin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bshad pas mthu rgya chen po bstan pa mthong bas ni sems can rnams yongs su smin par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, sentient beings are matured by seeing the teaching of extensive power.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu mthong nas de la mos pa rnams de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu mthong nas de la mos pa rnams de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bad do //
translated: Having seen the power of the bodhisattva, those who aspire to it strive to attain it.

original: zab mo bstan pas ni rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: zab mo bstan pas ni rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: By the teaching of the profound, there is non-conceptuality.

original: de dag gis go rims bzhin du sems can rnams yongs su smin pa dang / bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed do zhes de skad du bshad do //
analyzed: de dag gis go rims bzhin du sems can rnams yongs su smin pa dang / bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed do zhes de skad du bshad do //
translated: Thus, they mature sentient beings and mature the Buddha qualities in themselves, respectively.

original: de'i phyir mthu'i 'og tu yongs su smin pa'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthu'i 'og tu yongs su smin pa'i skabs yin no //
translated: Therefore, after power, the stage of maturity is explained.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na yongs su mi skyo ba'i thabs mthu bshad ma thag pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na yongs su mi skyo ba'i thabs mthu bshad ma thag pa yin te /
translated: Or, the method of non-exhaustion is the power just explained.

original: 'khor ba'i log par bsgrub pa dang / sdug bsngal dag gis mi skyo ba'i dus ring por sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa na dag pa'i chos rnams kyis 'phel bar 'gyur bas de'i 'og tu dge ba 'phel ba'i thabs yongs su smin pa'i skabs yin no ;
analyzed: 'khor ba'i log par bsgrub pa dang / sdug bsngal dag gis mi skyo ba'i dus ring por sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa na dag pa'i chos rnams kyis 'phel bar 'gyur bas de'i 'og tu dge ba 'phel ba'i thabs yongs su smin pa'i skabs yin no ;
translated: The method of increasing virtue is the occasion of complete maturation, because one is not discouraged by the errors of cyclic existence or by suffering, and because one increases in the pure qualities while developing the qualities of buddhahood and bringing sentient beings to full maturity.

original: / spong ba'i yan lag rnams dang ldan pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / spong ba'i yan lag rnams dang ldan pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The bodhisattva is endowed with the limbs of abandonment.

original: spong ba'i yan lag ni lnga ste /
analyzed: spong ba'i yan lag ni lnga ste /
translated: The limbs of abandonment are five:

original: dad pa dang / g-yo med pa dang / sgyu med pa nyid dang / nad nyung ba dang / shes rab bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa dang / g-yo med pa dang / sgyu med pa nyid dang / nad nyung ba dang / shes rab bsgom pa'o //
translated: faith, absence of deceit, absence of pretense, few desires, and cultivation of wisdom.

original: nyon mongs pa sel ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i zhi ba zhes bya ba ni sdom pa nod pa'i dus nas bzung ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa sel ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i zhi ba zhes bya ba ni sdom pa nod pa'i dus nas bzung ste /
translated: The bodhisattva’s abandonment of afflictions is called “peace.”

original: dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa la sogs pas tshogs kyi lam dang / sbyor ba dang / mthong ba dang / sgom pa dang / mthar thug pa'i lam dag gis 'dod pa'i gnod sems la sogs pa nyon mongs rnams rab tu zhi ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa la sogs pas tshogs kyi lam dang / sbyor ba dang / mthong ba dang / sgom pa dang / mthar thug pa'i lam dag gis 'dod pa'i gnod sems la sogs pa nyon mongs rnams rab tu zhi ba ste /
translated: By means of the path of accumulation, the path of preparation, the path of seeing, the path of cultivation, and the path of conclusion, the bodhisattvas completely pacify the afflictions such as malice in the desire realm,

original: byang @63b chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin pas dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa la rab tu zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang @63b chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin pas dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa la rab tu zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: because the afflictions of the bodhisattvas are conceptualizations. The abandonment of the afflictions that are conceptualizations of things and nonthings is called complete pacification.

original: rang bzhin snying brtse ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang bzhin snying brtse ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Natural compassion.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rigs bzung ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rigs bzung ste /
translated: The word “natural” refers to the spiritual gene.

original: ji skad du byang chub sems dpa'i sa las /
analyzed: ji skad du byang chub sems dpa'i sa las /
translated: As the Bodhisattva Levels says,

original: rigs dang khams dang sa bon dang // rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rigs dang khams dang sa bon dang // rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: “Gene, element, seed, and nature are synonyms.”

original: rang bzhin brtan pa zhes bya ba 'dir yang rang bzhin zhes smos pas ni bzod pa'i rigs bzung ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin brtan pa zhes bya ba 'dir yang rang bzhin zhes smos pas ni bzod pa'i rigs bzung ste /
translated: Here, the term “natural” refers to the family of patience.

original: las dang po pa bzod pa dang ldan pa'i chos dag ma thos par gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni rigs kyi stobs kyis yin no //
analyzed: las dang po pa bzod pa dang ldan pa'i chos dag ma thos par gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni rigs kyi stobs kyis yin no //
translated: The patience of one who is a beginner and who possesses the Dharma, but who has not yet heard the Dharma of patience, is the patience of one who endures harm without any thought of retaliation.🔽This patience is due to the power of the family.

original: so sor brtags pa ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ni shes rab ste /
translated: Discernment is wisdom.🔽The patience of one who possesses the Dharma of wisdom is the patience of one who, having analyzed the Dharma of patience with wisdom, then endures the harm inflicted by sentient beings.

original: shes rab kyis bzod pa dang ldan pa'i chos rnams dpyad cing dpyad nas de'i 'og tu sems can dag las mi 'dod pa 'bab pa la sogs pa bzod pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi stobs kyis yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyis bzod pa dang ldan pa'i chos rnams dpyad cing dpyad nas de'i 'og tu sems can dag las mi 'dod pa 'bab pa la sogs pa bzod pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi stobs kyis yin no //
translated: This patience is due to the power of wisdom.

original: de'i 'og tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs na bsgom pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs na bsgom pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: After that, in the state of meditative equipoise, it is due to the power of meditation.

original: dran pa dang shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa la yid gzhungs pa zhes bya ba'i chos gdags so //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa la yid gzhungs pa zhes bya ba'i chos gdags so //
translated: The Dharma that is designated as “intelligence” is the association of mindfulness and wisdom.

original: yang na 'di ltar gsung rab las yid gzhungs pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi rnam grangs su 'byung bas yid gzhungs pa zhes bya ba 'di ni shes rab kyi rnam grangs kho na yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'di ltar gsung rab las yid gzhungs pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi rnam grangs su 'byung bas yid gzhungs pa zhes bya ba 'di ni shes rab kyi rnam grangs kho na yin te /
translated: Or else, since the scriptures state that “intellect” is a synonym for wisdom, this “intellect” is a synonym for wisdom.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo gzhan las shes rab kyi dbang du mdzad nas shes rab dang / shes rab gsal ba dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / mkhas pa zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo gzhan las shes rab kyi dbang du mdzad nas shes rab dang / shes rab gsal ba dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / mkhas pa zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the Bhagavān, in another sūtra, said, “Wisdom, clear wisdom, intellect, and skill are synonyms for wisdom.”

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab skye bar rung ba nyid ni yid gzhungs pa'i las so zhes brjod pa gang yin pa der ni de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa'i shes rab bskal pa grangs med pa dang po la nges par skyes pa gang yin pa de
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab skye bar rung ba nyid ni yid gzhungs pa'i las so zhes brjod pa gang yin pa der ni de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa'i shes rab bskal pa grangs med pa dang po la nges par skyes pa gang yin pa de
translated: The statement “The function of intellect is to make supramundane wisdom arise” means that the wisdom that does not realize reality, which definitely arises in the first incalculable eon,

original: la yid gzhungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: la yid gzhungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: is called “intellect.”

original: yid gzhungs pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab skye bar rung @64a * //
analyzed: yid gzhungs pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab skye bar rung @64a * //
translated: And that wisdom which is the nature of mental agility is also suitable to generate supramundane wisdom.

original: ba yin pas de ni de'i las su bstan te chos de nyid //
analyzed: ba yin pas de ni de'i las su bstan te chos de nyid //
translated: Therefore, it is taught as the action of that.

original: chos de nyid kyi las su ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: chos de nyid kyi las su ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can it be the action of that reality?

original: tshul 'dis nyes pa med do //
analyzed: tshul 'dis nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in this method.

original: nam bdud kyis bar chad bya mi nus zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i gnas skabs na byang chub sems dpa' shes rab can chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba la /
analyzed: nam bdud kyis bar chad bya mi nus zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i gnas skabs na byang chub sems dpa' shes rab can chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba la /
translated: When a demon cannot create an obstacle means that when a wise bodhisattva who is following the Dharma in the states of listening, reflection and meditation,

original: gang gi tshe bdud byang chub sems dpa' dang skal pa 'dra ba lta bu nye bar 'ong bas bar chad bya bar mi nus pa de'i tshe mi 'phrogs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdud byang chub sems dpa' dang skal pa 'dra ba lta bu nye bar 'ong bas bar chad bya bar mi nus pa de'i tshe mi 'phrogs pa nyid yin te /
translated: a demon who is like a bodhisattva in fortune cannot create an obstacle by approaching and at that time, it is unassailable.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su smin pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su smin pa yin no //
translated: It is fully matured by nature.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yongs su smin pa'i skabs so /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yongs su smin pa'i skabs so /
translated: This is the chapter on the bodhisattva's full maturation.

original: // / byang chub sems dpa' yongs su smin pa'i 'og tu sems can yongs su smin pa ste /
analyzed: // / byang chub sems dpa' yongs su smin pa'i 'og tu sems can yongs su smin pa ste /
translated: After the bodhisattva has matured himself, he brings beings to full maturity.

original: 'di'i 'brel pa yang de nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel pa yang de nyid yin la /
translated: The connection is the same as before.

original: bdag yongs su smin pas kyang /
analyzed: bdag yongs su smin pas kyang /
translated: And because he has matured himself,

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed par rung ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed par rung ba yin no //
translated: he is fit to bring beings to full maturity.🔽Thus, on this basis, he shows the pacification of the two extremes,

original: de bzhin rten 'dir phyogs gnyis zhi ba dang // de bzhin spyad pa nyid du smin pa bstan //
analyzed: de bzhin rten 'dir phyogs gnyis zhi ba dang // de bzhin spyad pa nyid du smin pa bstan //
translated: and the maturation of practice itself.🔽The pacification of the two extremes is the pacification of the two extremes of existence and nonexistence.

original: zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du mi mthun pa zhi ba dang / gnyen po sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du mi mthun pa zhi ba dang / gnyen po sbyar ba'o //
translated: The maturation of practice itself is the application of the antidote.

original: phyi rol pa'i yongs su smin pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir mchog tu smin par byed pa ni rab tu smin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi yongs su smin pa la yongs su smin pa khyad par du 'phags pa yin no
analyzed: phyi rol pa'i yongs su smin pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir mchog tu smin par byed pa ni rab tu smin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi yongs su smin pa la yongs su smin pa khyad par du 'phags pa yin no
translated: The most excellent maturation is the maturation that is superior to the maturation of the non Buddhists.

original: // 'tsham par smin par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa spyod pa rnams la mi sdug pa la sogs pa ston pas so //
analyzed: // 'tsham par smin par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa spyod pa rnams la mi sdug pa la sogs pa ston pas so //
translated: The phrase bringing to maturity in a suitable manner means that the Buddha teaches the meditation on foulness, etc., to those who are engaged in the practice of passion, etc.

original: rtogs pas smin par byed pa ni rtogs pa smin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni ched kyi don du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pas smin par byed pa ni rtogs pa smin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni ched kyi don du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The phrase bringing to maturity through realization means that the Buddha brings to maturity through realization. The word through has its usual meaning of cause.

original: dper na zas kyi snod ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na zas kyi snod ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the expression a pot of food means that the food is placed in the pot.

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa' de kho na nyid rtogs pas smin par byed pa ni rtogs pa smin par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpa' de kho na nyid rtogs pas smin par byed pa ni rtogs pa smin par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, the phrase bringing to maturity through realization means that the bodhisattva brings to maturity through his own realization of reality.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis rtag tu smin par byed pa ni rtag tu smin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni ming gi tshogs dang ; tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams kyi don phyin ci ma log par ston pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis rtag tu smin par byed pa ni rtag tu smin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni ming gi tshogs dang ; tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams kyi don phyin ci ma log par ston pa ste /
translated: The phrase bringing to maturity in a constant manner means that the Buddha brings to maturity in a constant manner through the Dharma teachings of the collections of names, words, and letters, which are not erroneous with regard to the meaning.

original: 'das pa dang / da ltar byung bas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan pa gang yin pa de la ming gi tshogs la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de dag gi don gdul ba'i skye bo la ltos @64b nas phyin ci ma log par bstan pa gang yin pa'i🔽don de rtag tu de kho na bzhin du rab tu bstan pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni rtag tu smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / da ltar byung bas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan pa gang yin pa de la ming gi tshogs la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de dag gi don gdul ba'i skye bo la ltos @64b nas phyin ci ma log par bstan pa gang yin pa'i don de rtag tu de kho na bzhin du rab tu bstan pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni rtag tu smin par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the constant ripening of sentient beings, because the meaning of those collections of names, etc., which exist in the teachings of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, whether past, present, or future, is always taught unerringly in relation to the disciples.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams la nam yang rtag pa dang bde ba la sogs par mngon par zhen nas phyin ci log tu ston par mi byed kyi //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams la nam yang rtag pa dang bde ba la sogs par mngon par zhen nas phyin ci log tu ston par mi byed kyi //
translated: Or, in another way, it is the constant ripening of sentient beings, because one never teaches falsely, having wrongly conceived the impermanent, painful, empty, and insubstantial natures of things as permanent, blissful, etc.

original: rtag tu mi rtag pa la sogs pa phyin ci ma log pa'i don rab tu ston pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pas rtag tu smin par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu mi rtag pa la sogs pa phyin ci ma log pa'i don rab tu ston pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pas rtag tu smin par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is ripening in the present because it causes the ripening of those who are vessels by means of the path of vision.🔽It is ripening in the highest degree because it causes the ripening of those who are vessels by means of the path of meditative development.🔽It is ripening in the future because it causes the ripening of those who are not yet vessels to become vessels by means of the factors that contribute to enlightenment.🔽It is ripening in the present because it causes the ripening of those who are vessels by means of the path of vision.🔽It is ripening in the highest degree because it causes the ripening of those who are vessels by means of the path of meditative development.

original: yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i don gyis gong nas gong du rim gyis smin par byed pa ni gong du smin par byed pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po la gnas pa dang / nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pa yongs su smin par bya ba dag sangs rgyas nyid dang /🔽dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i don gyis gong nas gong du rim gyis smin par byed pa ni gong du smin par byed pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po la gnas pa dang / nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pa yongs su smin par bya ba dag sangs rgyas nyid dang / dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa ste /
translated: It is ripening in the future because it causes the ripening of those who are not yet vessels to become vessels by means of the factors that contribute to enlightenment.🔽It is ripening in the present because it causes the ripening of those who are vessels by means of the path of vision.🔽It is ripening in the highest degree because it causes the ripening of those who are vessels by means of the path of meditative development.

original: de dag gis yongs su smin pa gang yin pa de ni gong du 'gro ba'i phyir gong du smin par byed pa zhes bya'o //🔽de bzhin pha dang ma dang gnyen bshes rnams //
analyzed: de dag gis yongs su smin pa gang yin pa de ni gong du 'gro ba'i phyir gong du smin par byed pa zhes bya'o // de bzhin pha dang ma dang gnyen bshes rnams //
translated: It is ripening in the future because it causes the ripening of those who are not yet vessels to become vessels by means of the factors that contribute to enlightenment.🔽It is ripening in the present because it causes the ripening of those who are vessels by means of the path of vision.🔽It is ripening in the highest degree because it causes the ripening of those who are vessels by means of the path of meditative development.🔽It is ripening in the future because it causes the ripening of those who are not yet vessels to become vessels by means of the factors that contribute to enlightenment.🔽It is ripening in the present because it causes the ripening of those who are vessels by means of the path of vision.🔽It is ripening in the highest degree because it causes the ripening of those who are vessels by means of the path of meditative development.

original: bu dang gnyen pa rnams la legs mi gnas //
analyzed: bu dang gnyen pa rnams la legs mi gnas //
translated: It is ripening in the future because it causes the ripening of those who are not yet vessels to become vessels by means of the factors that contribute to enlightenment.🔽It is ripening in the

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la legs par gnas pa de ltar pha dang ma dag kyang bu rnams la legs par mi gnas la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la legs par gnas pa de ltar pha dang ma dag kyang bu rnams la legs par mi gnas la /
translated: This is how the bodhisattva is well-situated with regard to sentient beings, but parents are not well-situated with regard to their children, and friends are not well-situated with regard to their friends.

original: de ltar gnyen bshes rnams kyang gnyen pa dag la legs par mi gnas so zhes de skad du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gnyen bshes rnams kyang gnyen pa dag la legs par mi gnas so zhes de skad du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This is how the application is to be made.🔽The world is attached to itself, but it is applied to what is not beneficial and not pleasurable.

original: 'jig rten bdag la byams pa ni bdag nyid la phan pa ma yin pa dang bde ba ma yin par sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni rmongs pa ni bdag nyid bde bar bya'o snyam nas ma byin par len pa la sogs pa la rab tu sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten bdag la byams pa ni bdag nyid la phan pa ma yin pa dang bde ba ma yin par sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni rmongs pa ni bdag nyid bde bar bya'o snyam nas ma byin par len pa la sogs pa la rab tu sbyar ro //
translated: The fool thinks, “I will be happy,” and applies himself to taking what is not given, etc.

original: de'i ma byin par len pa la sogs pa de yang tshe phyi ma la ngan 'gror khrid par byed pa yin pas phan pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i ma byin par len pa la sogs pa de yang tshe phyi ma la ngan 'gror khrid par byed pa yin pas phan pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: But that taking what is not given, etc. leads to the lower realms in the next life, and so is not beneficial.

original: de ltar na 'jig rten ni bdag nyid phan pa ma yin pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten ni bdag nyid phan pa ma yin pa la sbyor ro //
translated: Thus the world is applied to what is not beneficial for itself.

original: de'i rkyen gyis 'di nyid la gsad pa dang / bcing ba dang / brdeg pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa de ni de'i bde ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis 'di nyid la gsad pa dang / bcing ba dang / brdeg pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa de ni de'i bde ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the suffering that is killing, binding, beating, etc. in this life is not happiness for him.

original: yang na mu stegs can gyi lta ba brten pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na mu stegs can gyi lta ba brten pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or, because of relying on the views of the tīrthikas,

original: kun tu gdung ba dang / yongs su gdung ba dang / mer 'jug pa dang // zas @65a * //
analyzed: kun tu gdung ba dang / yongs su gdung ba dang / mer 'jug pa dang // zas @65a * //
translated: such as the practice of self-mortification, complete mortification, entering fire,

original: mi za ba la sogs pa bsten pas 'di nyid la sdug bsngal 'thob po //
analyzed: mi za ba la sogs pa bsten pas 'di nyid la sdug bsngal 'thob po //
translated: and fasting, one obtains suffering in this life.

original: de'i phyir bde ba ma yin pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba ma yin pa la sbyor ro //
translated: Therefore, one is joined to what is not happiness.

original: de'i rkyen gyis ngan 'gror 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni phan pa yin pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis ngan 'gror 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni phan pa yin pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: The condition for that is going to a bad rebirth, which is joining to what is not beneficial.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni pha dang / ma dang / gnyen bshes kyi bsam pa bas khyad par du 'phags pa'i bsam pas bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / grang ba dang / tsha ba la sogs pa srog la 'bab pa'i sdug bsngal yang brtsis la ma chags par go cha dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni pha dang / ma dang / gnyen bshes kyi bsam pa bas khyad par du 'phags pa'i bsam pas bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / grang ba dang / tsha ba la sogs pa srog la 'bab pa'i sdug bsngal yang brtsis la ma chags par go cha dang /
translated: Bodhisattvas, with a motivation that is superior to that of parents, relatives and friends, put on the armor of not being attached to their lives, disregarding the sufferings of hunger, thirst, cold, heat and so on.

original: sbyor ba dang / mi 'gong ba dang / mi 'khrug pa dang / chog mi shes pa'i brtson 'grus kyis bdag la mi lta ba sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba la sogs pas sems can rnams kyis ji ltar bsams pa'i don yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir bde ba'i bsam pa can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / mi 'gong ba dang / mi 'khrug pa dang / chog mi shes pa'i brtson 'grus kyis bdag la mi lta ba sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba la sogs pas sems can rnams kyis ji ltar bsams pa'i don yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir bde ba'i bsam pa can zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is endowed with a superior intention, which is superior to the intention of a father, mother, relatives, and friends. He is endowed with a blissful intention, because he is not attached to the suffering of life, such as hunger, thirst, cold, heat, etc., and he is not discouraged by the armor, application, non-discouragement, non-agitation, and non-satisfaction of striving. He is endowed with a beneficial intention, because he is not concerned with himself, and he fulfills the aims of beings just as they desire, through generosity, agreeable speech, etc.

original: de'i 'og tu bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyis bsdus nas bstan pa la 'dzud pa dang / rab tu byung ba la sogs pa phan pa la sbyor ba'i phyir phan pa'i bsam pa can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyis bsdus nas bstan pa la 'dzud pa dang / rab tu byung ba la sogs pa phan pa la sbyor ba'i phyir phan pa'i bsam pa can zhes bya'o //
translated: After that, he is endowed with a beneficial intention, because he is engaged in benefiting them through the means of gathering, by gathering them with the four means of gathering, by introducing them to the teaching, and by engaging them in renunciation, etc.

original: rang gi lus dang longs spyod thams cad sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi lus dang longs spyod thams cad sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase all one's body and possessions means

original: go dang / rkang pa dang / lag pa dang / mig dang / sha dang / khrag dang / tshil dang / rkang la sogs pa sbyin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: go dang / rkang pa dang / lag pa dang / mig dang / sha dang / khrag dang / tshil dang / rkang la sogs pa sbyin pa'i phyir /
translated: that one gives one's body, feet, hands, eyes, flesh, blood, bones, and marrow, and so on.

original: rang gi lus thams cad sbyin pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi lus thams cad sbyin pa yin no //
translated: One gives all one's body, because one gives one's body.

original: nor dang / 'bru dang / mdzod dang / bang mdzod dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / rgyan dang / glang po che dang / rta dang / bu dang / bran la sogs pa sbyin pa'i phyir longs spyod thams cad sbyin pa yin no //
analyzed: nor dang / 'bru dang / mdzod dang / bang mdzod dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / rgyan dang / glang po che dang / rta dang / bu dang / bran la sogs pa sbyin pa'i phyir longs spyod thams cad sbyin pa yin no //
translated: One gives all one's possessions, because one gives one's wealth, grain, treasuries, storehouses, jewels, pearls, ornaments, elephants, horses, sons, servants, and so on.

original: mi mnyam pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang ngoms pa med par sbyin pas so zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa las tshig gang dang gang gis bstan zhe na /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang ngoms pa med par sbyin pas so zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa las tshig gang dang gang gis bstan zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the verse that begins, Because of giving without discrimination and giving without satiation?🔽 The phrase one is never satiated with the good qualities of giving equally means

original: mnyam par sbyin pa'i yon tan ngoms par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mnyam par sbyin pa'i yon tan ngoms par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: that one is never satiated with the good qualities of giving equally.

original: mi mnyam pa med par sbyin pa nyid dang / ngoms pa med par sbyin pa nyid gang dag yin pa de dag ni sbyin pa'i yon tan yin no //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa med par sbyin pa nyid dang / ngoms pa med par sbyin pa nyid gang dag yin pa de dag ni sbyin pa'i yon tan yin no //
translated: The qualities of generosity are the very generosity that is not unequal and the very generosity that is not satisfied.

original: mi mnyam pa med par sbyin pa ni snying rjes snod kyi khyad par la mi lta ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa med par sbyin pa ni snying rjes snod kyi khyad par la mi lta ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la phan 'dogs pas te zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa'i tshig / phan 'dogs rnam pa gnyis kyis gzhan smin byed // ces bya ba 'dis bstan to //
