original: rtag pa zhes bya bas ni brtan pa'i tshul khrims ston te /🔽yang dag @65b par blang ba len pa gang yin pa de dus thams cad du rjes su 'jug cing srog la bab kyang yongs su mi gtong bas de'i phyir bstan pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya bas ni brtan pa'i tshul khrims ston te /🔽yang dag @65b par blang ba len pa gang yin pa de dus thams cad du rjes su 'jug cing srog la bab kyang yongs su mi gtong bas de'i phyir bstan pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: It is shown that it is helpful in both lives by the verse,🔽It

original: rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims la shin tu goms pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims can du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims la shin tu goms pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims can du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Natural morality is the morality of one who becomes naturally moral through being accustomed to morality.

original: so sor brtags shing so sor brtags nas tshul khrims yang dag par len pa la 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: so sor brtags shing so sor brtags nas tshul khrims yang dag par len pa la 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: He does not engage in the correct practice of morality after having examined and examined.

original: gzhan la tshe phyi ma la phan 'dogs pa ni rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i yon tan dag brgyud pas byed de /
analyzed: gzhan la tshe phyi ma la phan 'dogs pa ni rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i yon tan dag brgyud pas byed de /
translated: The benefit to others in a future life is accomplished through the qualities of evolutionary development and natural outcome.🔽The qualities of evolutionary development and natural outcome are uninterrupted because they are mutually supportive.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa dag phan tshul mthun pas rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar tshul khrims dang ldan pa de bde 'gror skye ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa dag phan tshul mthun pas rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar tshul khrims dang ldan pa de bde 'gror skye ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The qualities of evolutionary development and natural outcome are mutually supportive because the one who is moral is reborn in a good destiny, which is the result of evolutionary development.

original: de sngon goms pa'i dbang gis yang dang yang du tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa la 'jug pa ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de sngon goms pa'i dbang gis yang dang yang du tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa la 'jug pa ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: And through the power of previous practice, he again and again engages in the correct practice of morality, which is the result of natural outcome.

original: rgyu mthun rgyu dang 'dra ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mthun rgyu dang 'dra ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “The natural outflow is similar to the cause.”

original: de nas shi 'phos nas yang goms pa'i dbang gis tshe rabs gzhan dag tu de kho na bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir brgyud pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos nas yang goms pa'i dbang gis tshe rabs gzhan dag tu de kho na bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir brgyud pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Then, after death, one enters again in the same way in other lives, through the power of habit. Thus, it is a continuum.

original: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa dag phan tshun mthun pas rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa dag phan tshun mthun pas rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the natural outflow and the maturation of action are mutually consistent, the continuum is uninterrupted.

original: brtson 'grus mchog la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brtson 'grus mchog la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “With supreme effort”

original: brtson 'grus chen po la zhes bya ba'i don ston to //
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen po la zhes bya ba'i don ston to //
translated: shows the meaning of “with great effort.”

original: gzhan gyi sems dge ba gcig gi phyir yang zhes bya ba ni gal te gzhan bskal pa bye ba stong gis dge ba'i sems gcig skyed par byed na yang des kyang byang chub sems dpa' la skyo ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems dge ba gcig gi phyir yang zhes bya ba ni gal te gzhan bskal pa bye ba stong gis dge ba'i sems gcig skyed par byed na yang des kyang byang chub sems dpa' la skyo ba med pa'o //
translated: “Even for the sake of a single virtuous thought in another” means that even if another generates a single virtuous thought after a thousand million eons, the bodhisattva is not discouraged.

original: zang zing med pa gzhan gyis mchod 'dod pa //
analyzed: zang zing med pa gzhan gyis mchod 'dod pa //
translated: “Without material reward, desiring only to worship others”

original: thams cad nges par bcom pa zhes bya ba ni 'di snyam du gzhan dag bdag la mchod pa dang bkur sti la sogs pa byed par 'gyur bas de'i phyir bdag gis bsgrim par bya'o snyam du mi sems kyi /
analyzed: thams cad nges par bcom pa zhes bya ba ni 'di snyam du gzhan dag bdag la mchod pa dang bkur sti la sogs pa byed par 'gyur bas de'i phyir bdag gis bsgrim par bya'o snyam du mi sems kyi /
translated: The phrase having destroyed all means that he does not think, I will strive for the sake of others' worship, honor, etc. of me.

original: zang zing med pa'i sems mchod pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa dang bral bas yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i sems mchod pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa dang bral bas yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: He ripens them with a disinterested mind, free of desire for worship and honor.

original: de nyid kyi don gyi tshul ni don dam pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi don gyi tshul ni don dam pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The method of that very meaning is the method of the ultimate.

original: dgongs don tshul ni dgongs pa'i don gyi tshul lo //
analyzed: dgongs don tshul ni dgongs pa'i don gyi tshul lo //
translated: The method of the meaning of the intention is the method of the meaning of the intention.

original: yongs su smin pa'i skabs so /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i skabs so /
translated: This concludes the section on complete ripening.

original: // / yongs su smin pa'i 'og tu thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
analyzed: // / yongs su smin pa'i 'og tu thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
translated: After complete ripening comes omniscience.

original: de'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is its connection?

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs yongs su smin pa ni @66a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs yongs su smin pa ni @66a * //
translated: The bodhisattva, whose collection of roots of virtue is completely ripened in this way,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la reg par 'gyur bas de'i phyir de'i 'og tu byang chub kyi skabs yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la reg par 'gyur bas de'i phyir de'i 'og tu byang chub kyi skabs yin no //
translated: and he will touch the supreme enlightenment. Therefore, the chapter on enlightenment comes next.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na bslab pa'i dmigs pa rang dang gzhan gyi don la sogs pa dngos po bdun pa bshad de /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na bslab pa'i dmigs pa rang dang gzhan gyi don la sogs pa dngos po bdun pa bshad de /
translated: In another way, the seven topics of the aim of self and others, etc. are explained as the object of the training.

original: 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems kyis byang chub don du gnyer ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems kyis byang chub don du gnyer ro //
translated: Thus, one strives for enlightenment through the thought of enlightenment.

original: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: In order to benefit self and others.

original: de'i phyir rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi skabs yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi skabs yin no //
translated: Therefore, the chapter on the aim of self and others comes next.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don la zhugs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med par bya dgos pas de'i 'og tu kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs de kho na nyid kyi skabs bshad do //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don la zhugs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med par bya dgos pas de'i 'og tu kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs de kho na nyid kyi skabs bshad do //
translated: One who is engaged in the aim of self and others must be free from defilement. Therefore, the chapter on the means of being free from defilement, i.e. reality, comes next.

original: de'i 'og tu gdul ba'i sems can gyi don du yongs su mi skyo ba'i thabs mthu'i skabs bshad do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gdul ba'i sems can gyi don du yongs su mi skyo ba'i thabs mthu'i skabs bshad do //
translated: After that, the chapter on the means of not being wearied in the service of sentient beings to be trained, i.e. power, is explained.

original: de kho na nyid dang mthu 'di dag kho nas go rims bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid dang mthu 'di dag kho nas go rims bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur te /
translated: By means of these two, reality and power, the bodhisattva’s buddha qualities and the beings’ evolution are brought to perfection, respectively.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i bdag yongs su smin pa dga' ba la sogs pa rnam pa dgu po shin tu chen por 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i bdag yongs su smin pa dga' ba la sogs pa rnam pa dgu po shin tu chen por 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva’s own perfection is the realization of reality, which is the nine aspects of joy, etc., in their highest form.

original: de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the non-realization of reality.

original: mthu dang ldan pa yongs su skyo ba med pas sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur gyi mthu dang mi ldan pas ni ma yin pas de'i phyir yongs su skyo ba med pa'i thabs mthu bshad do //
analyzed: mthu dang ldan pa yongs su skyo ba med pas sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur gyi mthu dang mi ldan pas ni ma yin pas de'i phyir yongs su skyo ba med pa'i thabs mthu bshad do //
translated: The beings’ evolution is brought to perfection by the powerful one, who is not wearied, but not by the powerless one. Therefore, the means of non-wearying is taught as power.

original: de ltar bdag dang sems can yongs su smin par byas nas tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa de de'i rjes la bde blag tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bas yongs su smin pa'i 'og tu byang chub🔽kyi skabs so //
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang sems can yongs su smin par byas nas tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa de de'i rjes la bde blag tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bas yongs su smin pa'i 'og tu byang chub kyi skabs so //
translated: The Chapter on Enlightenment

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don la sogs pa dngos po bzhi ni rgyur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don la sogs pa dngos po bzhi ni rgyur gyur pa yin no //
translated: The four things such as benefit for oneself and others are the causes.

original: byang chub ni 'bras bur gyur pa yin no //🔽de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams dngos po bzhi pa la ni rgyu nyid du dmigs la /
analyzed: byang chub ni 'bras bur gyur pa yin no // de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams dngos po bzhi pa la ni rgyu nyid du dmigs la /
translated: Enlightenment is the result.

original: lnga pa ni 'bras bu nyid du dmigs te /
analyzed: lnga pa ni 'bras bu nyid du dmigs te /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattvas observe the four things as causes and the fifth as a result.

original: de bas na go rims kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //🔽bskal mchog dus ring 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bas na go rims kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no // bskal mchog dus ring 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Hence, the order is irreproachable.🔽The verse states, “The supreme eon is long, and the world is.”

original: mchog ces bya ba'i sgra ni bskal pa chen po bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba'i sgra ni bskal pa chen po bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “supreme” refers to a great eon.

original: bskal pa mchog de dag dus ring por 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: bskal pa mchog de dag dus ring por 'gro ba ste /
translated: Those supreme eons are long for beings.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: by three incalculable eons.

original: ring @66b zhes bya ba ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ring @66b zhes bya ba ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Long means that three incalculable eons are taken.

original: gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid mthu dang bcas pa la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid mthu dang bcas pa la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the nondual reality with its power.

original: sangs rgyas nyid ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: Buddhahood is not the reality of the imagined nature, which is the reality of existence.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis med pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the reality of the perfected nature, which is the reality of nonexistence.

original: rin po che'i 'byung gnas lta bu nyid ni mthu yin no //
analyzed: rin po che'i 'byung gnas lta bu nyid ni mthu yin no //
translated: The source of jewels is its power.

original: de bzhin nyid tha dad pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas nyid kyang de rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyang sangs rgyas nyid yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid ni chos thams cad kyi rjes su song ba yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid tha dad pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas nyid kyang de rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyang sangs rgyas nyid yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid ni chos thams cad kyi rjes su song ba yin la /
translated: Because suchness is not a different nature, and because buddhahood is distinguished by the purification of that, all things are buddhahood. Suchness is the universal essence of all things.

original: chos dang chos can dag kyang tha mi dad pas de'i phyir chos thams cad sangs rgyas nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: chos dang chos can dag kyang tha mi dad pas de'i phyir chos thams cad sangs rgyas nyid du brjod do //
translated: And because the thing and its essence are not different, therefore all things are said to be buddhahood.

original: de dag gis de bstan par bya ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis de bstan par bya ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And they are not even taught by that, because the imagined natures of the perfections, etc. are not fully established.

original: gdul ba'i rgyud kyi zhing la dge ba'i lo thog rnams zhes bya ba ni der rab tu bskrun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gdul ba'i rgyud kyi zhing la dge ba'i lo thog rnams zhes bya ba ni der rab tu bskrun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In the field of the continuum of those to be trained, the crops of virtue are planted there, and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas nyid de ni gdul ba'i zhing dag la dge ba'i chos kyi lo thog mngon par 'phel ba gang yin pa de'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid de ni gdul ba'i zhing dag la dge ba'i chos kyi lo thog mngon par 'phel ba gang yin pa de'i rgyu yin te /
translated: That buddhahood is the cause of the increase of the crop of virtue in the fields of those to be trained.

original: dge ba'i lo thog 'phel ba de ni de las rab tu skye'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i lo thog 'phel ba de ni de las rab tu skye'o //
translated: The increase of the crop of virtue is born from that.

original: skye dgu rnams la legs par bshad pa mi zad pa'i chos kyi char chen po 'bebs pas na zhes bya bar 'dir tshig rnam par sbyar bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: skye dgu rnams la legs par bshad pa mi zad pa'i chos kyi char chen po 'bebs pas na zhes bya bar 'dir tshig rnam par sbyar bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: The phrase “because he sends down the great rain of the inexhaustible Dharma of good explanations for living beings” should be understood as a compound in which the words are separated by other words.

original: skye dgu rnams la legs par bshad pa mi zad pa'i chos kyi char chen 'bebs pas na /
analyzed: skye dgu rnams la legs par bshad pa mi zad pa'i chos kyi char chen 'bebs pas na /
translated: The phrase “because he sends down the great rain of the inexhaustible Dharma of good explanations for living beings” is a compound in which the words are separated by other words.

original: zhes gang bshad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i bzhi cha 'di las chos kyi char zhes bya ba'i sgra dang / 'bebs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dang por 'byung la /
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i bzhi cha 'di las chos kyi char zhes bya ba'i sgra dang / 'bebs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dang por 'byung la /
translated: The words “rain of the Dharma” and “sends down” occur at the beginning of the verse.

original: legs bshad dang mi zad pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mjug nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: legs bshad dang mi zad pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mjug nas 'byung ngo //
translated: The words “good explanations” and “inexhaustible” occur at the end.

original: de la legs bshad dang / mi zad ces bya ba'i tshig dag ni dang por rig par bya la /
analyzed: de la legs bshad dang / mi zad ces bya ba'i tshig dag ni dang por rig par bya la /
translated: The words “well-explained” and “inexhaustible” should be known as the first [words of the verse].

original: ches kyi char dang 'bebs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra dag ni tha mar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ches kyi char dang 'bebs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra dag ni tha mar rig par bya'o //
translated: The words “rain of Dharma” and “to pour down” should be known as the last [words of the verse].

original: de ltar na skye dgu rnams la legs par bshad pa mi zad pa'i chos kyi char chen po 'bebs pas na zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na skye dgu rnams la legs par bshad pa mi zad pa'i chos kyi char chen po 'bebs pas na zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Thus, it is because he pours down the great rain of the inexhaustible Dharma, which is well-explained, to all living beings.

original: tshig rnam par sbyar ba 'dis mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig rnam par sbyar ba 'dis mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is how the words are to be connected.

original: de bzhin du /🔽rin chen chos rab che yangs 'byung phyir zhes bya ba de la yang @67a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du / rin chen chos rab che yangs 'byung phyir zhes bya ba de la yang @67a * //
translated: Similarly,

original: sbyar bar bya'o /
analyzed: sbyar bar bya'o /
translated: “because it is the source of the great, vast, precious Dharma,” should also be applied in the same way.

original: // / sangs rgyas nyid kyi ngo bo'i 'og tu skyabs bla na med pa'i khyad par ste /
analyzed: // / sangs rgyas nyid kyi ngo bo'i 'og tu skyabs bla na med pa'i khyad par ste /
translated: After the essence of Buddhahood, the distinctive feature of the unsurpassed refuge is taught.

original: 'di'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the connection here?

original: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
translated: It is explained like this:

original: mthu'i khyad par 'di lta bu dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das ni skyabs bla na med pa yin pas bla na med pa'i skyabs so //
analyzed: mthu'i khyad par 'di lta bu dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das ni skyabs bla na med pa yin pas bla na med pa'i skyabs so //
translated: Since the Blessed One, who possesses such distinctive power, is the unsurpassed refuge, he is the unsurpassed refuge.

original: gong du / theg pa mchog phyir dkon mchog skyabs rab song ba gang //
analyzed: gong du / theg pa mchog phyir dkon mchog skyabs rab song ba gang //
translated: The above verse says:🔽Those who go for refuge to the Three Jewels for the sake of the supreme vehicle

original: de nyid skyabs su song ba rnams kyi mchog ces bya //
analyzed: de nyid skyabs su song ba rnams kyi mchog ces bya //
translated: are the best of those who go for refuge.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang zag gi khyad par gyi sgo nas skyabs su 'gro ba bshad pa yin te /🔽gang zag 'jigs pas skrag pa gang dag ri la sogs pa la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i gang zag 'khor ba'i 'jigs pas skrag pa gang dag bdag nyid bskyab pa'i phyir dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i gang zag de dag pas byang chub sems dpa'i gang zag bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi don du gnyer ba gang zhig bdag
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang zag gi khyad par gyi sgo nas skyabs su 'gro ba bshad pa yin te / gang zag 'jigs pas skrag pa gang dag ri la sogs pa la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i gang zag 'khor ba'i 'jigs pas skrag pa gang dag bdag nyid bskyab pa'i phyir dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i gang zag de dag pas byang chub sems dpa'i gang zag bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi don du gnyer ba gang zhig bdag
translated: This explains going for refuge from the perspective of the individual.🔽Those individuals who are frightened by fear go for refuge to mountains and so on and those individuals of the sravaka and so on who are frightened by the fears of samsara go for refuge to the Three Jewels in order to protect themselves.

original: kyang sangs rgyas nyid thob nas skyabs su 'gro bar bya'o zhes de snyam du bsams nas dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba 'di nyid mchog yin no //
analyzed: kyang sangs rgyas nyid thob nas skyabs su 'gro bar bya'o zhes de snyam du bsams nas dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba 'di nyid mchog yin no //
translated: But those individuals who are bodhisattvas who strive for the state of buddhahood for their own sake and for the sake of others think, I will go for refuge to the Three Jewels with the thought that after attaining buddhahood, I will go for refuge to the Three Jewels and this is the best way to go for refuge.

original: skyabs kyi don ni skyob pa'i don yin pas /
analyzed: skyabs kyi don ni skyob pa'i don yin pas /
translated: The meaning of refuge is the meaning of protection.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'tshe ba gang dag las skyob pas skyabs bla na med pa yin pa dang / rgyu gang dag gis na skyabs ri la sogs pa bas skyabs bla na med pa yin pa de ston par byed do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'tshe ba gang dag las skyob pas skyabs bla na med pa yin pa dang / rgyu gang dag gis na skyabs ri la sogs pa bas skyabs bla na med pa yin pa de ston par byed do //
translated: Therefore, it shows that the Bhagavat is the unsurpassed refuge because he protects from all dangers, and by what causes he is the unsurpassed refuge, better than mountains, etc.

original: sngar ni skyabs su 'gro ba'i skabs kyis bsams so //
analyzed: sngar ni skyabs su 'gro ba'i skabs kyis bsams so //
translated: Previously, it was considered in terms of the occasion of going for refuge.

original: de ni byang chub kyi skabs kyis bsams te /
analyzed: de ni byang chub kyi skabs kyis bsams te /
translated: Now, it is considered in terms of the occasion of enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas nyid ni byang chub bla na med pa yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ni byang chub bla na med pa yin la /
translated: Buddhahood is unsurpassed enlightenment,

original: de yang skyabs thams cad pas skyabs gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: de yang skyabs thams cad pas skyabs gtso bo yin no //
translated: and that is the foremost refuge among all refuges.

original: rga dang 'chi ba dag las kyang //
analyzed: rga dang 'chi ba dag las kyang //
translated: From aging and death

original: zhes bya ba ni skye ba med par rga ba dang 'chi ba med do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye ba med par rga ba dang 'chi ba med do //
translated: means that without birth, there is no aging and death.

original: rga ba dang 'chi ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ni skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bshad do //
analyzed: rga ba dang 'chi ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ni skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bshad do //
translated: The terms aging and death explain the defilement of birth.

original: sna tshogs 'jig gyur 'jig tshogs kun dang theg pa dang // ngan song rnam mang sdug bsngal thabs min song ba rnams //
analyzed: sna tshogs 'jig gyur 'jig tshogs kun dang theg pa dang // ngan song rnam mang sdug bsngal thabs min song ba rnams //
translated: The various destructions, the perishing of all the world, the many lower realms, the sufferings, the wrong paths.

original: zhes bya ba ni long ba la sogs pa 'tshe ba sna tshogs dag dang / 'jigs pa'i bdag nyid lha dang mi la sogs pa thams cad las ni theg pa gnyis kyis yongs su skyob po //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni long ba la sogs pa 'tshe ba sna tshogs dag dang / 'jigs pa'i bdag nyid lha dang mi la sogs pa thams cad las ni theg pa gnyis kyis yongs su skyob po //
translated: He protects from the various dangers of the blind, etc. , and from all the fears of gods, men, etc. , by means of the two vehicles.

original: ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams ni theg pa dman pa las yongs su skyob po //🔽ngan song dag ni sdug bsngal rnam pa mang po yod pa @67b gang dag yin pa de dag las yongs su skyob pas na /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams ni theg pa dman pa las yongs su skyob po // ngan song dag ni sdug bsngal rnam pa mang po yod pa @67b gang dag yin pa de dag las yongs su skyob pas na /
translated: He protects the indefinite types from the Individual Vehicle.🔽He protects from the many kinds of suffering in the unfortunate realms.

original: ngan song rnam mang sdug bsngal las yongs su skyob pa'o //
analyzed: ngan song rnam mang sdug bsngal las yongs su skyob pa'o //
translated: He protects from the many kinds of suffering in the unfortunate realms.

original: thabs min song zhes bya ba ni thabs ma yin pa las yongs su skyob pa ste /
analyzed: thabs min song zhes bya ba ni thabs ma yin pa las yongs su skyob pa ste /
translated: He protects from the wrong means, i.e., he protects from the wrong means.

original: thabs ma yin pa las yongs su skyob pa nyid kyang mu stegs can gyi lta ba las slong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa las yongs su skyob pa nyid kyang mu stegs can gyi lta ba las slong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He protects from the wrong means because he rescues from the views of the heterodox.

original: dam pa'i chos la sems can gdul ba'i thabs mkhyen pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la sems can rnams 'dod chags spyod pa la sogs pa la mi sdug pa bstan pa la sogs pa rnam pa gang dang gang gis gdul bar
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la sems can gdul ba'i thabs mkhyen pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la sems can rnams 'dod chags spyod pa la sogs pa la mi sdug pa bstan pa la sogs pa rnam pa gang dang gang gis gdul bar
translated: Because of the knowledge of the means of training sentient beings in the true Dharma, he knows all the methods for training sentient beings in the well-spoken Dharma-Vinaya, by which means they are to be trained.

original: bya ba de thams cad dang ji lta ba bzhin mkhyen to //
analyzed: bya ba de thams cad dang ji lta ba bzhin mkhyen to //
translated: He knows exactly what is to be done, such as teaching the repulsive to those who indulge in desire.

original: thugs rjes pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thugs rjes bskul bas sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: thugs rjes pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thugs rjes bskul bas sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: Because of the perfection of compassion, he has attained the perfection of all the qualities of a Buddha, being urged on by compassion.

original: yang na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub brnyes pa'i phyir thugs rje'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub brnyes pa'i phyir thugs rje'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
translated: Or else, he has attained the perfection of compassion because he has attained unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: mthar phyin pa brnyes so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mthar phyin pa brnyes so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he has attained the perfection of the end.

original: 'jig rten ji srid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten ji srid ces bya ba ni /
translated: For as long as the world exists,

original: 'jig rten khams kyi mthar thug pa'i mtha' gang yin pa de skyabs sangs rgyas kyi mtha' yang de yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams kyi mthar thug pa'i mtha' gang yin pa de skyabs sangs rgyas kyi mtha' yang de yin no //
translated: The limit of the world is also the limit of the Buddha.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mtha' la ni mthar thug pa med pa la skyabs la yang mthar thug pa med pas sangs rgyas nyid de ni skyabs dpe med cing mchog yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mtha' la ni mthar thug pa med pa la skyabs la yang mthar thug pa med pas sangs rgyas nyid de ni skyabs dpe med cing mchog yin par 'dod do //
translated: Since the limit of the world is limitless, and since the limit of the refuge is also limitless, Buddhahood is considered to be the incomparable, supreme refuge.

original: de ni mi rtog ye shes lam gyis 'thob //🔽ces bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lam thob pas so //
analyzed: de ni mi rtog ye shes lam gyis 'thob // ces bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lam thob pas so //
translated: It is attained by the path of nonconceptual intuition.🔽It is attained by the path of the extremely pure supramundane intuition.

original: shin tu yul chen ye shes lam gyis thob //
analyzed: shin tu yul chen ye shes lam gyis thob //
translated: It is attained by the path of the intuition of the great domain.

original: ces bya ba ni de'i rjes la 'thob pa shes bya mtha' yas pa'i yul can gyi ye shes kyi lam thob pas te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni de'i rjes la 'thob pa shes bya mtha' yas pa'i yul can gyi ye shes kyi lam thob pas te /
translated: It is attained by the path of the intuition whose domain is the infinite knowable, which is attained subsequently to the previous intuition.

original: 'di gnyis bshad par bya ba'i tshig yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di gnyis bshad par bya ba'i tshig yin par sbyar ro //
translated: These two are to be connected with the words to be explained.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sems can gyi tshogs kun tu song ba nyid ni sems can thams cad bdag nyid du zhal gyis bzhes pa yongs su grub pa las rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni des sa dang po la chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i don du🔽rtogs pas bdag gang yin pa de nyid sems can rnams yin zhes sems can thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid 'thob po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sems can gyi tshogs kun tu song ba nyid ni sems can thams cad bdag nyid du zhal gyis bzhes pa yongs su grub pa las rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni des sa dang po la chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i don du rtogs pas bdag gang yin pa de nyid sems can rnams yin zhes sems can thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid 'thob po //
translated: The Buddha’s going everywhere in the hosts of sentient beings should be understood as the perfection of his acceptance of all sentient beings as himself.

original: sems can thams cad bdag nyid du khas blangs pa de sangs rgyas kyis la @68a * //🔽yongs su grub ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bdag nyid du khas blangs pa de sangs rgyas kyis la @68a * // yongs su grub ste /
translated: By realizing the meaning of the all-pervading expanse of reality on the first level, he attains the sameness of himself and all sentient beings, thinking, “Whatever is the self, that are all sentient beings.”🔽That acceptance of all sentient beings as himself is perfected in the Buddha.

original: de bzhin nyid ni thams cad du song ba nyid du rab tu grub pas 'di ni khyad par gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni thams cad du song ba nyid du rab tu grub pas 'di ni khyad par gzhan yin no //
translated: This is another difference.

original: ji ltar rnga dag ma brdungs par //
analyzed: ji ltar rnga dag ma brdungs par //
translated: The Buddha’s speech is like a drum.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dbang gis rnga dag ma brdungs pa las gzas pa med par grogs po dag 'dod pa rnams ni mi rtag pa /🔽mi brtan pa /🔽yid brtan du mi rung ba ste /🔽ngan 'gro'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i sgra 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dbang gis rnga dag ma brdungs pa las gzas pa med par grogs po dag 'dod pa rnams ni mi rtag pa / mi brtan pa / yid brtan du mi rung ba ste / ngan 'gro'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i sgra 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the sound of the drum of the gods arises without being beaten, through the power of the roots of virtue of sentient beings, saying, “Friends, the desired objects are impermanent,🔽unstable,🔽and unreliable,🔽they are the cause of the miserable realms,” and so on,🔽🔽

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rang bzhin gyi sku la bzhugs pa rnams kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis lhun gyis grub par chos 'chad par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rang bzhin gyi sku la bzhugs pa rnams kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis lhun gyis grub par chos 'chad par 'byung ngo //
translated: Just as the sound of a drum arises without effort, without being struck, through the power of the roots of virtue of sentient beings, in the same way, the sound of the Dharma arises from the transcendent lords, the buddhas, who abide in the natural body, through the power of their former aspirations, without effort.

original: de bzhin du ji ltar nor bu 'bad pa med par rang gi 'od ston pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar nor bu 'bad pa med par rang gi 'od ston pa lta bu ste /
translated: Just as a jewel effortlessly emits its own light,

original: nor bu ni 'di snyam du bdag gis 'od kyis bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems mod kyi /
analyzed: nor bu ni 'di snyam du bdag gis 'od kyis bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems mod kyi /
translated: a jewel does not think, “I will do this with my light!”

original: 'on kyang rtog pa med par 'od ston par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on kyang rtog pa med par 'od ston par 'gyur la /
translated: However, without thought, it emits light,

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu yang mthu ston to //
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu yang mthu ston to //
translated: and a wish-fulfilling jewel displays its power.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang lhun gyis grub pa'i gnas skabs na bza' ba mi mnga' bar rnam par mi rtog pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang lhun gyis grub pa'i gnas skabs na bza' ba mi mnga' bar rnam par mi rtog pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the Lord Buddhas, in the state of spontaneity, without any effort, perform the actions of a Buddha, like the spontaneous performance of the actions of the world.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyis ni lhun gyis grub pa nyid bstan to ;
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyis ni lhun gyis grub pa nyid bstan to ;
translated: These two verses show spontaneity.

original: / da ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid ston par byed de /
analyzed: / da ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid ston par byed de /
translated: Now, in two verses, he shows the uninterruptedness of the actions of a Buddha.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' la 'jig rten gyi bya ba rgyun mi 'chad par snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' la 'jig rten gyi bya ba rgyun mi 'chad par snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: The actions of the world appear uninterruptedly in space.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad ce na /
translated: How is it that they are uninterrupted in all world-realms?

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan zhig ste ;
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan zhig ste ;
translated: In other world-realms,

original: stong pa dag tu 'jig rten gyi bya ba rnams mi snang mod kyi /
analyzed: stong pa dag tu 'jig rten gyi bya ba rnams mi snang mod kyi /
translated: the actions of the world do not appear in the empty spaces.

original: 'on kyang gang dag chags pa de dag na 'jig rten gyi bya ba rnams rgyun mi 'chad par snang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang dag chags pa de dag na 'jig rten gyi bya ba rnams rgyun mi 'chad par snang ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, in those that are inhabited, the actions of the world appear uninterruptedly.

original: de bzhin du zag pa med pa'i dbyings nam mkha' ltar chad pa med pa la yang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du zag pa med pa'i dbyings nam mkha' ltar chad pa med pa la yang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ngo //
translated: Likewise, in the uninterrrupted space of the uncontaminated realm, the activities of the buddhas occur without interruption.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' la rtag tu bya ba rnams skye zhing 'jig par 'byung ba de bzhin du zag pa med pa'i dbyings la sangs rgyas kyi phrin las skye zhing 'bri ste /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' la rtag tu bya ba rnams skye zhing 'jig par 'byung ba de bzhin du zag pa med pa'i dbyings la sangs rgyas kyi phrin las skye zhing 'bri ste /
translated: Just as actions are always arising and ceasing in space, so the activities of the buddhas arise and cease in the uncontaminated realm.

original: sems can gang dag skal ba dang ldan pa de dag la ni skye la /
analyzed: sems can gang dag skal ba dang ldan pa de dag la ni skye la /
translated: They arise for those sentient beings who are fortunate,

original: skal ba dang mi ldan pa de dag la ni 'bri'o //
analyzed: skal ba dang mi ldan pa de dag la ni 'bri'o //
translated: and they cease for those who are not.🔽It is not pure because there is no difference between the former and the latter.🔽It is not pure because it is not previously defiled and later purified.🔽It is not pure because it is not previously defiled and later purified.🔽It is not pure because it is not previously defiled and later purified.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma khyad par med pa'i phyir @68b dag pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sngar yang kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma khyad par med pa'i phyir @68b dag pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sngar yang kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not pure because it is not previously defiled and later purified.

original: phyis kyang ma yin pa de'i phyir dag pa ma yin te /🔽gang la dri ma yod pa de dag par 'gyur na chos kyi dbyings de ni sngar ram phyis kyang dri ma can ma yin no //
analyzed: phyis kyang ma yin pa de'i phyir dag pa ma yin te /🔽gang la dri ma yod pa de dag par 'gyur na chos kyi dbyings de ni sngar ram phyis kyang dri ma can ma yin no //
