original: glo bur gyi sgrib pa thams cad kyi dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ma dag pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: glo bur gyi sgrib pa thams cad kyi dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ma dag pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not impure because it is free from the stain of all adventitious obscurations.

original: bdag med pa'i mchog ni de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i mchog ni de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The supreme selflessness is the purification of suchness.🔽And that is the self of the buddhas by the meaning of intrinsic reality.

original: de yang ngo bo nyid kyi don gyis sangs rgyas rnams kyi bdag yin no zhes bya ba la bdag ces bya ba'i sgra 'di ni brtags pa'i bdag la mthong ngo //
analyzed: de yang ngo bo nyid kyi don gyis sangs rgyas rnams kyi bdag yin no zhes bya ba la bdag ces bya ba'i sgra 'di ni brtags pa'i bdag la mthong ngo //
translated: Here, the term self is seen in the imputed self.

original: chos kyi ngo bo nyid la yang mthong ste /
analyzed: chos kyi ngo bo nyid la yang mthong ste /
translated: It is also seen in the intrinsic reality of phenomena.

original: dper na sa ni sra ba'i bdag nyid do zhes bya ba sra ba'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya bar shes pa dang / me ni dro ba'i bdag nyid do zhes bya ba ni dro ba'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya bar shes pa ltar 'dir yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dper na sa ni sra ba'i bdag nyid do zhes bya ba sra ba'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya bar shes pa dang / me ni dro ba'i bdag nyid do zhes bya ba ni dro ba'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya bar shes pa ltar 'dir yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: For example, it is known that earth has the intrinsic reality of solidity, and it is known that fire has the intrinsic reality of heat.

original: bdag med pa'i mchog ni de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i mchog ni de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa yin la /
translated: Here, the supreme selflessness is the purification of suchness.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang de rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de'i phyir bdag ces bya ba'i sgra ni bdag med pa'i mchog gi ngo bo nyid yin pas blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang de rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de'i phyir bdag ces bya ba'i sgra ni bdag med pa'i mchog gi ngo bo nyid yin pas blta bar bya'o //
translated: Since the Bhagavān Buddhas are the nature of that purity, therefore the term “self” should be viewed as the nature of the supreme selflessness.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas yod min zhing //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas yod min zhing //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha is not said to exist,

original: med par yang ni mi brjod do //
analyzed: med par yang ni mi brjod do //
translated: nor is he said to be nonexistent.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu de nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas ni yod pa zhes kyang mi brjod de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu de nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas ni yod pa zhes kyang mi brjod de /
translated: For that very reason, the Buddha is not said to exist,

original: de bzhin nyid kun brtags pa'i gang zag dang chos med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kun brtags pa'i gang zag dang chos med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because suchness is the characteristic of the nonexistence of the imputed individual and phenomena.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid ni gang zag gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid ni gang zag gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: In this way, suchness is not the characteristic of the nature of the individual,

original: chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it the characteristic of the nature of phenomena.

original: kun brtags pa'i gang zag ni ri bong gi rva dang 'dra la /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i gang zag ni ri bong gi rva dang 'dra la /
translated: The imputed individual is like the horn of a rabbit,

original: kun brtags pa'i chos kyang de kho na dang 'dra bas so //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i chos kyang de kho na dang 'dra bas so //
translated: and the imputed phenomenon is just like that.

original: dgongs pa 'dis ni sangs rgyas nyid ni yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dgongs pa 'dis ni sangs rgyas nyid ni yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: This intention shows that Buddhahood is not existent.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid du yod pa'i phyir med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid du yod pa'i phyir med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not nonexistent, because it exists in the characteristic of thusness.🔽Just as the pacification of heat in iron and the pacification of cataracts in the eye are not existent, because they have the characteristic of the absence of heat and the absence of cataracts.

original: ji ltar lcags la tsha ba zhi ba dang / mig la rab rib zhi ba ni gdung ba dang / rab rib med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir yod pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar tsha ba med pa dang / rab rib med pa ni yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar lcags la tsha ba zhi ba dang / mig la rab rib zhi ba ni gdung ba dang / rab rib med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir yod pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar tsha ba med pa dang / rab rib med pa ni yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: In this way, the absence of heat and the absence of cataracts are not existent,

original: rims nad med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rims nad med pa bzhin no //
translated: like the absence of a disease.

original: ji ltar rims nad dang bral ba yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du tsha ba dang rab rib dang bral ba yang yod pa ma yin no //🔽zhi ba'i mtshan nyid @69a * //
analyzed: ji ltar rims nad dang bral ba yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du tsha ba dang rab rib dang bral ba yang yod pa ma yin no // zhi ba'i mtshan nyid @69a * //
translated: Just as the absence of a disease is not existent, so also the absence of heat and the absence of cataracts are not existent.

original: du yod pa'i phyir med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tsha ba zhi ba ste /
analyzed: du yod pa'i phyir med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tsha ba zhi ba ste /
translated: It is not nonexistent, because it exists in the characteristic of peace.

original: lcags grang mor gyur na lcags kyis lcags kyi bya ba mi byed pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: lcags grang mor gyur na lcags kyis lcags kyi bya ba mi byed pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The pacification of heat is not the nonperformance of the function of iron by iron, when it has become cold.

original: mig la rab rib zhi na yang mig gis mthong ba'i bya ba mi byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la rab rib zhi na yang mig gis mthong ba'i bya ba mi byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But when the eye is free of cataracts, it is not that the eye does not perform the function of seeing.

original: gal te med pa tsam zhig yin par gyur na ni gzugs med pa'i phyir lcags kyis kyang lcags kyi bya ba mi byed la /
analyzed: gal te med pa tsam zhig yin par gyur na ni gzugs med pa'i phyir lcags kyis kyang lcags kyi bya ba mi byed la /
translated: If it were just the absence of something, then iron would not perform the function of iron because it is formless.

original: mig gis kyang mig gi bya ba mi byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gis kyang mig gi bya ba mi byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the eye would not perform the function of the eye.

original: ji ltar rims nad nye bar zhi ba med pa tsam kho na ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar rims nad nye bar zhi ba med pa tsam kho na ma yin gyi /
translated: Just as the absence of a disease is not just the absence of a disease,

original: rims nad nye bar zhi na lus la nad sos pa gzhan 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: rims nad nye bar zhi na lus la nad sos pa gzhan 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: but when the disease is absent, health appears in the body,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems dang ye shes la gdung ba dang rab rib lta bu 'dod chags dang ma rig pa dag zhi ba ni yod par mi brjod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems dang ye shes la gdung ba dang rab rib lta bu 'dod chags dang ma rig pa dag zhi ba ni yod par mi brjod do //
translated: in the same way, the pacification of attachment and ignorance, which are like a disease and cataracts in the mind and wisdom of the Blessed Buddhas, is not said to be an existent.

original: sems dang shes rab rnam par grol ba dag ni des rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags med pa dang / ma rig pa med pa dang / 'gags pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nub pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems dang shes rab rnam par grol ba dag ni des rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags med pa dang / ma rig pa med pa dang / 'gags pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nub pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The absence of attachment, the absence of ignorance, the cessation, the pacification, and the disappearance do not exist.

original: med pa yang ma yin te /🔽rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid de lta bur yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin te / rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid de lta bur yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Nor do they not exist.🔽Because they exist in that way, with the characteristic of liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid ni gang rnam par grol ba la bdag ni rnam par grol lo snyam pa'i ye shes bdag nyid kyis so sor rang gis rig pa 'byung ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid ni gang rnam par grol ba la bdag ni rnam par grol lo snyam pa'i ye shes bdag nyid kyis so sor rang gis rig pa 'byung ba 'di yin te /
translated: The characteristic of liberation is that in liberation, the knowledge that “I am liberated” arises by oneself.

original: ji ltar rims nad nub ste nye bar zhi na so so rang gis rims nad sos pa so sor nyams su myong ba de bzhin du 'dod chags kyi rims nad dang / ma rig pa'i rab rib dag nub ste nye bar zhi na so so rang gis rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid kyi nad sos pa so so rang gis nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rims nad nub ste nye bar zhi na so so rang gis rims nad sos pa so sor nyams su myong ba de bzhin du 'dod chags kyi rims nad dang / ma rig pa'i rab rib dag nub ste nye bar zhi na so so rang gis rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid kyi nad sos pa so so rang gis nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as when a fever is cured and subsides, each one experiences the cure of the fever for himself, so also when the fever of passion and the darkness of nescience are cured and subside, each one experiences the cure of the disease, which is the nature of liberation, for himself.

original: tshigs su bcad pa snga ma rnams ni de bzhin nyid kyi gnas su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa snga ma rnams ni de bzhin nyid kyi gnas su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The previous verses have indicated the characteristic of the reality of thusness.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni gdung ba dang rab rib zhi ba lta bu gnas ngan len gyi lam gyi rten gyur pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni gdung ba dang rab rib zhi ba lta bu gnas ngan len gyi lam gyi rten gyur pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This verse indicates the characteristic of the reality of the basis of the elimination of the bad habits, which is like the elimination of the fever and the darkness.🔽Since it is like space, it is not multiple, because it is without body.

original: nam mkha' ltar lus med pas na mang po nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar bdag tu 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir rten tha dad par brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar lus med pas na mang po nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar bdag tu 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir rten tha dad par brjod par mi nus te /
translated: Since it is without body, it is not multiple. Since it is without body like space, it cannot be said to have a different basis, because there is no grasping of self.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa yod na ni 'di ni bdag go //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa yod na ni 'di ni bdag go //
translated: If there were grasping of self, one could say, “This is my self.”

original: lhas byin ni gzhan no snyam pa de lta bur 'gyur gyi bdag tu 'dzin pa med pa la ni de lta bur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhas byin ni gzhan no snyam pa de lta bur 'gyur gyi bdag tu 'dzin pa med pa la ni de lta bur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it would not be like that for one who does not have the conception of self.

original: de bas na bdag tu 'dzin @69b pa med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos kyi sku la gnas pa rnams nam mkha' bzhin du tha dad par bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de bas na bdag tu 'dzin @69b pa med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos kyi sku la gnas pa rnams nam mkha' bzhin du tha dad par bya bar mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, because of the absence of the conception of self, the Blessed Buddhas, who abide in the Dharma Body, cannot be differentiated like space.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas pa chos kyi sku yongs su ma rdzogs pa rnams la ni tha dad du mi bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas pa chos kyi sku yongs su ma rdzogs pa rnams la ni tha dad du mi bya ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that there is no differentiation among the bodhisattvas who abide in the practice, who have not perfected the Dharma Body.

original: ye shes snang ba byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ye shes snang ba byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are the source of the light of intuition,

original: nyi ma chen po 'dra bar 'dod //
analyzed: nyi ma chen po 'dra bar 'dod //
translated: they are like a great sun.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: nyi ma chen po ni kun brtag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: nyi ma chen po ni kun brtag par bya ba yin te /
translated: a great sun is to be imagined,

original: gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten snang bar byed pa'i nyi ma chen po de lta bu 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na'o //
analyzed: gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten snang bar byed pa'i nyi ma chen po de lta bu 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na'o //
translated: if there were some great sun that would illuminate the world systems of a billion-world universe.

original: sprul pa la sogs pa'i mdzad pa la 'dres pa'i mdzad pa gcig pa nyid ston to zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes smos pas ni byin gyi rlabs kyi mdzad pa la sogs pa bsdu bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sprul pa la sogs pa'i mdzad pa la 'dres pa'i mdzad pa gcig pa nyid ston to zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes smos pas ni byin gyi rlabs kyi mdzad pa la sogs pa bsdu bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The phrase “and so on” in the phrase “the performance of emanations, and so on” should be understood to include the performance of transformation.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mdzad pa ni 'dres pa yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas gcig gi sprul pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa gang yin pa de de las gzhan pa dag gis kyang mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mdzad pa ni 'dres pa yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas gcig gi sprul pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa gang yin pa de de las gzhan pa dag gis kyang mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The performance of the lord buddhas is mixed because whatever performance of emanation, etc., is performed by one buddha, is also performed by the others.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes dus gcig tu 'jug par ston to zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes dus gcig tu
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes dus gcig tu 'jug par ston to zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes dus gcig tu
translated: The phrase “the simultaneous engagement of the wisdom of all buddhas” means that the wisdom of all the lord buddhas always engages spontaneously and simultaneously,

original: 'jug ste mdzad pa gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug ste mdzad pa gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have a single performance.

original: nyi ma'i 'od zer stong pa rnam par rtog pa med par 'char ba ni 'od zer kha cig sngar 'char la /
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od zer stong pa rnam par rtog pa med par 'char ba ni 'od zer kha cig sngar 'char la /
translated: The thousand light rays of the sun arise without conceptuality, and it is not that some light rays arise earlier and others later;

original: gzhan dag phyis 'char ba ma yin gyi thams cad du dus gcig kho nar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan dag phyis 'char ba ma yin gyi thams cad du dus gcig kho nar 'byung ngo //
translated: they all occur at the same time.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mdzad pa tha mi dad pa rnams kyang dar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir gang gi tshe de kho na gcig gi ye shes 'byung ba de'i tshe kho na sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'byung ngo
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mdzad pa tha mi dad pa rnams kyang dar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir gang gi tshe de kho na gcig gi ye shes 'byung ba de'i tshe kho na sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'byung ngo
translated: In the same way, the Bhagavat Buddhas, whose activities are undifferentiated, are free of the grasping of “mine” and the grasping of “I,” and so when the gnosis of one arises, then all Buddhas arise.🔽As the light rays of the sun

original: // ji ltar nyi ma'i nyi zer dag /'jug la bdag gir bya ba med //
analyzed: // ji ltar nyi ma'i nyi zer dag /'jug la bdag gir bya ba med //
translated: engage, they are not made by anyone.

original: ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are without conceptuality.

original: nyi ma ni 'od zer rnams 'jug pa la bdag gir bya ba med de /
analyzed: nyi ma ni 'od zer rnams 'jug pa la bdag gir bya ba med de /
translated: The sun is not made by anyone in the engagement of the light rays.

original: lhun gyis grub pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It engages spontaneously.

original: nyi ma ni 'di snyam du bdag ni bsreg pa dang skem pa la sogs pa'i las la zhugs pa yin pas bdag gis bsreg par bya'o snyam du mi sems mod kyi /🔽'on kyang rnam par mi @70a * //
analyzed: nyi ma ni 'di snyam du bdag ni bsreg pa dang skem pa la sogs pa'i las la zhugs pa yin pas bdag gis bsreg par bya'o snyam du mi sems mod kyi / 'on kyang rnam par mi @70a * //
translated: The sun does not think, I will engage in the action of burning and drying, and so I will burn.

original: rtog pa bzhin du bdag gir bya ba med par 'od zer 'gyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtog pa bzhin du bdag gir bya ba med par 'od zer 'gyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: However, like the nonconceptual, without any sense of ownership, it emits its rays.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos kyi sku la gnas pa nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa spangs pa rnams kyi ye shes me long lta bu la sogs pa gang🔽dag yin pa de dag 'jug pa la yang bdag gir 'dzin pa mi mnga'i /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos kyi sku la gnas pa nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa spangs pa rnams kyi ye shes me long lta bu la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag 'jug pa la yang bdag gir 'dzin pa mi mnga'i /
translated: In the same way, the Bhagavat Buddhas, who abide in the dharmakāya, who have abandoned the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, together with their instincts, who have abandoned the grasping of I and grasping of mine, their gnoses such as mirror gnosis🔽engage in all objects of knowledge without any sense of ownership.

original: nga yir 'dzin pa mi mnga' bar shes bya thams cad la 'jug go //
analyzed: nga yir 'dzin pa mi mnga' bar shes bya thams cad la 'jug go //
translated: They engage in all objects of knowledge without any sense of mine.

original: snyigs ma lnga shas che ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snyigs ma lnga shas che ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five degenerations

original: snyigs ma lnga ni nyon mongs pa dang / lta ba dang / sems can dang / bskal ba dang / tshe'i snyigs ma dag yin te /
analyzed: snyigs ma lnga ni nyon mongs pa dang / lta ba dang / sems can dang / bskal ba dang / tshe'i snyigs ma dag yin te /
translated: The five degenerations are those of the passions, of the view of objective self-existence, of life, of the age, and of living beings.

original: snyigs ma zhes bya ba ni snyigs ma ngan pa dang tha shal yin no //
analyzed: snyigs ma zhes bya ba ni snyigs ma ngan pa dang tha shal yin no //
translated: Degeneration means bad degeneration, the worst.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni phrin las zab pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni phrin las zab pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The rest of the verse shows the profound activity.

original: stobs sogs sangs rgyas chos rnams la //
analyzed: stobs sogs sangs rgyas chos rnams la //
translated: The Buddha qualities of the powers, etc.

original: byang chub rin chen 'byung gnas 'dra //
analyzed: byang chub rin chen 'byung gnas 'dra //
translated: Are like a mine of jewels for enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa rin po che'i gnas nyid kyi phrin las bstan to //🔽'gro ba'i dge ba'i lo thog la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa rin po che'i gnas nyid kyi phrin las bstan to // 'gro ba'i dge ba'i lo thog la //
translated: This shows the activity of being a mine of jewels for the elements that lead to enlightenment, etc.🔽Like a great cloud for the crop of virtue

original: sprin chen dang yang 'dra bar 'dod //
analyzed: sprin chen dang yang 'dra bar 'dod //
translated: Of beings is the will to be generative held to be.

original: ces bya ba phyed 'dis ni sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i phrin las bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba phyed 'dis ni sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i phrin las bstan to //
translated: This half-verse shows the activity of bringing beings to maturity.

original: bsod nams ye shes rab rdzogs phyir ;
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes rab rdzogs phyir ;
translated: Because of the perfection of merit and wisdom,

original: / zla ba nya ba lta bur 'dod //
analyzed: / zla ba nya ba lta bur 'dod //
translated: It is like the full moon.

original: ces ba ba 'dis ni mthar thug par gshegs pa'i phrin las brjod do //
analyzed: ces ba ba 'dis ni mthar thug par gshegs pa'i phrin las brjod do //
translated: This verse describes the activity of going to the ultimate stage.

original: ye shes snang ba byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ye shes snang ba byed pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is the light of intuition,

original: nyi ma chen po 'dra bar 'dod //
analyzed: nyi ma chen po 'dra bar 'dod //
translated: it is like a great sun.

original: ces bya ba 'dis ni chos ston pa'i phrin las brjod do //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis ni chos ston pa'i phrin las brjod do //
translated: This describes the activity of teaching the truth.

original: ji ltar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi //
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi //
translated: Just as the light of the sun

original: 'od zer dpag tu med 'dres shing //
analyzed: 'od zer dpag tu med 'dres shing //
translated: is mixed with the infinite light-rays,

original: zhes bya ba 'di dang / de bzhin zag med dbyings na yang //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di dang / de bzhin zag med dbyings na yang //
translated: and just so in the uncontaminated realm

original: sangs rgyas dpag tu med 'dres shing //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dpag tu med 'dres shing //
translated: the Buddhas are mixed in their infinite number.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di thams cad kyis ni sprul pa la sogs pa mdzad pa'i phrin las bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di thams cad kyis ni sprul pa la sogs pa mdzad pa'i phrin las bstan to //
translated: These two verses show the activity of creating emanations, etc.

original: dper na nyi ma'i 'od zer gcig / ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni ye shes 'jug pa'i phrin las bstan to //
analyzed: dper na nyi ma'i 'od zer gcig / ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni ye shes 'jug pa'i phrin las bstan to //
translated: This verse describes the activity of intuition’s engagement.

original: ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od zer dag / ces bya ba 'dis ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phrin las brjod do //
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od zer dag / ces bya ba 'dis ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phrin las brjod do //
translated: This describes the activity of non-conceptuality.

original: nyi ma'i 'od zer gcig btang bas //
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od zer gcig btang bas //
translated: The sun sends forth a single ray

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni ye shes rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i phrin las bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni ye shes rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i phrin las bstan to //
translated: This shows the various aspects of the Buddha's gnosis.

original: ji ltar @70b nyi ma'i 'od zer rnams //
analyzed: ji ltar @70b nyi ma'i 'od zer rnams //
translated: The sun sends forth a single ray

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni ye shes mi 'jug pa'i phrin las brjod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni ye shes mi 'jug pa'i phrin las brjod do //
translated: This shows the non-engagement of the Buddha's gnosis.🔽The profound activities of the Buddha are difficult to explain

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas 'ga' phrin las zab pa 'di bshad pa //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas 'ga' phrin las zab pa 'di bshad pa //
translated: Even for the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: mkha' la tshon gyis ri mo 'dri //
analyzed: mkha' la tshon gyis ri mo 'dri //
translated: It is like painting a picture in the sky

original: zhes bya ba ni dper na 'ga' nams so so rang gis rig 'jug go //🔽dri med dbyings la sangs rgyas kyi //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dper na 'ga' nams so so rang gis rig 'jug go // dri med dbyings la sangs rgyas kyi //
translated: This shows that the Buddha's gnosis is difficult to understand.🔽The profound characteristics,🔽Abiding and activities of the Buddhas

original: mtshan nyid dang ni gnas pa dang / phrin las zab pa 'di bshad pa //🔽mkha' la tshon gyis ri mo 'dri //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni gnas pa dang / phrin las zab pa 'di bshad pa // mkha' la tshon gyis ri mo 'dri //
translated: In the uncontaminated realm🔽Are like painting a picture in the sky.🔽It is like painting a picture in the sky

original: zhes bya ba ni dper na 'ga' zhig nam mkha' la ni ri mo 'dri bar dka' ba byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dper na 'ga' zhig nam mkha' la ni ri mo 'dri bar dka' ba byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: This shows that the Buddha's gnosis is difficult to understand.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams so so rang gis rig pa'i chos bsnyad pa'i rnam par stan pa mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni dka' ba mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams so so rang gis rig pa'i chos bsnyad pa'i rnam par stan pa mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni dka' ba mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The Exalted Ones, the Buddhas, perform the difficult deed of teaching the Dharma which is to be known by each one for himself.

original: gos bkra ba nyid dang nam mkha' la ri mo 'dri ba nyid ni rgya mtsho'i blo gros kyi mdo'i rjes su 'brang bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gos bkra ba nyid dang nam mkha' la ri mo 'dri ba nyid ni rgya mtsho'i blo gros kyi mdo'i rjes su 'brang bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The vividness of the cloth and the painting in space should be understood according to the Sāgaranāgarājaparipṛcchāsūtra.

original: 'byor pa rnam par dbye ba la zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'byor pa tha ma dang / 'bring dang ; mchog tu rnam par dbye bas so //
analyzed: 'byor pa rnam par dbye ba la zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'byor pa tha ma dang / 'bring dang ; mchog tu rnam par dbye bas so //
translated: The analysis of mastery is the analysis of the lesser, middling, and superior mastery of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and buddhas, respectively.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rim gyis gzhan dang gzhan zil gyis gnon to //🔽rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par dang / zab pa'i khyad par gyis 'byor pa ston to zhes bya ba sbyar te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rim gyis gzhan dang gzhan zil gyis gnon to // rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par dang / zab pa'i khyad par gyis 'byor pa ston to zhes bya ba sbyar te /
translated: Therefore, in order, they surpass the others.🔽The analysis of mastery is taught through the distinction of types and the distinction of profundity.

original: dpag tu med pa nyid kyis ni rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par bstan la /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa nyid kyis ni rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par bstan la /
translated: The distinction of types is taught by the immeasurability.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid kyis zab pa'i khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid kyis zab pa'i khyad par bstan to //
translated: The profundity of the Buddha's knowledge is shown by its inconceivability.

original: ji ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin /
translated: How is it inconceivable?

original: ji ltar tshad med pa yin zhe na /🔽smras pa / de gang zag dang gang gi don dang / 'jig rten gyi khams gang du dang / rnam pa ci 'dra ba dag dang / bskal pa ci tsam du byang chub kyi ched du zhugs nas 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar tshad med pa yin zhe na / smras pa / de gang zag dang gang gi don dang / 'jig rten gyi khams gang du dang / rnam pa ci 'dra ba dag dang / bskal pa ci tsam du byang chub kyi ched du zhugs nas 'jug pa ste /
translated: How is it immeasurable?🔽It is said that the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, cannot be measured or conceived in terms of such topics as the persons in whom they are found, the purpose for which they are found, the world systems in which they are found, the forms in which they are found, and the eons during which they are found.

original: don de lta bu la sogs pa la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ji ltar 'jug pa de tshad gzung ba dang bsam par mi nus so //
analyzed: don de lta bu la sogs pa la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ji ltar 'jug pa de tshad gzung ba dang bsam par mi nus so //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, cannot be measured or conceived in terms of the manner in which they enter into enlightenment.🔽When the five faculties are transformed, one obtains the two excellent masteries.

original: dbang po lnga gzhan du gyur na 'byor pa dam pa rnam pa gnyis 'thob po zhes bya ba gzugs med na ji ltar dbang po gzhan du 'gyur par 'dod ce na /🔽rang gi sa bon gang las su //
analyzed: dbang po lnga gzhan du gyur na 'byor pa dam pa rnam pa gnyis 'thob po zhes bya ba gzugs med na ji ltar dbang po gzhan du 'gyur par 'dod ce na / rang gi sa bon gang las su //
translated: How can one maintain that the faculties are transformed in the formless realm?

original: rnam rig snang ba gang byung ba //
analyzed: rnam rig snang ba gang byung ba //
translated: The appearance of consciousness

original: de dang de yi skye mched ni //
analyzed: de dang de yi skye mched ni //
translated: arises from its own seed.🔽The Sage has declared

original: rnam pa gnyis su thub pas gsungs //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su thub pas gsungs //
translated: that this is the twofold sense base.

original: rang gi sa bon yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par thob pa gang las gzugs su snang ba'i rnam par rig pa 'byung ba'i sa @71a * //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par thob pa gang las gzugs su snang ba'i rnam par rig pa 'byung ba'i sa @71a * //
translated: The eye is the particular attainment that is the transformation of its seed, from which there arises a representation that appears as form.

original: bon gang yin pa de dang snang ba gang yin pa de ste /
analyzed: bon gang yin pa de dang snang ba gang yin pa de ste /
translated: The seed and the appearance are the eye and form sense spheres, respectively.

original: de dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis go rims bzhin du de'i mig dang gzugs kyi skye mched nas lus dang reg bya'i skye mched kyi bar du gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis go rims bzhin du de'i mig dang gzugs kyi skye mched nas lus dang reg bya'i skye mched kyi bar du gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One taught them in that order, from the eye and form sense spheres up to the body and tactility sense spheres.

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' rnams khams gsum pa 'di sems tsam mo zhes bya bar thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rim gyis gzugs kyi 'du shes zil gyis mnan te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' rnams khams gsum pa 'di sems tsam mo zhes bya bar thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rim gyis gzugs kyi 'du shes zil gyis mnan te /
translated: When bodhisattvas, through hearing, reflection, and meditation, overcome the discernment of form by thinking, “This three-realm world is only mind,”

original: gzugs su phyin ci log spong bar byed pa de'i tshe skye mched nyid du phyin ci log par gyur ba'i rnam par rig pa gang dag yin pa de dag yongs su gyur na phyin ci log spang ba'i phyir dbang po lnga gzhan du 'gyur ba rnam par gzhag
analyzed: gzugs su phyin ci log spong bar byed pa de'i tshe skye mched nyid du phyin ci log par gyur ba'i rnam par rig pa gang dag yin pa de dag yongs su gyur na phyin ci log spang ba'i phyir dbang po lnga gzhan du 'gyur ba rnam par gzhag
translated: When one abandons the error of form, then the five faculties are transformed in order to abandon the error of the sense bases.

original: go // 'byor ba rnam pa gnyis la dbang po lnga po thams cad don lnga po thams cad la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni mig gis gzugs mthong ba nas reg bya la reg pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: go // 'byor ba rnam pa gnyis la dbang po lnga po thams cad don lnga po thams cad la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni mig gis gzugs mthong ba nas reg bya la reg pa'i bar du ste /
translated: In the two kinds of mastery, all five faculties engage all five objects.

original: dbang po re re la yang 'byor ba de lta bu dang gzugs la sogs pa mthong bas yon tan brgya phrag bcu gnyis 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po re re la yang 'byor ba de lta bu dang gzugs la sogs pa mthong bas yon tan brgya phrag bcu gnyis 'thob pa'o //
translated: In each faculty there is such mastery, and one obtains the twelve hundred qualities of seeing forms and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs par mngon par zhen pa yod na don thams cad la 'jug pa 'gal gyi /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs par mngon par zhen pa yod na don thams cad la 'jug pa 'gal gyi /
translated: If one has attachment to forms and so on, then engaging all objects is contradictory.

original: de mngon par zhen na spang ba'i phyir nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de mngon par zhen na spang ba'i phyir nyes pa med de /
translated: But if one has attachment, it is in order to abandon it, so there is no fault.

original: don 'di ni 'phags pa gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po dang / dam pa'i chos padma dkar po la sogs pa'i mdo las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: don 'di ni 'phags pa gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po dang / dam pa'i chos padma dkar po la sogs pa'i mdo las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: This point should be understood from the noble Dhāraṇīśvararāja Sūtra, the noble Sūtra of the White Lotus of the True Doctrine, and so on.

original: yid gzhan du 'gyur na 'byor ba dang mthun pa spyod pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa la 'byor ba'i mchog rnyed par gyur te zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gzhan du gyur na'o //
analyzed: yid gzhan du 'gyur na 'byor ba dang mthun pa spyod pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa la 'byor ba'i mchog rnyed par gyur te zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gzhan du gyur na'o //
translated: When the mental organ is transformed, one attains the highest mastery of the nondiscriminative gnosis that is in harmony with the perfections, and is completely purified.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan par 'jug la /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan par 'jug la /
translated: The nondiscriminative gnosis is engaged in association with the mental consciousness.

original: de'i rten ni yid yin te /
analyzed: de'i rten ni yid yin te /
translated: And its basis is the mental organ.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i mig la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i mig la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the eye and so on being the basis of the eye consciousness and so on.

original: ji srid du nyon mongs can gyi yid de gzhan du ma gyur pa'i bar du 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan par kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dmigs nas phyin ci log tu 'jug pa de srid du
analyzed: ji srid du nyon mongs can gyi yid de gzhan du ma gyur pa'i bar du 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan par kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dmigs nas phyin ci log tu 'jug pa de srid du
translated: As long as the afflicted mind has not transformed, it engages in error by focusing on the foundation consciousness and being concomitant with the four afflictions such as the view of the transitory collection.

original: de la brten pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la ci rigs par gzugs la sogs pa'i yul med bzhin du yod pa yang dag par bzung nas phyin ci log tu 'jug go //
analyzed: de la brten pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la ci rigs par gzugs la sogs pa'i yul med bzhin du yod pa yang dag par bzung nas phyin ci log tu 'jug go //
translated: The mental consciousness that is based on that engages in error by apprehending objects such as form as truly existent, even though they do not exist.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi @71b yid de gzhan du gyur na de la brten pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la 'byor ba 'thob ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi @71b yid de gzhan du gyur na de la brten pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la 'byor ba 'thob ste /
translated: When that afflicted mind transforms, the nonconceptual exalted wisdom that is based on it attains mastery.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'byor ba de la rag las pa dang / de'i rjes la 'thob pa'i ye shes la rag las pas ni de dang mthun par spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'byor ba de la rag las pa dang / de'i rjes la 'thob pa'i ye shes la rag las pas ni de dang mthun par spyod pa yin no //
translated: Bodhisattvas engage in conduct in accordance with that mastery and the exalted wisdom that is attained subsequently.

original: don gzhan du gyur pa ni gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga gzhan du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa ni gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga gzhan du gyur pa'o //
translated: The transformation of the object refers to the transformation of the five sense objects such as form.

original: 'dzin pa gzhan du gyur pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lnga gzhan du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa gzhan du gyur pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lnga gzhan du gyur pa ste /
translated: The transformation of the subject refers to the transformation of the five sense consciousnesses such as visual consciousness.

original: ji ltar rnam par ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na yul lnga po sna tshogs su dmigs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na yul lnga po sna tshogs su dmigs pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the five sense objects are perceived as various in the impure stage,

original: gzhan du gyur ba'i gnas skabs na bee d'u rya la sogs pa'i zhing sna tshogs su snang ba rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur ba'i gnas skabs na bee d'u rya la sogs pa'i zhing sna tshogs su snang ba rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: so they appear as various pure fields such as the lapis lazuli field in the transformed stage.

original: rnam par rtog pa gzhan du gyur na zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa gzhan du gyur pa ston to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gzhan du gyur na zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa gzhan du gyur pa ston to //
translated: When discursive thought is transformed, this shows the transformation of the mental consciousness.

original: ye shes thams cad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ye shes thams cad ces bya ba ni /
translated: All intuition refers to

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: mirror intuition and so on.

original: phrin las thams cad la zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i phrin las sogs pa la ste /
analyzed: phrin las thams cad la zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i phrin las sogs pa la ste /
translated: All activity refers to emanation activity and so on.

original: dus thams cad du thogs pa med pa la 'byor ba'i mchog thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dus thams cad du thogs pa med pa la 'byor ba'i mchog thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: One attains the supreme mastery over the unimpededness in all times.

original: rten ni gzhan du gyur pa na zhes bya ba la rten du gyur pa ni sa ste /
analyzed: rten ni gzhan du gyur pa na zhes bya ba la rten du gyur pa ni sa ste /
translated: The basis is the transformation of the support. The support is the earth.

original: de gzhan du gyur na mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la 'byor ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gzhan du gyur na mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la 'byor ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When that is transformed, one attains mastery over the nirvāṇa that is not a location.

original: 'di ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa gzhan du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa gzhan du gyur pa yin te /
translated: This is the transformation of the object of the support of the foundation consciousness.🔽Thus it is said:

original: 'di ltar / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni //
translated: The foundation consciousness

original: de ni len pa dag dang gnas //🔽rnam par rig pa mi rig pa //
analyzed: de ni len pa dag dang gnas // rnam par rig pa mi rig pa //
translated: is the appropriator and the support.

original: zhes bya ba 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'byung ba yin no //
translated: It is the representation that is not a representation.

original: rten de gzhan du gyur pa ni gnas ngan len gyi rten gyi dmigs pa gzhan du gyur pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rten de gzhan du gyur pa ni gnas ngan len gyi rten gyi dmigs pa gzhan du gyur pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The transformation of that support is posited as the transformation of the support of negative reflex actions.

original: 'khrig pa gzhan du gyur ba ni lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: 'khrig pa gzhan du gyur ba ni lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: The transformation of sexual intercourse is one part of the body sense faculty.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas dri med pa'i //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas dri med pa'i //
translated: Thus, in the stainless abode of the buddhas,

original: gnas na gzhan gyur dpag med pas //
analyzed: gnas na gzhan gyur dpag med pas //
translated: there is an immeasurable transformation.

original: zhes bya ba ni dbang po lnga gzhan du gyur pa la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa 'di ni sgo tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbang po lnga gzhan du gyur pa la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa 'di ni sgo tsam du zad kyi /
translated: This verse shows that the above explanation of the transmutation of the five faculties is only a summary.

original: rgyas par ni chos mang po gzhan du gyur pa theg pa chen po'i mdo dag las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par ni chos mang po gzhan du gyur pa theg pa chen po'i mdo dag las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The extensive explanation of the transmutation of many other dharmas should be understood from the Mahayana scriptures.

original: 'byor ba'i skabs kyi 'og tu sangs rgyas nyid kyis sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: 'byor ba'i skabs kyi 'og tu sangs rgyas nyid kyis sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i skabs yin te /
translated: After the chapter on mastery comes the chapter on the buddhas’ work of bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: 'di'i 'brel ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the connection between these two chapters?

original: de ltar 'byor ba brnyes pa rang gi don gyi mthar phyin pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan @72a * //
analyzed: de ltar 'byor ba brnyes pa rang gi don gyi mthar phyin pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan @72a * //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas, having attained mastery and completed their own goals,

original: 'das rnams ni 'di ltar rtsol ba mi mnga' bar rnam par mi rtog pa bzhin du /
analyzed: 'das rnams ni 'di ltar rtsol ba mi mnga' bar rnam par mi rtog pa bzhin du /
translated: without any effort, and as if in nonconceptuality,🔽bring sentient beings to maturity.

original: sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pas 'di'i dbang du byas nas yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i skabs yin no //
