translated: or as particularities of small bodies and large bodies.

original: chos la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i bye brag ni sa bcu pa dang / blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs kyi sgo tha dad pas so //
analyzed: chos la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i bye brag ni sa bcu pa dang / blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs kyi sgo tha dad pas so //
translated: The particularity of the enjoyment of the Dharma is by means of the different doors of the various enumerations of the Dharma, such as the Dashabhumika, the Aksayamatinirdesha, etc.

original: mdzad pa'i bye brag ni byang chub sems dpa' 'dus pa'i bsam pa la ltos nas mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: mdzad pa'i bye brag ni byang chub sems dpa' 'dus pa'i bsam pa la ltos nas mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The particularity of deeds is in relation to the intentions of the assembled bodhisattvas.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku de dang / 'brel ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku de dang / 'brel ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: That sambhogakaya is related to the nirmanakaya.

original: 'di'i 'brel ba nyid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel ba nyid gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is its relation?

original: de'i rgyur gyur pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pa nyid de /
translated: It is the cause of that.

original: 'di ltar chos kyi sku ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi sku ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Thus, the dharmakaya is the cause of the sambhogakaya.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa ni de'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i phyir 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sar chud pa rnams la theg pa chen po'i chos thun mong ma yin pa ston pas de'i phyir longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni chos kyi
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa ni de'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i phyir 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sar chud pa rnams la theg pa chen po'i chos thun mong ma yin pa ston pas de'i phyir longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni chos kyi
translated: The enjoyment body is the result that is the natural outflow of the Dharma body, because it teaches the uncommon Mahayana Dharma to bodhisattvas who have entered the levels in the circle of the retinue.

original: sku dang 'brel ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sku dang 'brel ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore the enjoyment body is said to be related to the Dharma body.

original: yang na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes la thob pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: yang na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes la thob pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: Or the enjoyment body is the essence of the post equipoise state of the nonconceptual state.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes la thob pa de yang rtogs pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang / rnam par 'jog pa dang / 'dres pa dang / nges par spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid dang rnam pa lngar bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes la thob pa de yang rtogs pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang / rnam par 'jog pa dang / 'dres pa dang / nges par spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid dang rnam pa lngar bstan te /
translated: That post equipoise state is taught to be of five types: realization, recollection, placement, mixing, and definite practice.

original: de'i phyir yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni chos kyi sku dang 'brel ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni chos kyi sku dang 'brel ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore the enjoyment body is said to be related to the Dharma body.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sar chud pa rnams dang thabs cig tu theg pa chen po'i chos thun mong ma yin pa'i longs spyod rdzogs par sku nyams su bstar ba'i
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sar chud pa rnams dang thabs cig tu theg pa chen po'i chos thun mong ma yin pa'i longs spyod rdzogs par sku nyams su bstar ba'i
translated: The Enjoyment Body is characterized by the perfection of one's own aim, because it is the enjoyment of the Great Vehicle Dharma, which is not shared by the Disciples, that is experienced by the Bodhisattvas who have entered the spiritual levels.

original: phyir ro // phun sum tshogs pa de ni chos kyi sku la brten pa yin no //🔽gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la brten pa yang yin la /
analyzed: phyir ro // phun sum tshogs pa de ni chos kyi sku la brten pa yin no // gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la brten pa yang yin la /
translated: That perfection is based on the Dharma Body.

original: sprul pa'i sku la brten pa yang yin te /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku la brten pa yang yin te /
translated: The perfection of the aims of others is based on the Enjoyment Body and also on the Transformation Body.

original: de dag ni sku gsum yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni sku gsum yin no //
translated: These are the three Bodies.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku gsum po de dag ni go rims bzhin du rnam pa gsum gyis khyad par med de zhes bya ba la 'jig rten gyis ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi sku tha mi dad do //🔽ji ltar tha mi @74a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku gsum po de dag ni go rims bzhin du rnam pa gsum gyis khyad par med de zhes bya ba la 'jig rten gyis ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi sku tha mi dad do // ji ltar tha mi @74a * //
translated: The three Bodies of all Buddhas are undifferentiated in three ways, respectively. The Dharma Body is undifferentiated in the world because all Buddhas have the same Dharma Body.

original: dad ce na ;
analyzed: dad ce na ;
translated: How is it undifferentiated?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: chos kyi dbyings tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the realm of phenomena is undifferentiated.

original: dgongs pas ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pas ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment body is the intention.

original: sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the intention of the buddhas is undifferentiated.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni 'ga' la yang dgongs pa mthon dman gyi bye brag tha dad pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni 'ga' la yang dgongs pa mthon dman gyi bye brag tha dad pa mi mnga'o //
translated: The enjoyment body does not have a different intention for anyone, in terms of higher or lower.

original: phrin las kyis ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: phrin las kyis ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The emanation body is the activity.

original: phrin las thun mong pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phrin las thun mong pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the activity is common.

original: ji ltar sprul pa'i sku gcig gi sprul pas phrin las mdzad pa de bzhin du gzhan dag kyang mdzad pas gcig gis mdzad pa gang yin pa de thun mong yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyis kyang mdzad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sprul pa'i sku gcig gi sprul pas phrin las mdzad pa de bzhin du gzhan dag kyang mdzad pas gcig gis mdzad pa gang yin pa de thun mong yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyis kyang mdzad pa kho na yin no //
translated: Just as the activity is performed by the emanation of one emanation body, so it is performed by others. Therefore, since what is performed by one is common, it is performed by others as well.

original: sku gsum gyi skabs kyi 'og tu ye shes kyi skabs te /
analyzed: sku gsum gyi skabs kyi 'og tu ye shes kyi skabs te /
translated: After the section on the three bodies, the section on the four kinds of gnosis.

original: 'di'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the connection here?

original: 'di ni byang chub kyi skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub kyi skabs yin no //
translated: This is the section on enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni chos lnga po chos kyi dbyings dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa bzhis bsdus so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni chos lnga po chos kyi dbyings dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa bzhis bsdus so //
translated: The stage of the Buddha is comprised of the five dharmas, the dharmadhatu and the four knowledges, the mirror-like knowledge, etc.

original: de la chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i skabs kyi chos kyi dbyings ni /
analyzed: de la chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i skabs kyi chos kyi dbyings ni /
translated: The dharmadhatu in the context of the realization of the dharmadhatu🔽is distinguished in the three bodies, as it is said:

original: rang bzhin chos rdzogs longs spyod dang // sprul pa dag gis tha dad 'jug / ces dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas chos kyi dbyings la sku gsum gsal ba byas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin chos rdzogs longs spyod dang // sprul pa dag gis tha dad 'jug / ces dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas chos kyi dbyings la sku gsum gsal ba byas so //
translated: The dharmadhatu is differentiated by its nature, by its perfect enjoyment of the Dharma, and by its emanations.

original: da ni ye shes kyi dbang du byas nas sangs rgyas kyi ye shes me long lta bu la sogs pa bzhi bsam mo //
analyzed: da ni ye shes kyi dbang du byas nas sangs rgyas kyi ye shes me long lta bu la sogs pa bzhi bsam mo //
translated: Now, in the context of knowledge, the four knowledges of the Buddha, the mirror-like knowledge, etc., are to be contemplated.

original: me long ye shes nga yi med //
analyzed: me long ye shes nga yi med //
translated: The mirror-like knowledge is without discrimination,

original: yongs su ma chad ces bya ba ni ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir nga yi ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su ma chad ces bya ba ni ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir nga yi ba med pa yin no //
translated: without discrimination means without the discrimination of “I” and “mine” and without the discrimination of subject and object.

original: yul gyi sgo nas yongs su ma chad pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la shar la sogs pa'i yul tha dad par yongs su chad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yul gyi sgo nas yongs su ma chad pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la shar la sogs pa'i yul tha dad par yongs su chad pa med pa'o //
translated: In terms of object, it is called uninterrupted because it is not interrupted by the different objects of the east, etc.

original: rtag tu sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir shes bya thams cad la ma rmongs pa yang yin zhes bya ba ni 'di la 'di ltar de ni dus thams cad du nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral bas so //
analyzed: rtag tu sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir shes bya thams cad la ma rmongs pa yang yin zhes bya ba ni 'di la 'di ltar de ni dus thams cad du nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral bas so //
translated: And it is never confused about any object of knowledge because it is always free from obscurations, that is, because it is free from the afflictive and the knowledge obscurations at all times.

original: rnam pa med pa'i phyir chos de dag la mngon du phyogs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni shes bya dag la gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa bzhin du dmigs pa'i bye brag gam /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i phyir chos de dag la mngon du phyogs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni shes bya dag la gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa bzhin du dmigs pa'i bye brag gam /
translated: It is not directed toward those phenomena because it is devoid of aspects, that is, it does not engage in objects of knowledge by way of the distinctions of apprehending form, etc.,

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag gis 'jug pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag gis 'jug pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: or by way of the distinctions of the aspects of blue, etc.

original: de ni dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa mnyam pas mnyam pa rnam par mi rtog pa de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de ni dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa mnyam pas mnyam pa rnam par mi rtog pa de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: It is equality because it is equal to the object of observation, which is nonconceptual suchness, by way of the equality of the observed object and the observing subject.

original: @74b de nyid kyi phyir mi g-yo ba yin no //
analyzed: @74b de nyid kyi phyir mi g-yo ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is immovable.🔽Since it is the cause of all aspects of the knowledge of sameness and so on, it is like the source of all knowledge.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa de dag gi rnam pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ye shes thams cad kyi 'byung gnas lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba 'byung ba bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa de dag gi rnam pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ye shes thams cad kyi 'byung gnas lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba 'byung ba bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: Here, this passage should be connected with the following passage from the Sutra Teaching the Arising of the Tathagata:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rten gyi ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir ye shes kyi 'byung gnas chen po'o zhes 'byung ba'i mdo'i dum bu 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //🔽de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang yin la zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rten gyi ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir ye shes kyi 'byung gnas chen po'o zhes 'byung ba'i mdo'i dum bu 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o // de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang yin la zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: “The Bhagavat Buddhas are the great source of knowledge because they possess the knowledge that is the basis of omniscience.”🔽It is the enjoyment buddha, because it is the cause of the enjoyment buddha.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the enjoyment buddha because it is the cause of the enjoyment buddha.

original: ye shes kyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i phyir de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ye shes kyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i phyir de zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the reflection of knowledge arises from it, it is called the source of all knowledge.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni me long lta bu'i ye shes dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni me long lta bu'i ye shes dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The word “that” is to be connected with mirror-wisdom.

original: dus thams cad du byams pa chen po dang / thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes 'di la dpe ni mdo las /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mthong na sems can thams cad dga' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dus thams cad du byams pa chen po dang / thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes 'di la dpe ni mdo las / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mthong na sems can thams cad dga' ba'i phyir /
translated: “At all times endowed with great love and great compassion” is the wisdom of equality. The example of this is stated in a sutra:

original: ye shes chen po'i zla ba yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: ye shes chen po'i zla ba yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: “The bhagavat buddhas are the moon of great wisdom because they delight all sentient beings who see them.”

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni //
translated: The wisdom of individual investigation

original: shes bya kun la rtag mo thogs //
analyzed: shes bya kun la rtag mo thogs //
translated: is always unobstructed regarding all objects of knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la rnam pa thams cad kyi khyad par gyi 'jug pa'i phyir shes bya thams cad la thogs pa mi mnga' ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la rnam pa thams cad kyi khyad par gyi 'jug pa'i phyir shes bya thams cad la thogs pa mi mnga' ba yin no //
translated: Because it engages the distinctions of all aspects of all phenomena, it is unobstructed regarding all objects of knowledge.

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su ni //
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su ni //
translated: In the maṇḍalas of the retinue

original: 'byor ba thams cad ston mdzad pa //🔽the tshom thams cad gcod pa yi //
analyzed: 'byor ba thams cad ston mdzad pa // the tshom thams cad gcod pa yi //
translated: it displays all powers

original: chos chen char ni rab tu 'bebs //
analyzed: chos chen char ni rab tu 'bebs //
translated: and rains down the great Dharma🔽that cuts through all doubts.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la ni dpe mdo las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la ni dpe mdo las /
translated: The following is to be applied here:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rnam pa thams cad du shes bya yang dag par rab tu gsal bar mdzad pa'i phyir /🔽ye shes chen po'i nyi ma yin no zhes 'byung ba 'di sbyar bar bya'o //🔽bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rnam pa thams cad du shes bya yang dag par rab tu gsal bar mdzad pa'i phyir / ye shes chen po'i nyi ma yin no zhes 'byung ba 'di sbyar bar bya'o // bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are the sun of great intuition, because they illuminate all objects of knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la ni dpe mdo las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la ni dpe mdo las /
translated: The following is to be applied here:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar mdzad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar mdzad pa'i phyir /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are the medicine of great intuition, because they cure all the sicknesses of the addictions.

original: ye shes chen po'i sman yin no zhes 'byung ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: ye shes chen po'i sman yin no zhes 'byung ba 'di yin no //
translated: The following is to be applied here:🔽The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are the great physician of intuition, because they cure all the sicknesses of the addictions.

original: 'dzin pa'i phyir ni thos pa'i chos rnams so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i phyir ni thos pa'i chos rnams so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Dharma of learning is for the sake of retention.

original: rgyu 'di dang rim pa 'dis me long lta bu'i ye shes yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu 'di dang rim pa 'dis me long lta bu'i ye shes yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this cause and this process, the mirror-intuition is perfectly achieved.

original: sems mnyam pa'i phyir ni sems can thams cad la bdag dang @75a * //
analyzed: sems mnyam pa'i phyir ni sems can thams cad la bdag dang @75a * //
translated: The Dharma of realization is for the sake of the equality of mind, because of the equality of self and other.

original: gzhan mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes yang dag par 'grub ste /
analyzed: gzhan mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes yang dag par 'grub ste /
translated: The gnosis of equality is achieved through the equality of others,

original: 'di ltar de ni sems can thams cad la byams pa chen po mnyam pa nyid bsgoms pas yang dag par 'grub po //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni sems can thams cad la byams pa chen po mnyam pa nyid bsgoms pas yang dag par 'grub po //
translated: because it is achieved through the cultivation of the equality of great love for all sentient beings.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni chos yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni chos yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The gnosis of individual realization arises from the cause of teaching the Dharma well.

original: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni bya ba thams cad bsgrub pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni bya ba thams cad bsgrub pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The gnosis of achieving activities arises from the cause of achieving all activities.

original: sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs 'di dag yongs su dag na me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //🔽sangs rgyas kyi sa'i skabs kyis ci sangs rgyas gcig kho nar zad dam /
analyzed: sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs 'di dag yongs su dag na me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa mthar phyin par 'gyur ro // sangs rgyas kyi sa'i skabs kyis ci sangs rgyas gcig kho nar zad dam /
translated: When these stages of application and so on are pure, the mirrorlike gnosis and so forth are perfected.

original: 'on te mang mo zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'on te mang mo zhig ce na /
translated: In the context of the buddha level, is there only one buddha or many?

original: de la re zhig kha cig na re ji srid du 'jig rten gyi khams gcig na yod pa de srid du 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu sangs rgyas mi 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de la re zhig kha cig na re ji srid du 'jig rten gyi khams gcig na yod pa de srid du 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu sangs rgyas mi 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: As long as a Buddha exists in one world system, no other Buddha appears in other world systems.

original: gzhan dag na re 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na sangs rgyas gcig kho na zhig lcags sdong bzhin du bzhugs shing sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na sangs rgyas gcig kho na zhig lcags sdong bzhin du bzhugs shing sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad kyi /
translated: Others say: In all world systems, only one Buddha exists, like the central pole of a building, and performs the deeds of a Buddha.

original: mang po mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ni med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mang po mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ni med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Many do not attain manifest complete enlightenment.

original: gzhan dag na re sangs rgyas ni mang po zhig yin na chos kyi sku la bzhugs par ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa de dag kyang mang po nyid yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sangs rgyas ni mang po zhig yin na chos kyi sku la bzhugs par ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa de dag kyang mang po nyid yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Others say: Many Buddhas exist, but many are the Buddhas who have abandoned the pride of thinking “I am,” the pride of thinking “mine,” the afflictions, and the obscurations to that which needs to be known, together with their imprints, while abiding in the dharma body.

original: de dag 'gags pa'i phyir sangs rgyas gcig pa nyid dang mang po nyid ma yin pa'i skabs so //
analyzed: de dag 'gags pa'i phyir sangs rgyas gcig pa nyid dang mang po nyid ma yin pa'i skabs so //
translated: Because of their cessation, there is no oneness or multiplicity of the Buddha.🔽Because of the uselessness of a difference of species,

original: tha dad rigs don med phyir dang // rdzogs dang thog ma med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: tha dad rigs don med phyir dang // rdzogs dang thog ma med pa'i phyir //
translated: and because of perfection and beginninglessness,

original: sangs rgyas gcig pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas gcig pa ma yin no ;
translated: there is no oneness of the Buddha.

original: / dri med gnas te zag pa med pa'i dbyings na chos kyi sku tha dad min te mang po nyid ma yin gyi gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: / dri med gnas te zag pa med pa'i dbyings na chos kyi sku tha dad min te mang po nyid ma yin gyi gcig pa nyid do //
translated: In the immaculate abode, in the uncontaminated realm, the Dharma Body is not different, not multiple, but one.

original: sangs rgyas nyid de la ji ltar 'jug pa de'i thabs kyi dbang du byas nas tshigs su bcad pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid de la ji ltar 'jug pa de'i thabs kyi dbang du byas nas tshigs su bcad pa bzhi'o //
translated: Four verses on the method of entry into that Buddhahood.🔽That very nonapprehension of meditation is the highest meditation.

original: bsgom pa mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid bsgom pa dam pa yin zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe kun brtags pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa thams cad dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid bsgom pa dam pa yin zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe kun brtags pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa thams cad dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba bsgom pa ste /
translated: When one is free from all the imagined, from the apprehended object and apprehending subject, from the belief in a self and the belief in a self’s belongings, and from all conceptualization, then one meditates.

original: sa dang po thob pa nas bzung ste mthar thug pa'i bar gyi lam bsgom pa de ni sgom pa'i dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang po thob pa nas bzung ste mthar thug pa'i bar gyi lam bsgom pa de ni sgom pa'i dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cultivation of the path from the attainment of the first stage up to the ultimate stage is called the highest cultivation.

original: don 'di nyid ni don gyi ngo bo nyid @75b yongs su gcod par byed pa 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lnga brgya pa las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don 'di nyid ni don gyi ngo bo nyid @75b yongs su gcod par byed pa 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lnga brgya pa las blta bar bya'o //
translated: This very meaning should be seen in the noble Perfection of Wisdom in Five Hundred Verses, which determines the nature of the meaning.

original: gang dag sangs rgyas nyid la bla ma ya mtshan gyi chos dang ldan par lta ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang dag sangs rgyas nyid la bla ma ya mtshan gyi chos dang ldan par lta ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who view buddhahood as having qualities of wonderment are called “those who view as having qualities of wonderment.”

original: ya mtshan gyi chos dang ldan pa ni sangs rgyas nyid do //
analyzed: ya mtshan gyi chos dang ldan pa ni sangs rgyas nyid do //
translated: Having qualities of wonderment is buddhahood.

original: thob par bya'o zhes de ltar rnam par brtags nas khengs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: thob par bya'o zhes de ltar rnam par brtags nas khengs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Having investigated in that way, they become arrogant, thinking “I will attain it.”

original: sangs rgyas nyid ni brtson 'grus chen po yun ring po nas goms pas dka' ba spyad pa mang po phul du phyin pas thob par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ni brtson 'grus chen po yun ring po nas goms pas dka' ba spyad pa mang po phul du phyin pas thob par bya ba yin la /
translated: Buddhahood is to be attained by long-term cultivation of great diligence, by perfecting many austerities.

original: bdag kyang byang chub tu smon lam btab pa yin pas rnam pa de lta bus sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya'o zhes de snyam du bsams nas gzhan dag khyad du bsad de gyong bar 'gyur ba de dag ni de ltar nga rgyal kun tu spyod pa'i phyir sangs
analyzed: bdag kyang byang chub tu smon lam btab pa yin pas rnam pa de lta bus sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya'o zhes de snyam du bsams nas gzhan dag khyad du bsad de gyong bar 'gyur ba de dag ni de ltar nga rgyal kun tu spyod pa'i phyir sangs
translated: I too have made a vow for enlightenment, so I will attain buddhahood by that very means.🔽Thinking in this way, they despise others and become arrogant.

original: rgyas nyid las thag ring bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyas nyid las thag ring bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, they become far removed from buddhahood, because they are engaged in the practice of pride.

original: yang na nga rgyal zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam grangs yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na nga rgyal zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam grangs yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Or else, the term pride should be regarded here as a synonym for the conceptualization of an objective referent.

original: 'di dag thams cad ni rtog pa tsam mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni rtog pa tsam mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All of these are mere conceptualizations.

original: bla ma ring dang mtshan ma dang // zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bshad ma thag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma ring dang mtshan ma dang // zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bshad ma thag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The reference is to the immediately preceding explanations of pride, etc.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i gnas skabs na zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la lam mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i gnas skabs na zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la lam mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The reference is to the stage of the acceptance of the nonarising of things, because the path occurs effortlessly on the eighth stage.

original: bslab pa'i dmigs pa'i khyad par bshad zin to //
analyzed: bslab pa'i dmigs pa'i khyad par bshad zin to //
translated: The distinctive objects of training have been explained.

original: da ni ji ltar bslab pa yin pa de brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni ji ltar bslab pa yin pa de brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, we must explain how one trains.

original: de ji ltar bslab pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar bslab pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one train?

original: sbyor ba'i sa la rnam pa gang dag gis de slob pa ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sa la rnam pa gang dag gis de slob pa ste /
translated: On the stage of action in faith, one trains in the perfections by way of certain aspects.

original: bsam pa'i khyad par dang / sbyor ba dang / gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa dang / rang la phan pa sgrub pa dang / rang dang gzhan la phan pa rnam par dag pa nges par 'byung ba'i khyad par gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: bsam pa'i khyad par dang / sbyor ba dang / gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa dang / rang la phan pa sgrub pa dang / rang dang gzhan la phan pa rnam par dag pa nges par 'byung ba'i khyad par gyi sgo nas so //
translated: By way of the distinctive of attitude, distinctive of application, distinctive of accomplishment of benefit for others, distinctive of accomplishment of benefit for self, and distinctive of purification of benefit for self and others.

original: bsam pa'i sgo nas ji ltar slob ce na /
analyzed: bsam pa'i sgo nas ji ltar slob ce na /
translated: How does one train by way of attitude?

original: dam pa'i chos la mos pa rgyu dang 'bras bu 'tsham zhing phyin ci ma log par rang dang gzhan gyi don la sogs pa gzhi lngas bsdus pa mthong ba des dang po kho nar chos zab cing rgya che ba la nges par brtag pa lhur blang ba bya
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la mos pa rgyu dang 'bras bu 'tsham zhing phyin ci ma log par rang dang gzhan gyi don la sogs pa gzhi lngas bsdus pa mthong ba des dang po kho nar chos zab cing rgya che ba la nges par brtag pa lhur blang ba bya
translated: One who has faith in the holy Dharma, who sees the concordance of cause and effect, who is unmistaken about the benefit for self and others, and so on, which is included in the five topics, should first of all strive to ascertain the profound and extensive Dharma.

original: dgos pas de'i phyir byang chub kyi 'og tu mos pa'i skabs so //🔽yang na byang chub sems dpa' dag gis gang la bslab par bya ba rang dang gzhan gyi don nas bzung ste /
analyzed: dgos pas de'i phyir byang chub kyi 'og tu mos pa'i skabs so // yang na byang chub sems dpa' dag gis gang la bslab par bya ba rang dang gzhan gyi don nas bzung ste /
translated: Therefore, after enlightenment, the stage of devoted interest is explained.

original: byang chub kyi bar gzhi bdun po de ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar gzhi bdun po de ni bshad zin to //
translated: Or else, the seven topics beginning with the benefit have been explained, in which the bodhisattvas should be trained, up to enlightenment.🔽Now, how and in what manner do the bodhisattvas train?

original: da ni ji ltar te byang chub sems dpa' rnams rnam pa gang gis slob pa de ston to //
analyzed: da ni ji ltar te byang chub sems dpa' rnams rnam pa gang gis slob pa de ston to //
translated: That is taught.

original: @76a * // ji ltar slob ce na /
analyzed: @76a * // ji ltar slob ce na /
translated: How do they train?

original: mos pa dang chos yongs su tshol ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis so //🔽ji ltar phung po'i don las brtsams te gzugs gang ci yang rung 'das pa'am /🔽ma 'ongs pa'am /
analyzed: mos pa dang chos yongs su tshol ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis so // ji ltar phung po'i don las brtsams te gzugs gang ci yang rung 'das pa'am / ma 'ongs pa'am /
translated: By the stages of devoted interest, seeking the Dharma, etc.🔽How do they train beginning with the meaning of the aggregates?

original: da ltar byung ba'am /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'am /
translated: Whatever form there is, past, future, or present,

original: nang gi'am / phyi'i'am /🔽rags pa'am / phra ba 'am ;
analyzed: nang gi'am / phyi'i'am / rags pa'am / phra ba 'am ;
translated: internal or external,🔽gross or subtle,

original: ngan pa'am / gya nom pa'am /
analyzed: ngan pa'am / gya nom pa'am /
translated: inferior or exalted,

original: nye ba na 'dug pa gang yin pa 'am /
analyzed: nye ba na 'dug pa gang yin pa 'am /
translated: far or near.

original: thag ring po na 'dug pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i rim pa 'dis gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa de bzhin du mos pa yang mdo dag las 'das pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis dbye ba bstan to ;🔽/ gzung bar gyur pa ni phyi rol gyi ste gang la dmigs pa nyid du mos pa'o zhes bya ba ni mos pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos yin te /
analyzed: thag ring po na 'dug pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i rim pa 'dis gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa de bzhin du mos pa yang mdo dag las 'das pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis dbye ba bstan to ; / gzung bar gyur pa ni phyi rol gyi ste gang la dmigs pa nyid du mos pa'o zhes bya ba ni mos pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos yin te /
translated: Similarly, interest is taught in the sūtras to be classified according to the distinctions of the past and so on.🔽Interest in the external is that which is the object of interest.

original: gang gi tshe de theg pa chen po'i chos la dmigs te skye ba de'i tshe ni 'dzin pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de theg pa chen po'i chos la dmigs te skye ba de'i tshe ni 'dzin pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Interest is a mental factor, and when it arises in relation to the Mahāyāna teachings, it is taught to be grasping.

original: gang gi tshe de nyid 'das pa la ro myang ba'am /🔽rjes su yi rang ba'am /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyid 'das pa la ro myang ba'am / rjes su yi rang ba'am /
translated: When one relishes the past,

original: ma 'ongs pa la mngon par dga' ba la sogs par dmigs pa de'i tshe ni gzung ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la mngon par dga' ba la sogs par dmigs pa de'i tshe ni gzung ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: rejoices in the future, and so on, it is taught to be the object of interest.

original: yang na sems nyid thams cad du gnyis kyi rnam pa can du 'jug pas mos pa rnam pa gnyis su brjod do //
analyzed: yang na sems nyid thams cad du gnyis kyi rnam pa can du 'jug pas mos pa rnam pa gnyis su brjod do //
translated: Or else, it is said to be twofold, because the mind engages in the aspect of both.

original: log par mos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dper na nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams nyan thos kyi theg pa cher bsgom pa kho nas sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar mos pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: log par mos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dper na nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams nyan thos kyi theg pa cher bsgom pa kho nas sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar mos pa lta bu ste /
translated: Because of wrong belief, for example, the Sravakas believe that one can attain Buddhahood by cultivating the Sravakayana alone.

original: dgongs pa can gyi don la sgra ji bzhin du mos na log par mos pa'i phyir nor pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa can gyi don la sgra ji bzhin du mos na log par mos pa'i phyir nor pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If one believes literally in the meaning of the sutras that are of interpretable meaning, it is called a mistake, because of wrong belief.

original: mngon sum pa ni nye ba ste /
analyzed: mngon sum pa ni nye ba ste /
translated: Direct is near.

original: rkyen nye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa rkyen nyen de las de thos ma thag tu mos pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: rkyen nye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa rkyen nyen de las de thos ma thag tu mos pa skye ba'o //
translated: Because of the nearness of the conditions, for example, one who has the nearness of the conditions of a spiritual teacher, etc., generates belief immediately upon hearing the Dharma.

original: 'phrogs dang 'dres dang mi mthun phyogs ma 'dres //
analyzed: 'phrogs dang 'dres dang mi mthun phyogs ma 'dres //
translated: It is stolen, mixed, and unmixed with the adverse.

original: zhes bya ba la mos pa'i rab tu dbye ba 'di ni mdo las chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / dman pa dang / rgya chen po dang / bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa dang / brtson pa dang / ma brtson pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la mos pa'i rab tu dbye ba 'di ni mdo las chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / dman pa dang / rgya chen po dang / bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa dang / brtson pa dang / ma brtson pa dang /
translated: This classification of conviction is mentioned in the sutra as small, middling, great, inferior, superior, obscured, unobscured, with effort, without effort,

original: bsags pa dang / ma bsags pa dang / bstan pa dang ring du zhugs pa'i bye brag gis brjod pa ste gzhan yin no //
analyzed: bsags pa dang / ma bsags pa dang / bstan pa dang ring du zhugs pa'i bye brag gis brjod pa ste gzhan yin no //
translated: accumulated, unaccumulated, and distinguished as taught and practiced for a long time.

original: 'dres pa ni 'bring po'o zhes bya ba ni res 'ga' mos res 'ga' mi mos pa ste /
analyzed: 'dres pa ni 'bring po'o zhes bya ba ni res 'ga' mos res 'ga' mi mos pa ste /
translated: Mixed is middling. Sometimes one has conviction, sometimes one does not.

original: ma mos pa dang mos pa 'dre ba'i @76b phyir 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma mos pa dang mos pa 'dre ba'i @76b phyir 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called mixed because non-conviction and conviction are mixed.

original: ma mos pa ni 'dun pa med pa dang / le lo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma mos pa ni 'dun pa med pa dang / le lo la sogs pa'o //
translated: Non-conviction is lack of aspiration, laziness, and so on.

original: bsgribs pa ni khyad par du 'gro bar bya ba la sgrib pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mos pa yod du zin kyang bya ba ngan pas 'brel pas khyad par mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: bsgribs pa ni khyad par du 'gro bar bya ba la sgrib pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mos pa yod du zin kyang bya ba ngan pas 'brel pas khyad par mi 'thob ste /
translated: Obscured is that which is associated with obscurations to progress. Even if one has conviction, one does not attain distinction because one is bound by bad actions.

original: de'i phyir sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called an obscuration.

original: yang na gang gis na tshe phyi ma la ma mos par 'gyur ba dam pa'i chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las byas pa'i phyir sgrib pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gang gis na tshe phyi ma la ma mos par 'gyur ba dam pa'i chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las byas pa'i phyir sgrib pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, it is called an obscuration because one has performed actions that will result in the loss of the true Dharma in a future life, due to which one will have no faith in the true Dharma.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni rtag tu rgyun ma chad par ro //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni rtag tu rgyun ma chad par ro //
translated: Constantly means: always, without break.

original: rtag tu yin yang la la bsam pa drag pos mi byed pas de yongs su spangs pa'i phyir gus par byas te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rtag tu yin yang la la bsam pa drag pos mi byed pas de yongs su spangs pa'i phyir gus par byas te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Although one is constantly engaged in the practice, one is not engaged in it with a strong intention. In order to completely avoid this, it says: with devotion.

original: bsags pa ni de rtogs par rung ba'o zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bskal pa grangs med pa dang pos bsdus pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: bsags pa ni de rtogs par rung ba'o zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bskal pa grangs med pa dang pos bsdus pa tsam gyis so //
translated: Accumulated means: suitable for the realization of that. The accumulation of merit and wisdom is included in the first incalculable aeon.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par gyur pa la ni rnal 'byor 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba ni las dang po pa la gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i dngos po sngar bshad pa'i tshul du bden par rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par gyur pa la ni rnal 'byor 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba ni las dang po pa la gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i dngos po sngar bshad pa'i tshul du bden par rnam par 'jog go //
translated: The disturbance of yoga in regard to the apprehended object and apprehending subject is for the beginner, the true establishment of the apprehended object and apprehending subject in the manner previously explained.

original: gang gi tshe thams cad du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la gzhol bar gyur na de ni rnal 'byor 'khrugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe thams cad du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la gzhol bar gyur na de ni rnal 'byor 'khrugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When it is directed everywhere to the apprehended object and apprehending subject, then it is called disturbed yoga.

original: su'i 'khrugs she na /
analyzed: su'i 'khrugs she na /
translated: Whose yoga is disturbed?

original: rnal 'byor ba'i ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i ste /
translated: The yoga of the bodhisattva.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba la gnyis su mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba la gnyis su mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the adherence to duality in non-conceptual intuition which is devoid of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: bdag nyid mos pa la ni dge ba'i rtsa ba nyam chung ba'o zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba dag yang dang yang du ma goms par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid mos pa la ni dge ba'i rtsa ba nyam chung ba'o zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba dag yang dang yang du ma goms par gyur ba'o //
translated: The weakness of the roots of the wholesome refers to the roots of the wholesome such as faith and non-greed which have not been repeatedly cultivated.

original: nor pa'i mos pa'i bar du gcod pa ni bsam par mi bya ste /
analyzed: nor pa'i mos pa'i bar du gcod pa ni bsam par mi bya ste /
translated: The obstruction to the faith of conviction should not be conceived as being real;

original: de nyid bar du gcod pa yin pas so //
analyzed: de nyid bar du gcod pa yin pas so //
translated: because it is just an obstruction, it is not real.

original: dkar po'i phyogs kyi mos pa kho na'i bar du gcod pa bsam par bya ba yin pas mngon sum pa ma yin pa'i bar du gcod pa yang bsam par mi bya ste /
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs kyi mos pa kho na'i bar du gcod pa bsam par bya ba yin pas mngon sum pa ma yin pa'i bar du gcod pa yang bsam par mi bya ste /
translated: The obstruction to the faith of conviction alone should be conceived as being real, but the obstruction to the faith of direct realization should not be conceived as being real;

original: rang nyid bar du gcod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid bar du gcod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the very nature of the obstacles to obstruct oneself.

original: zhi gnas tsam gyis mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong la mngon par brtson par mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas tsam gyis mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong la mngon par brtson par mi byed pa ste /
translated: One who is proud of mere calm abiding is one who does not strive for insight.

original: gang gi tshe zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag mnyam par 'jug pa de'i tshe zung du 'brel ba'i lam thob pa'i phyir mos pa gegs med par 'gyur ro //🔽ma bsgribs pa la ni sgrib pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe le lo la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag gis don dan pa la 'brel ba'i bya bas gor nas gong du khyad par du @77a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag mnyam par 'jug pa de'i tshe zung du 'brel ba'i lam thob pa'i phyir mos pa gegs med par 'gyur ro // ma bsgribs pa la ni sgrib pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe le lo la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag gis don dan pa la 'brel ba'i bya bas gor nas gong du khyad par du @77a * //
translated: When calm abiding and insight are evenly united, then, because one has attained the path that unites the two, one's aspiration is unobstructed.🔽One who is not free of obscurations is one who is obscured.

original: 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When one is obstructed by unfavorable conditions such as laziness, etc., one does not progress further and further.🔽One who has generated it is one of great merit.

original: skyes pa da ltar byung ba'i ni bsod nams chen po'o zhes bya ba ni sngar mos pa skyes pa ni 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnam pa gnyis su bshad do //
analyzed: skyes pa da ltar byung ba'i ni bsod nams chen po'o zhes bya ba ni sngar mos pa skyes pa ni 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnam pa gnyis su bshad do //
translated: One who has previously generated aspiration is explained as being of two types: one who has generated it in the past and one who has generated it in the present.

original: de la da ltar byung ba'i phan yon ni bsod nams chen po yin no //
analyzed: de la da ltar byung ba'i phan yon ni bsod nams chen po yin no //
translated: The benefit that occurs in the present is great merit.

original: 'das pa ni mngon par dga' ba la sogs pa'i mos pas yang dang yang du goms par byas pa la 'gyod pa med pa phan yon yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa ni mngon par dga' ba la sogs pa'i mos pas yang dang yang du goms par byas pa la 'gyod pa med pa phan yon yin te /
translated: The benefit of the past is the absence of regret for repeated practice with faith that is full of joy, etc.

original: yid la gcags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid la gcags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a benefit because there is no remorse.

original: 'dzin pa dang gzung bar gyur pa'i ni yid bde ba chen po ste /🔽ting nge 'dzin dang yang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe gzung ba dang 'dzin par 'gyur pa'i mos pa de la mngon par zhen par mi byed kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid rnam par 'jig par byed pa de'i tshe mngon par zhen
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang gzung bar gyur pa'i ni yid bde ba chen po ste / ting nge 'dzin dang yang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe gzung ba dang 'dzin par 'gyur pa'i mos pa de la mngon par zhen par mi byed kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid rnam par 'jig par byed pa de'i tshe mngon par zhen
translated: The benefit of the future is the attainment of the great joy of mind that is free of both the subject and object aspect.🔽It is a benefit because one attains concentration.

original: pa bor bas ting nge 'dzin 'thob po //
analyzed: pa bor bas ting nge 'dzin 'thob po //
translated: When one does not cling to the faith that is free of the subject and object aspect, but rather destroys the subject and object aspect, then one attains concentration by abandoning clinging.🔽The benefit of the vast is the attainment of the supreme goal of others.

original: rgya chen po'i ni gzhan gyi don thob pa'i mchog go zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgya chen po'i ni gzhan gyi don thob pa'i mchog go zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a benefit because one attains Buddhahood.

original: phan yon ni mngon par shes pa myur ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phan yon ni mngon par shes pa myur ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The benefit is the swift acquisition of the superknowledges.

original: mngon par shes pa myur ba nyid ni dbang po rnon po nyid de /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa myur ba nyid ni dbang po rnon po nyid de /
translated: The swift acquisition of the superknowledges is the keenness of the faculties.

original: mgo smos pas go ba'i phyir chos myur du rab tu shes pa yin no //
analyzed: mgo smos pas go ba'i phyir chos myur du rab tu shes pa yin no //
translated: Because of understanding through a mere indication, one quickly understands the Dharma.🔽For those who possess mundane concentration, it is like a tortoise.

original: 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa rnams kyi ni rus sbal ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid khong du ma chud pa'i phyir mos pa 'khums pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa rnams kyi ni rus sbal ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid khong du ma chud pa'i phyir mos pa 'khums pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of not comprehending the specific and general characteristics of all things, interest is said to be contracted.

original: yang na bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa tsam gyi phyir dang / de tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa'i phyir dang / yon tan khyad par can ma thob pa'i phyir 'khums pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa tsam gyi phyir dang / de tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa'i phyir dang / yon tan khyad par can ma thob pa'i phyir 'khums pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, it is contracted because one is satisfied with merely attaining the meditative development of the meditative absorptions, etc., because of the absence of the realization of reality and because of the non-acquisition of the special qualities.

original: rang gi don dang ldan pa nyan thos rnams kyis ni gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs pa'i phyir chos thams cad spyi'i rnam par shes so //
analyzed: rang gi don dang ldan pa nyan thos rnams kyis ni gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs pa'i phyir chos thams cad spyi'i rnam par shes so //
translated: Those who have their own aim, i.e., the śrāvakas, know all things in a general way, because they know the selflessness of the person.

original: de gnyis kyi phyir de dag gi mos pa rus sbal lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi phyir de dag gi mos pa rus sbal lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: For these two reasons, their interest is not like that of the tortoise.

original: 'on kyang rang gi don lhur len pa'i phyir 'khor bas skrag pas skyo ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi don lhur len pa'i phyir 'khor bas skrag pas skyo ste /
translated: However, because they are intent on their own aim, they are discouraged by fear of samsara.

original: bran bzhin du 'jigs shing skrag pa'i lus kyis rnam par rgyu bas de'i phyir bran dang 'dra'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bran bzhin du 'jigs shing skrag pa'i lus kyis rnam par rgyu bas de'i phyir bran dang 'dra'o zhes bya'o //
translated: They move about with a body that is fearful and frightened, like a slave. Therefore, they are said to be like slaves.

original: don de nyid gzhan gyis bstan nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don de nyid gzhan gyis bstan nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of this is taught by another verse:

original: ji ltar khyi ni rtag tu ltogs shing sdug bsngal gyis nyen chog mi shes //
analyzed: ji ltar khyi ni rtag tu ltogs shing sdug bsngal gyis nyen chog mi shes //
translated: Just as a dog, always hungry and suffering, does not know contentment,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni tshigs su bcad @77b pa dang po las gzhan yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni tshigs su bcad @77b pa dang po las gzhan yin no //
translated: This verse is different from the first verse.

original: 'dis bstan nas de'i 'og tu gsum pas theg pa chen po la mos pa yang dag par len du 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis bstan nas de'i 'og tu gsum pas theg pa chen po la mos pa yang dag par len du 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Having taught this, then in the third verse he causes those who have interest in the Great Vehicle to take it up.

original: theg pa chen po de la de mchog tshul bzhin rig nas ni //
analyzed: theg pa chen po de la de mchog tshul bzhin rig nas ni //
translated: Having understood that the Great Vehicle is the best way to that,

original: 'di na bstan pas de la de nyid rtag par rab tu tshol //
analyzed: 'di na bstan pas de la de nyid rtag par rab tu tshol //
translated: he always seeks that for them, because of his teaching.

original: zhes de skad du theg pa chen po la mos pa yang dag par len du 'jug go //
analyzed: zhes de skad du theg pa chen po la mos pa yang dag par len du 'jug go //
translated: Thus he causes those who aspire to the Great Vehicle to take it up.

original: bdag nyid za ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi don gyi dbang du byas nas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid za ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi don gyi dbang du byas nas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: He does not eat what is not eaten by others.

original: re zhig gang zhig brtse ba'i don dang / rgyags pa dang / cha ba la sogs pa'i don du za ba de'i zas de ni bsod nams ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur ro //🔽gang zhig lung du ma bstan par za ba de'i zas de ni bsod nams kyang ma yin /
analyzed: re zhig gang zhig brtse ba'i don dang / rgyags pa dang / cha ba la sogs pa'i don du za ba de'i zas de ni bsod nams ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur ro // gang zhig lung du ma bstan par za ba de'i zas de ni bsod nams kyang ma yin /
translated: The food of one who eats out of love, or out of vanity, intoxication, or pride, is only demerit.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The food of one who eats what is morally neutral is neither merit nor demerit.

original: gang zhig rgyags pa la sogs pa'i don du mi za'i /
analyzed: gang zhig rgyags pa la sogs pa'i don du mi za'i /
translated: But one who does not eat out of vanity, etc.,

original: 'on kyang khal dag la ba'i don du shing rta'i srog shing skud pa lta bu'i tshul du lus 'tsho bas dge ba'i phyogs la rung bar 'gyur zhing dge sbyong gi tshul du 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur ro snyam nas lus 'tsho bar bya ba'i don du za ba'i
analyzed: 'on kyang khal dag la ba'i don du shing rta'i srog shing skud pa lta bu'i tshul du lus 'tsho bas dge ba'i phyogs la rung bar 'gyur zhing dge sbyong gi tshul du 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur ro snyam nas lus 'tsho bar bya ba'i don du za ba'i
translated: But, in order to carry the load, the body is sustained like a chariot's axle by means of food. Thus, it will be fit for the side of virtue and will obtain the fruit in the form of an ascetic.

original: zas de ni bsod nams su 'gyur gyi bsod nams 'byung ba chen por ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zas de ni bsod nams su 'gyur gyi bsod nams 'byung ba chen por ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The food that is eaten for the sake of sustaining the body is merit, but it is not a great source of merit.🔽In the same way, the benefit that comes from being devoted to the Dharma of the Sravakayana is not a great source of merit, as great as the benefit that comes from listening to and reciting a single verse of the Dharma of the Mahayana, which is the basis for the welfare of others.

original: de bzhin du nyan thos kyi theg pa'i chos la mos pa las kyang gzhan gyi don gyi rten theg pa chen po'i chos bstan pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig mnyan pa dang / bton pa la sogs pa las phan yon ji skad du theg pa chen po'i mdo de dang de dag las 'byung ba ci 'dra ba de 'dra bar bsod nams 'byung ba chen po ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyan thos kyi theg pa'i chos la mos pa las kyang gzhan gyi don gyi rten theg pa chen po'i chos bstan pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig mnyan pa dang / bton pa la sogs pa las phan yon ji skad du theg pa chen po'i mdo de dang de dag las 'byung ba ci 'dra ba de 'dra bar bsod nams 'byung ba chen po ma yin no //
translated: The benefit that comes from being devoted to the Dharma of the Mahayana is like the benefit that comes from listening to and reciting a single verse of the Dharma of the Mahayana, which is the basis for the welfare of others.

original: de ltar 'phags pa chen po'i chos ni yangs gyur la //
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa chen po'i chos ni yangs gyur la //
translated: Thus, the Dharma of the great noble ones is vast.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: yangs par gyur pa ni theg pa chen po ste /
analyzed: yangs par gyur pa ni theg pa chen po ste /
translated: The Great Vehicle is vast.🔽

original: mdo sde 'bum pa du ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo sde 'bum pa du ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Great Vehicle is vast because it teaches many hundreds of thousands of scriptures.

original: gang la dang gang zhig dang mos pa ji lta bus 'bras bu gang yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang la dang gang zhig dang mos pa ji lta bus 'bras bu gang yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The verse shows the basis, the one who has it, the kind of interest, and the result that is possessed.

original: gang la shes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i chos yangs pa la'o //
analyzed: gang la shes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i chos yangs pa la'o //
translated: The basis is the vast Dharma of the Great Vehicle.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' blo dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' blo dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The one who has it is the wise bodhisattva.

original: mos pa ji lta bu zhes bya ba ni mos pa yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba rgya chen pos te /
analyzed: mos pa ji lta bu zhes bya ba ni mos pa yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba rgya chen pos te /
translated: The kind of interest is that it is not lost, and it is vast,

original: mos pa che zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mos pa che zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: as explained in the verse on great interest.

original: 'bras bu gang yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni bsod nams rgya chen po 'phel ba la sogs pa 'bras bu rnam pa gsum yongs su 'dzin pa'o /
analyzed: 'bras bu gang yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni bsod nams rgya chen po 'phel ba la sogs pa 'bras bu rnam pa gsum yongs su 'dzin pa'o /
translated: The result that is possessed is the possession of the three kinds of results, the increase of great merit and so on.

original: // / @78a * //  mos pa'i skabs kyi 'og tu chos yongs su tshol ba'i skabs te /🔽'di'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: // / @78a * //  mos pa'i skabs kyi 'og tu chos yongs su tshol ba'i skabs te /🔽'di'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: The chapter on interest is followed by the chapter on the investigation of the teaching,🔽because interest in the teaching is aroused by investigating it.

original: de ltar smos pa mang po'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos yongs su tshol lo //
analyzed: de ltar smos pa mang po'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos yongs su tshol lo //
translated: The bodhisattva who has been described as having many such qualities seeks the Dharma.

original: chos yongs su tshol ba de'i dmigs pa ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos yongs su tshol ba de'i dmigs pa ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the object of his seeking the Dharma?🔽Therefore, he says,

original: de'i phyir / sde snod dag ni gsum mam gnyis kyang rung zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sde snod dag ni gsum mam gnyis kyang rung zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The collections are three or two.

original: de la gsung rab kyi yan lag tu gtogs pa bcu gnyis las shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod yin no //
analyzed: de la gsung rab kyi yan lag tu gtogs pa bcu gnyis las shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod yin no //
translated: Among the twelve branches of the scriptures, the Vaipulya and the Jataka are the bodhisattva collection.

original: lhag ma ni phal cher nyan thos kyi sde snod yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni phal cher nyan thos kyi sde snod yin no //
translated: The rest are for the most part the sravaka collection.

original: phal cher zhes smos pa ni yan lag kha cig ni theg pa chen po dang nyan thos kyi theg pa thun mong yin pas so //
analyzed: phal cher zhes smos pa ni yan lag kha cig ni theg pa chen po dang nyan thos kyi theg pa thun mong yin pas so //
translated: He says for the most part because some branches are common to the Great Vehicle and the sravaka vehicle.

original: de yang gsum mam gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de yang gsum mam gnyis yin no //
translated: And that is three or two.

original: ci'i phyir sde snod ces bya ba zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sde snod ces bya ba zhe na /
translated: Why are they called collections?🔽He says,

original: smras pa / bsdus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / bsdus pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are compilations.

original: don thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dper na gnas gzhan kha cig na bre bcu shong ba la bre bcu bsdus pa'i phyir sde snod ces bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang shes bya'i don thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir sde snod ces bya'o //
analyzed: don thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dper na gnas gzhan kha cig na bre bcu shong ba la bre bcu bsdus pa'i phyir sde snod ces bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang shes bya'i don thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir sde snod ces bya'o //
translated: For example, in some places, a basket is called a container of ten bre of grain, and in the same way, here, a collection is called a container of all topics of knowledge.

original: ci'i phyir gsum yin zhe na /🔽rgyu gus zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dang / chos mngon pa dang / 'dul ba rnams la so sor the tshom dang mtha' gnyis dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gsum yin zhe na / rgyu gus zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dang / chos mngon pa dang / 'dul ba rnams la so sor the tshom dang mtha' gnyis dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Why are there three?🔽Because of the three causes, doubt, the two extremes, and grasping an extreme view, etc.🔽Each has a separate cause: doubt, the two extremes, and grasping an extreme view, etc.

original: re re la'ang rgyu so sor the tshom dang mtha' gnyis dang / mdo sde gang zhig don gang la the tshom za ba de la de nges par bya ba'i ched du bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re re la'ang rgyu so sor the tshom dang mtha' gnyis dang / mdo sde gang zhig don gang la the tshom za ba de la de nges par bya ba'i ched du bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because each is explained in order to ascertain the meaning of a sūtra about which one has doubt.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang zhig don gang la the tshom za ba de bstsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang zhig don gang la the tshom za ba de bstsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it eliminates doubt about any meaning.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / bden pa dang / sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag la the tshom za ba rnams la the tshom spang ba'i phyir de dang 'tsham par bshad pa smos pa'i tshul du mdo sde bshad pa de'i phyir the tshom gyi gnyen por mdo sde bshad do🔽// mtha' gnyis la sbyor ba'i gnyen por ni 'dul ba ste kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i yongs su spyad dka' ba'i sgo nas /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / bden pa dang / sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag la the tshom za ba rnams la the tshom spang ba'i phyir de dang 'tsham par bshad pa smos pa'i tshul du mdo sde bshad pa de'i phyir the tshom gyi gnyen por mdo sde bshad do // mtha' gnyis la sbyor ba'i gnyen por ni 'dul ba ste kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i yongs su spyad dka' ba'i sgo nas /
translated: The sutras are explained in order to eliminate doubts about the aggregates, elements, sense bases, dependent origination, truths, levels, perfections, and so on, and their general and specific characteristics. Therefore, the sutras are explained as the antidote to doubt.🔽The Vinaya is the antidote to engaging in the two extremes.

original: zhes bya ba la mtha' gnyis la sbyor ba ni 'dod pa'i bsod nyams dang bdag nyid dub pa la sbyor ba dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la mtha' gnyis la sbyor ba ni 'dod pa'i bsod nyams dang bdag nyid dub pa la sbyor ba dag go //
translated: Engaging in the two extremes means engaging in indulgence in desires and self-mortification.

original: 'dod pa'i bsod nyams la sbyor ba dag ni @78b dper na 'dod pa can yongs su spyod pa lta bur bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa'i gzhi bcas pa de las 'das te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i bsod nyams la sbyor ba dag ni @78b dper na 'dod pa can yongs su spyod pa lta bur bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa'i gzhi bcas pa de las 'das te /
translated: Those who are devoted to the indulgence of desire are like those who indulge in sense objects. The Blessed One has established the bases of training so that one should not transgress them.

original: gsog 'jog byas pa la sogs pa yongs su spyod pas bdag nyid cha ba la sogs pa'i don du yongs su spyod pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gsog 'jog byas pa la sogs pa yongs su spyod pas bdag nyid cha ba la sogs pa'i don du yongs su spyod pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Indulgence is the indulgence in the sense objects of form, sound, etc. for the sake of one's own enjoyment, etc. by indulging in the sense objects of form, sound, etc. that are stored up, etc.

original: de'i gnyen po'o //🔽ji lta zhe na gang zhig yongs su spyod pa dgag pa mdzad pa de lta bu de thag bsrings te yongs su spong pa ni gus pa drag pos bslab pa'i gnas ji ltar bcas pa dag la gus par byed pas de ltar kha na ma tho ba dang
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'o // ji lta zhe na gang zhig yongs su spyod pa dgag pa mdzad pa de lta bu de thag bsrings te yongs su spong pa ni gus pa drag pos bslab pa'i gnas ji ltar bcas pa dag la gus par byed pas de ltar kha na ma tho ba dang
translated: The antidote to that is the avoidance of indulgence.

original: bcas pa'i yongs su spyod pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: bcas pa'i yongs su spyod pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: How is that? The avoidance of indulgence in sense objects is the avoidance of indulgence in sense objects that is far removed from the indulgence in sense objects that is prohibited. It is the avoidance of indulgence in sense objects that is prohibited by the avoidance of blameworthy indulgence.

original: bdag nyid dub pa la sbyor ba'i mtha'i gnyen por ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i yongs su spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid dub pa la sbyor ba'i mtha'i gnyen por ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i yongs su spyod pa'o //
translated: The antidote to the extreme of self-mortification is the avoidance of blameless indulgence.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar gnang ba de yongs su spyod kyi /🔽bdag nyid nub gsum dang nub drug tu gdung ba dang yongs su gdung ba la sogs pas dub par mi byed pa ste ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa yon tan dang ldan pa la ni ngas zas ro brgya dang ldan
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar gnang ba de yongs su spyod kyi / bdag nyid nub gsum dang nub drug tu gdung ba dang yongs su gdung ba la sogs pas dub par mi byed pa ste ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa yon tan dang ldan pa la ni ngas zas ro brgya dang ldan
translated: He uses what is blameless, what the Lord has permitted.🔽He does not tire himself with mortifications, such as sleeping in water or on land for three or six nights, etc.

original: pa dang / gos 'bum ri ba yang gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: pa dang / gos 'bum ri ba yang gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The Lord has said: “I permit food of a hundred tastes and garments worth a hundred thousand for a monk who is virtuous and has good qualities.”🔽When he eats that food, he eats without attachment, not for intoxication, etc.

original: zas de yang za ba na ma chags shing rgyags pa la sogs pa'i don du ma yin par za na de lta na kha na ma tho ba med pa'i yongs su spyad pa bdag nyid dub pa la sbyor ba'i mtha'i gnyen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zas de yang za ba na ma chags shing rgyags pa la sogs pa'i don du ma yin par za na de lta na kha na ma tho ba med pa'i yongs su spyad pa bdag nyid dub pa la sbyor ba'i mtha'i gnyen por 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the use of what is blameless is the antidote to the extreme of mortification.

original: 'dul bas ni chos dang don 'grub pa ste /

translated: Correct analytical discrimination is when one correctly analyzes phenomena as the summary of the Dharma, as emptiness, signlessness and wishlessness, then one rises above even the most subtle downfalls.🔽The classification is, for example, the six classifications of this precept: “Do not urinate or defecate on green grass or in water, etc.”
