translated: The object is of four kinds:🔽The Dharma as object is the teaching.

original: dmigs pa chos ni bshad pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i chos mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyi sa bsnyad pa'i sde la @80b sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa chos ni bshad pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i chos mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyi sa bsnyad pa'i sde la @80b sogs pa ste /
translated: The Dharma of the universal vehicle, the scriptural division of Sutra, mixed verse and prose, etc.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' shes rab rnon po'i dmigs pa yin gyi thams cad kyi ni ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' shes rab rnon po'i dmigs pa yin gyi thams cad kyi ni ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: This is the object of the bodhisattva of keen acumen, not of all bodhisattvas.

original: lus la sogs pa ni nang ste zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa ni nang ste zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The body, etc. are the internal object.

original: stsogs pa zhes smos pa ni tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa zhes smos pa ni tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The word etc. includes feelings, mind, and dharmas.

original: yang na dmigs pa chos so zhes smos pa ni skye ba na yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kho na skye la 'gag pa na yang 'gag gi gzhan nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na dmigs pa chos so zhes smos pa ni skye ba na yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kho na skye la 'gag pa na yang 'gag gi gzhan nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Or else, the phrase “the object is the dharmas” means that when they arise, only the dharmas of defilement and purification arise, and when they cease, only they cease. There is no person as an inner agent.

original: de la nang gi dmigs pa 'dzin par gyur pa ni dbang po'i gzugs can mig la sogs pa dang yid do //🔽phyir rol gyi dmigs pa gzung ba ni 'dzin pa'i spyod yul gyi don nyid dam /
analyzed: de la nang gi dmigs pa 'dzin par gyur pa ni dbang po'i gzugs can mig la sogs pa dang yid do // phyir rol gyi dmigs pa gzung ba ni 'dzin pa'i spyod yul gyi don nyid dam /
translated: Among them, the inner object is the apprehending subject, which is the five sense faculties such as the eye, and the mind.🔽The outer object is the apprehended object, which is the object that is the domain of the apprehending subject, or it is form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ste gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ste gsum pa yin no //
translated: The third is the inner and outer object.

original: nang dang phyi de dag nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gnyis ni dmigs pa bzhi pa yin te /
analyzed: nang dang phyi de dag nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gnyis ni dmigs pa bzhi pa yin te /
translated: The suchness of those inner and outer objects is the fourth object.

original: 'di ni tshigs su bcad pa las //
analyzed: 'di ni tshigs su bcad pa las //
translated: This is the explanation of the four kinds of objects, which is found in the verse:

original: dmigs pa chos dang nang dang ni //
analyzed: dmigs pa chos dang nang dang ni //
translated: The object is the dharma, the inner,

original: phyi dang gnyis ni yin par 'dod //
analyzed: phyi dang gnyis ni yin par 'dod //
translated: The outer, and both.

original: ces dmigs pa rnam pa bzhi bshad pa gang yin pa rnam par phye ba yin no //
analyzed: ces dmigs pa rnam pa bzhi bshad pa gang yin pa rnam par phye ba yin no //
translated: The four kinds of objects are distinguished in the verse.

original: de la nang gi dmigs pa la sogs pa ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rtsa ba'i gzhung nyid las shin tu rnam par phye bar yang zad na dmigs pa de dag nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gnyis so zhes bya ba de bzhin nyid la ni
analyzed: de la nang gi dmigs pa la sogs pa ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rtsa ba'i gzhung nyid las shin tu rnam par phye bar yang zad na dmigs pa de dag nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gnyis so zhes bya ba de bzhin nyid la ni
translated: The internal object, etc., are distinguished in the basic text by the distinctions of grasping, etc.

original: tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But, since there is no difference in reality, how can there be a difference in the objects of observation of reality?

original: nang gi la sogs pa'i dbye bas de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs pa tha dad par rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: nang gi la sogs pa'i dbye bas de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs pa tha dad par rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The objects of observation of reality are established as different by the distinctions of internal, etc.

original: dper na bum pa'i nam mkha' dang gnas khang gi nam mkha' zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar chos can gyi bye brag gis tha dad par rnam par gzhag gi rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa'i nam mkha' dang gnas khang gi nam mkha' zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar chos can gyi bye brag gis tha dad par rnam par gzhag gi rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
translated: For example, like the space of a vase and the space of a house, they are established as different by the distinctions of the phenomena, but not by their own natures.

original: de la chos kyi dmigs pa dang por bstan pa dang de ni brjod par bya ba mang ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa dang gsum pa dag gis rgyas par 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la chos kyi dmigs pa dang por bstan pa dang de ni brjod par bya ba mang ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa dang gsum pa dag gis rgyas par 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Among them, the object of observation of phenomena is first taught, and it is explained extensively in the second and third verses because it has many things to be said.

original: nang gi dmigs pa la sogs pa ni brjod par bya ba nyung ba de dag gi dmigs pa rnyed pa dang po brjod do //
analyzed: nang gi dmigs pa la sogs pa ni brjod par bya ba nyung ba de dag gi dmigs pa rnyed pa dang po brjod do //
translated: The internal object, etc., are mentioned because they are the objects of the few things to be described.

original: de la nang dang phyi'i dmigs pa gnyis ni don gnyis kyis go rims bzhin du rnyed de /
analyzed: de la nang dang phyi'i dmigs pa gnyis ni don gnyis kyis go rims bzhin du rnyed de /
translated: The internal and external objects are found in two ways, respectively, by the two kinds of object.

original: gal te gzung ba'i don las 'dzin pa'i don tha mi dad par mthong ba'am /
analyzed: gal te gzung ba'i don las 'dzin pa'i don tha mi dad par mthong ba'am /
translated: If the object of apprehension is seen as not different from the object of the apprehended,

original: zhes bya ba ji ltar tha mi dad par mthong @81a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ji ltar tha mi dad par mthong @81a * //
translated: how is it seen as not different?

original: zhe na ; gnyis su snang ba 'di yang rnam par shes pa kho na snang bar zad kyi dmigs pa gzugs la sogs pa rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs par rang gi ngo bor gnyis su yongs su grub pas grub pa ni med do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: zhe na ; gnyis su snang ba 'di yang rnam par shes pa kho na snang bar zad kyi dmigs pa gzugs la sogs pa rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs par rang gi ngo bor gnyis su yongs su grub pas grub pa ni med do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The appearance of duality is only the appearance of consciousness itself. The object of apprehension, form, etc., are not established as having a nature of their own, apart from consciousness.

original: bha dri ha ris ji skad du //
analyzed: bha dri ha ris ji skad du //
translated: Bhadrahari says:🔽Space, earth, wind, sun,

original: nam mkha' sa rlung nyi ma dang // rgya mtsho rlung dang phyogs rnams ni //
analyzed: nam mkha' sa rlung nyi ma dang // rgya mtsho rlung dang phyogs rnams ni //
translated: ocean, wind, and directions

original: nang gi shes pa'i ngo bo yi //
analyzed: nang gi shes pa'i ngo bo yi //
translated: are the internal nature of consciousness.

original: cha las phyi rol lta bur 'dug / ces bshad pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: cha las phyi rol lta bur 'dug / ces bshad pa lta bu yin no //
translated: It is as if it were external to the parts.🔽When one sees that the object of the act of grasping is not different from the object of the act of apprehending,

original: 'dzin pa'i don las gzung ba'i don tha mi dad par mthong na'o zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ni rnam par shes pa kho nar zad kyi rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa byis pas kun brtags pa mig la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i don
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i don las gzung ba'i don tha mi dad par mthong na'o zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ni rnam par shes pa kho nar zad kyi rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa byis pas kun brtags pa mig la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i don
translated: the object of the act of apprehending is only consciousness. Apart from consciousness, the object of the act of apprehending, such as the eye, etc.,

original: ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: which is imagined by the foolish, does not exist.

original: de'i phyir don du snang ba thams cad sems kho na yin par blta'o /
analyzed: de'i phyir don du snang ba thams cad sems kho na yin par blta'o /
translated: Therefore, one should see that all appearances of objects are only mind.

original: don sems las gzhan par ni mi blta'o //
analyzed: don sems las gzhan par ni mi blta'o //
translated: One should not see objects as other than mind.

original: de'i tshe ni 'di'i gzung ba la rnam par g-yeng ba spangs la 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'ba' zhig bsdus te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni 'di'i gzung ba la rnam par g-yeng ba spangs la 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'ba' zhig bsdus te /
translated: At that time, one should abandon distraction with regard to the object of the act of grasping and should concentrate on the act of apprehending alone.

original: de ni bzod pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: de ni bzod pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: This is the stage of acquiescence.

original: de nas myur du bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob ste /
analyzed: de nas myur du bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob ste /
translated: Then, one quickly attains the uninterrupted samādhi.

original: de ni 'di'i 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di'i 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs yin no //
translated: This is the stage of the supreme worldly dharma.

original: de ltar na nang dang phyi'i dmigs pa thob pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nang dang phyi'i dmigs pa thob pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one obtains the internal and external objective supports.🔽The attainment of the reality of all the internal and external objective supports should be understood as the non-apprehension of both the object and subject.

original: phyi dang nang gi dmigs pa gnyis po thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rnyed pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa de gnyis nyid mi dmigs pa las rig par bya'o zhes pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi dmigs pa gnyis po thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rnyed pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa de gnyis nyid mi dmigs pa las rig par bya'o zhes pa ni ji skad du /
translated: As will be explained:

original: de nas de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: de nas de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes bla na med pa'o //
translated: Then, it is the supramundane, unsurpassed pristine wisdom.

original: rnam par mi rtog ye shes dri ma med //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ye shes dri ma med //
translated: The stainless, non-conceptual pristine wisdom

original: 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral ba 'thob //🔽ces 'chad par 'gyur ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral ba 'thob // ces 'chad par 'gyur ba lta bu yin no //
translated: is attained, free from the two apprehensions.

original: nang dang phyi dang phyi nang gi de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: nang dang phyi dang phyi nang gi de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa bshad zin to //
translated: The attainment of the reality of the internal, external, and both internal and external objective supports has been explained.

original: da ni chos kyi dmigs pa ji ltar rnyed pa de bzhin du skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: da ni chos kyi dmigs pa ji ltar rnyed pa de bzhin du skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: Now, the attainment of the objective support of the Dharma should be applied in the appropriate context.

original: de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni sems rnam par g-yeng bas ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni sems rnam par g-yeng bas ma yin pa ste /
translated: Here, “with a mind in equipoise” means not with a distracted mind.

original: gang gi tshe chos dag nyan pa na sems rtse gcig pas nyan pa'o //🔽sems mnyam par gzhag pa nyid ni 'dir rna gtod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos dag nyan pa na sems rtse gcig pas nyan pa'o // sems mnyam par gzhag pa nyid ni 'dir rna gtod pa yin no //
translated: Attentiveness to mental attention is the same as attentiveness to the Dharma.🔽Attentiveness to the absence of signs is the same as attentiveness to the absence of characteristics.

original: yid kyi brjod pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rtog pa @81b dag gis te /
analyzed: yid kyi brjod pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rtog pa @81b dag gis te /
translated: Attentiveness to the absence of mental activity is the same as attentiveness to non-attention.🔽Attentiveness to the absence of an intrinsic nature is the same as attentiveness to the absence of an objective support.🔽Attentiveness to the absence of an objective support is the same as attentiveness to the absence of an agent.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pas ni don nges par 'dzin par byed nus pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pas ni don nges par 'dzin par byed nus pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Attentiveness to the absence of an agent is the same as attentiveness to the absence of a doer.🔽Attentiveness to the absence of a doer is the same as attentiveness to the absence of a creator.🔽Attentiveness to the absence of a creator is the same as attentiveness to the absence of a person.🔽Attentiveness to the absence of a person is the same as attentiveness to the absence of a self.🔽Attentiveness to the absence of a self is the same as attentiveness to the absence of a sentient being.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rjes la yid kyi brjod pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dag gis mdo dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde la sogs pa'i chos kyi don ji skad bshad pa nges par 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rjes la yid kyi brjod pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dag gis mdo dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde la sogs pa'i chos kyi don ji skad bshad pa nges par 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Attentiveness to the absence of a sentient being is the same as attentiveness to the absence of a living being.🔽Attentiveness to the absence of a living being is the same as attentiveness to the absence of a nourisher.🔽Attentiveness to the absence of a nourisher is the same as attentiveness to the absence of a human being.🔽Attentiveness to the absence of a human being is the same as attentiveness to the absence of a person who is born.🔽Attentiveness to the absence of a person who is born is the same as attentiveness to the absence of a person who dies.🔽Attentiveness to the absence of a person who dies is the same as attentiveness to the absence of a person who is reborn.

original: de ltar na re zhig thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas chas kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas chas kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa yin no //
translated: Attentiveness to the absence of a person who is reborn is the same as attentiveness to the absence of a person who is liberated.🔽Attentiveness to the absence of a person who is liberated is the same as attentiveness to the absence of a person who is not liberated.🔽Attentiveness to the absence of a person who is not liberated is the same as attentiveness to the absence of a person who is defiled.🔽Attentiveness to the absence of a person who is defiled is the same as attentiveness to the absence of a person who is purified.🔽Attentiveness to the absence of a person who is purified is

original: dmigs pa gnyis rnyed pa las ji skad bshad pa ltar yid kyi brjod pa las gzhan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar mthong na'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa gnyis rnyed pa las ji skad bshad pa ltar yid kyi brjod pa las gzhan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar mthong na'o //
translated: As explained in the context of the two objects of observation, it is not other than mental expression.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te gzung ba'i don las 'dzin pa'i don tha mi dad par mthong ba'am zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te gzung ba'i don las 'dzin pa'i don tha mi dad par mthong ba'am zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is saying, “If one sees that the object of apprehension is not different from the object of apprehension.”

original: 'di skad du chos 'chad pa na sems kho na ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang yi ge'i tshogs nyid du snang gi / sems las ma gtogs pa don gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar mthong na'o zhes bya bar bshad par 'gyur te
analyzed: 'di skad du chos 'chad pa na sems kho na ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang yi ge'i tshogs nyid du snang gi / sems las ma gtogs pa don gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar mthong na'o zhes bya bar bshad par 'gyur te
translated: This is saying, “If one sees that when the Dharma is explained, mind itself appears as a collection of names, a collection of phrases, and a collection of letters, and that apart from mind there is no other object.”

original: / de ltar na bsam pa las byung ba'i shes pas chos kyi dbyings kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa yin no //
analyzed: / de ltar na bsam pa las byung ba'i shes pas chos kyi dbyings kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the object of observation of the dharmadhātu is found by the knowledge that arises from reflection.🔽The phrase “by the knowledge that arises from meditation” means that

original: sems ni ming la gnas pa'i phyir bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems ni ming la gnas pa'i phyir bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: since mind is based on names,

original: ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi'o //
analyzed: ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi'o //
translated: names are the four aggregates that are not form.

original: de la ji ltar gnas she na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar gnas she na /
translated: How is it based on them?

original: ming gi de bzhin nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ming la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: ming gi de bzhin nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ming la gnas pa yin te /
translated: It is based on name because it is based on the reality of name.

original: chos dang chos can dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang chos can dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the phenomenon and its attribute are not different.🔽Therefore, it should be understood that it is attained through the knowledge derived from meditation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mjug thogs su bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pas de rnyed par rig par bya'o zhes bshad do gnyis mi dmigs pas rnyed pa las ji skad bshad pa ltar gnyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sngar phyir nang gi dmigs pa
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mjug thogs su bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pas de rnyed par rig par bya'o zhes bshad do gnyis mi dmigs pas rnyed pa las ji skad bshad pa ltar gnyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sngar phyir nang gi dmigs pa
translated: Just as it is explained that it is attained through the non-apprehension of duality, because of the non-apprehension of duality.🔽The attainment of the reality of all internal and external objects is to be understood from the non-apprehension of those two, the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: gnyis po thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rnyed pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa de gnyis nyid mi dmigs pa las rig pa bya'o zhes gnyi ga'i dmigs pa rnyed pa lta bu bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis po thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rnyed pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa de gnyis nyid mi dmigs pa las rig pa bya'o zhes gnyi ga'i dmigs pa rnyed pa lta bu bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is like the explanation of the attainment of the object of both.

original: de ltar na bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pas chos kyi dmigs pa rnyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pas chos kyi dmigs pa rnyed par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the object of phenomena should be attained through the knowledge derived from meditation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa rnam pa gsum rnyed pa sngar bshad pa de ni chos kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa las yang dag par rten pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa kho nas nang gi dmigs @82a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa rnam pa gsum rnyed pa sngar bshad pa de ni chos kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa las yang dag par rten pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa kho nas nang gi dmigs @82a * //
translated: Therefore, the attainment of the three aspects of objective support explained previously is based on the attainment of the objective support of the teaching.

original: pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i dmigs pa rnam pa gsum rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i dmigs pa rnam pa gsum rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The attainment of the three aspects of objective support explained previously, i.e., internal objective support, etc., is due only to the attainment of the objective support of the teaching.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa ni dmigs pa rnyed pa thams cad kyi nang na gtso bo yin la gsum pa ni de la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa ni dmigs pa rnyed pa thams cad kyi nang na gtso bo yin la gsum pa ni de la brten pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the attainment of the objective support of the teaching is the most important of all the attainments of objective support, and the third is based on it.

original: dmigs pa rnyed pa'i 'og tu yid la byed pa yongs su tshol ba'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa rnyed pa'i 'og tu yid la byed pa yongs su tshol ba'i skabs yin te /
translated: After the attainment of objective support, the investigation of mental attention is appropriate.

original: de ji ltar bshad pa'i dmigs pa rnyed pa las yid la byed pa rnyed pa ni rnal 'byor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar bshad pa'i dmigs pa rnyed pa las yid la byed pa rnyed pa ni rnal 'byor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The attainment of mental attention from the attainment of the objective support as explained is called the yogi.

original: yang na yid la byed pa'i khyad par ji lta bu dag gis dmigs pa rnyed par 'gyur ba de ltar rnam par gtan la dbab pa brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na yid la byed pa'i khyad par ji lta bu dag gis dmigs pa rnyed par 'gyur ba de ltar rnam par gtan la dbab pa brtsam par bya'o //
translated: Or else, it should be undertaken in such a way that the meditative object is attained through the special attention.

original: de la rigs nges pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs su nges pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa sbyor bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rigs nges pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs su nges pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa sbyor bsam pa yin no //
translated: Therein, the certainty of spiritual lineage is that which is ascertained as the spiritual lineage of the śrāvaka, etc. This is the intention.

original: tshogs bsags pa'i bya ba byed pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: tshogs bsags pa'i bya ba byed pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: The performance of the function of accumulating the stores is during the state of understanding.

original: mi gnod rten bcas gzhan yin te //
analyzed: mi gnod rten bcas gzhan yin te //
translated: The other is the basis that is not harmful.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'i rten dang gnod pa med pa'i rten dang bcas pa ste /

analyzed: khyim na gnas pa'i rten can dang rab tu byung ba'i rten can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: ming la dmigs pa las kyang tshig la dmigs pa tha dad pa la /

analyzed: tshig la dmigs pa las kyang yi ge la dmigs pa tha dad do //

analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa la dmigs pa las kyang chos la bdag med pa la dmigs pa tha dad la /

analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa dag kyang tha dad pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the observation of the material and the immaterial are different.

analyzed: mthong ba'i rnam pa bsgom pa'i yid la byed pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs na'o //
translated: The attention of meditation on the aspects of seeing is in the state of the path of seeing.

original: shes pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa ni bsgom pa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa ni bsgom pa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The attention of meditation on the aspects of knowledge is in the state of meditation.

original: 'di ltar bsgom pa'i gnas skabs na ni shes pa dag kho na 'thob po //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgom pa'i gnas skabs na ni shes pa dag kho na 'thob po //
translated: In the state of cultivation, one obtains only knowledge.

original: yang na mthong ba'i rnam pa bsgom pa ni bzod pa'i gnas skabs na'o //🔽shes pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa @83a * //
analyzed: yang na mthong ba'i rnam pa bsgom pa ni bzod pa'i gnas skabs na'o // shes pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa @83a * //

original: ni shes pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: ni shes pa'i gnas skabs na'o //

analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis byas pa'i khyad par yod do /

analyzed: mthong ba'i rnam pa bsgom pa ni zhi gnas kyi gnas skabs na'o //

analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa ni lhag mthong gi gnas skabs na'o //

analyzed: bsal ba'i rnam pa bsgom pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The cultivation of the aspect of removal is the removal of arisen evil unwholesome dharmas.

original: ji ltar na sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes zin pa rnams spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes zin pa rnams spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one remove arisen evil unwholesome dharmas?

original: mi dge ba'i chos rgyun gyis skye ba rnams rnam par gcod par byed pa gang yin pa'am sa bon spangs pa'i sgo nas spong ba yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rgyun gyis skye ba rnams rnam par gcod par byed pa gang yin pa'am sa bon spangs pa'i sgo nas spong ba yin no //
translated: It is the cutting off of the arising of nonvirtuous dharmas through a continuous series, or it is the abandonment by the abandonment of the seeds.

original: de lta ma yin na chos skyes pa rnams ni rang gi ngang gis skad cig mar 'jig pas 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na chos skyes pa rnams ni rang gi ngang gis skad cig mar 'jig pas 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the arisen dharmas would cease by themselves through momentariness.

original: gnyen po'i rnam pa bsgom pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir gnyen po'i thob pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po'i rnam pa bsgom pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir gnyen po'i thob pa yin no //
translated: The cultivation of the aspect of the antidote is the obtainment of the antidote in order to prevent the arising of nonvirtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen.

original: gnyen po thob nas ni sa bon kun nas 'joms par byed la /🔽de kun nas bcom pas kyang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skye ste /
analyzed: gnyen po thob nas ni sa bon kun nas 'joms par byed la / de kun nas bcom pas kyang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skye ste /
translated: Having obtained the antidote, one destroys the seeds.🔽And by the destruction of those, nonvirtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen do not arise.

original: de ltar na sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, nonvirtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen do not arise.

original: chog par 'dzin pa'i gnyen po yid la byed pa bsgom pa ni gang gi tshe 'dun pa skyed par byed pa na'o zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos bsgom pa cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen por 'dun pa skyed par byed🔽pa yin no //🔽rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po ni /

analyzed: rgod pa'i gnyen po ni zhi gnas dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa yin no //

analyzed: zhum pa'i gnyen po ni lhag mthong dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa yin no //

analyzed: sems gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'o //

translated: The cultivation of the aspects of the revolution of the basis is the non-apprehension of the signs of distraction, because the mind is fixed on the signless. Thus one attains the stability of the mind.

original: sems gnas na gnas yongs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems gnas na gnas yongs su 'gyur ro //
translated: When the mind is stable, there is a revolution of the basis.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa lam gyi rang bzhin dag la bshad pa gang yang med do zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam dag ni yid la byed pa thams cad sdud par byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa lam gyi rang bzhin dag la bshad pa gang yang med do zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam dag ni yid la byed pa thams cad sdud par byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The path of serenity and transcendent insight should be understood as including all mental attentions.

original: phan yon yid la byed pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: phan yon yid la byed pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Mental attention to the benefit is twofold:

original: gnas ngan len sel ba dang zhes bya ba ni gang gi lus kyi @84a * //🔽gnas ngan len dang / sems kyi gnas ngan len sel bar byed pas te /
analyzed: gnas ngan len sel ba dang zhes bya ba ni gang gi lus kyi @84a * // gnas ngan len dang / sems kyi gnas ngan len sel bar byed pas te /
translated: eliminating the corruption of the body and eliminating the signs of false views.

original: lus kyi gnas ngan len srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi gnas ngan len srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The corruption of the body is the nonvirtuous actions of taking life, etc.

original: sems kyi gnas ngan len ni de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi gnas ngan len ni de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu spyod pa'o //
translated: The corruption of the mind is the false views that motivate those actions.

original: lta ba'i mtshan ma sel ba'o zhes bya ba ni lta ba nyid mtshan ma yin pas lta ba'i mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: lta ba'i mtshan ma sel ba'o zhes bya ba ni lta ba nyid mtshan ma yin pas lta ba'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: Eliminating the signs of false views means that false views themselves are signs.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The signs of false views are the perishable collection view, etc.

original: lta ba'i mtshan ma de yid la byed pa gang gis sel bar byed pa'i yid la byed pa de ni lta ba'i mtshan ma sel ba yin no //
analyzed: lta ba'i mtshan ma de yid la byed pa gang gis sel bar byed pa'i yid la byed pa de ni lta ba'i mtshan ma sel ba yin no //
translated: The attention that eliminates the sign of view is the attention by which one eliminates the sign of view.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul la grangs nye bar rtog pa sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i dus na ting nge 'dzin la dmigs pa'i sems kyis yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul la grangs nye bar rtog pa sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i dus na ting nge 'dzin la dmigs pa'i sems kyis yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The application that investigates the number of the domain of samādhi is the attention that is focused on samādhi at the time of application.

original: gnas pa nye bar rtogs pa sbyor ba ni gang gis na gnas pa rnam pa gnyis nye bar rtog par byed pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas pa nye bar rtogs pa sbyor ba ni gang gis na gnas pa rnam pa gnyis nye bar rtog par byed pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The application that investigates abiding is that by which one investigates the two types of abiding.

original: tshad yod par gnas pa ni yi ge rnams so zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar yi ge rnams ni /🔽aa a'a zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: tshad yod par gnas pa ni yi ge rnams so zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar yi ge rnams ni / aa a'a zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Abiding with measure refers to the letters.🔽The letters range from a ā to kṣa.

original: ksha zhes bya ba la thug pa'i bar yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad yod pas tshad yod pa yin te /
analyzed: ksha zhes bya ba la thug pa'i bar yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad yod pas tshad yod pa yin te /
translated: Since there are forty-eight letters, they have measure.

original: de ltar na yi ge rnams ni tshad yod par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yi ge rnams ni tshad yod par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus the letters abide with measure.

original: tshad med par gnas pa ni ming dang tshig dag go //
analyzed: tshad med par gnas pa ni ming dang tshig dag go //
translated: The name and the phrase are immeasurable.

original: zhes bya ba ni mdo sde 'bum pa du ma dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdo sde 'bum pa du ma dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because many hundreds of thousands of sūtras are perceived.

original: mdo sde de dang de dag la ming dang tshig dpag tu med pa dag yod do //🔽yi ge ni kun brtags par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yi ge gcig ni ming ma yin la /
analyzed: mdo sde de dang de dag la ming dang tshig dpag tu med pa dag yod do // yi ge ni kun brtags par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yi ge gcig ni ming ma yin la /
translated: In this and that sūtra, there are immeasurable names and phrases.🔽The syllable is not to be imagined.

original: ming med par yang don kun tu rtog par mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: ming med par yang don kun tu rtog par mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: One syllable is not a name, and without a name, the meaning is not imagined.

original: gang yang ka zhes bya ba ni skye dgu'i bdag por bstan to //
analyzed: gang yang ka zhes bya ba ni skye dgu'i bdag por bstan to //
translated: And also, the syllable ka is taught as Prajāpati,🔽and the syllable ko is said to be the wind.

original: ko zhes bya ba ni rlung yin par brjod do zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa de yang aa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / tsheg gis bcad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir yi ge gcig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ko zhes bya ba ni rlung yin par brjod do zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa de yang aa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / tsheg gis bcad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir yi ge gcig pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not a single syllable, because it is endowed with a vowel and is to be divided by a pause.

original: rim pa nye bar rtog pa sbyor ba pa ni gang gis ming 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis don 'dzin pa la 'jug pa nye bar rtog par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'jig rten ni dang po nyid du tha snyad du bya ba'i
analyzed: rim pa nye bar rtog pa sbyor ba pa ni gang gis ming 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis don 'dzin pa la 'jug pa nye bar rtog par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'jig rten ni dang po nyid du tha snyad du bya ba'i
translated: The application of the investigation of stages is that by which one investigates the apprehension of an object preceded by the apprehension of a name.

original: phyir don de dang de dag la lhas byin zhes bya ba dang / bum pa zhes bya ba dang / @84b ras yug ces bya ba la sogs pa de lta bur ming 'dogs so //
analyzed: phyir don de dang de dag la lhas byin zhes bya ba dang / bum pa zhes bya ba dang / @84b ras yug ces bya ba la sogs pa de lta bur ming 'dogs so //
translated: In this way, in the world, in order to designate a particular object, one first imputes a name to it, such as Devadatta, pot, cloth, and so on.

original: gang gi tshe ming 'dis ni don 'di ston to zhes ming de la brdar btags la de'i tshe rim pa 'dis ming 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi don 'dzin pa la 'jug pa nye bar rtog pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ming 'dis ni don 'di ston to zhes ming de la brdar btags la de'i tshe rim pa 'dis ming 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi don 'dzin pa la 'jug pa nye bar rtog pa /
translated: When one is familiar with the name that indicates a particular object, then one investigates the apprehension of an object preceded by the apprehension of a name.

original: des na don de dang de dag gi tha snyad la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na don de dang de dag gi tha snyad la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one becomes skilled in the conventions of particular objects.

original: rtogs pa sbyor ba pa zhes bya ba ni lnga ba yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa sbyor ba pa zhes bya ba ni lnga ba yin no //
translated: The application of understanding is the fifth.

original: de ni rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
translated: It has eleven types.

original: glo bur ba nyid rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni ming yang don la glo bur ba yin la don yang ming la glo bur ba yin te /
analyzed: glo bur ba nyid rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni ming yang don la glo bur ba yin la don yang ming la glo bur ba yin te /
translated: The realization of adventitiousness means that the name is adventitious in the object and the object is adventitious in the name.

original: ming gi sngon rol na don gyi blo med pa'i phyir ro //🔽snang ba'i rgyu mtshan rtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ming gi sngon rol na don gyi blo med pa'i phyir ro // snang ba'i rgyu mtshan rtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because there is no cognition of the object prior to the name.

original: don du snang ba'i rgyu mtshan ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'khrul pa gzung ba dang / 'dzin par snang ba dag ste /
analyzed: don du snang ba'i rgyu mtshan ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'khrul pa gzung ba dang / 'dzin par snang ba dag ste /
translated: The realization of the sign of appearance means that the sign of the appearance of the object is the mind and mental factors that are deluded as subject and object.

original: 'di ni drod dang rtse mo'i gnas skabs na rtogs so //
analyzed: 'di ni drod dang rtse mo'i gnas skabs na rtogs so //
translated: This is realized in the states of heat and summit.

original: don mi dmigs pa rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni bzod pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: don mi dmigs pa rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni bzod pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: The realization of the non-apprehension of the object is in the state of acceptance.

original: dmigs pa mi dmigs par rtogs pa ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs na ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa mi dmigs par rtogs pa ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs na ste /
translated: The realization of the non-apprehension of the object of apprehension is in the state of the supreme mundane dharmas,

original: de med pas ni de yang med ces bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pas ni de yang med ces bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when that does not exist, this also does not exist.

original: gzung ba'i don med na 'dzin pa'i sems gang gis dmigs pa de yang mi dmigs par 'gyur bas de'i 'og tu gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med na chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba'i don med na 'dzin pa'i sems gang gis dmigs pa de yang mi dmigs par 'gyur bas de'i 'og tu gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med na chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa yin no //
translated: If there is no object to be grasped, then the mind that grasps it is also not perceived. Therefore, after that, when there is neither grasped nor grasper, one realizes the dharma-dhātu.

original: bsam pa dman pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: bsam pa dman pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The realization of the inferior thought refers to those of the Śrāvaka Vehicle.

original: ji ltar rtogs pa'i chos rnam par gzhag par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta bu'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs pa'i chos rnam par gzhag par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta bu'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: The realization of the arrangement of the realized Dharma refers to the stage of right view.

original: chos rnam par gzhag pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam la yang dag par rtog pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: chos rnam par gzhag pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam la yang dag par rtog pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: The realization of the arrangement of the Dharma refers to the stage of right investigation on the path of cultivation.

original: yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba yid la byed pa gang gis yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba yid la byed pa gang gis yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub pa byed pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of excellent qualities is the mental attention by which one accomplishes the special qualities.

original: yid la byed pa rnyed pa'i 'og tu chos kyi de kho na nyid kyi don yongs su tshol ba'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: yid la byed pa rnyed pa'i 'og tu chos kyi de kho na nyid kyi don yongs su tshol ba'i skabs yin te /
translated: After attaining mental attention, the stage of seeking the meaning of reality is as follows.

original: 'di ltar sems rtse gcig pa nyid rnyed pas chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems rtse gcig pa nyid rnyed pas chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by attaining one-pointedness of mind, one realizes the reality of phenomena.

original: de kho na nyid kyi mi bslu ba dang / phyin ci ma log pa gang yin pa'o //🔽de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes thob pas dmigs pa gang yin pa de kho @85a * //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi mi bslu ba dang / phyin ci ma log pa gang yin pa'o // de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes thob pas dmigs pa gang yin pa de kho @85a * //
translated: It is the non-deceptive and non-erroneous reality.

original: na nyid yin te /
analyzed: na nyid yin te /
translated: It is the reality that is the object of transcendent wisdom, which is attained by attaining transcendent wisdom.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid spyir brtag pa yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid spyir brtag pa yin no //
translated: It is the general reality of all phenomena that are afflicted and purified.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na nyid ni gnyis dang bral ba yin la /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na nyid ni gnyis dang bral ba yin la /
translated: The reality of the imagined nature is the absence of duality.

original: gnyis su snang ba nyid ni 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis su snang ba nyid ni 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: The appearance of duality itself is error.

original: ji srid du 'di 'khrul pas dmigs pa de srid du de'i yang dag pa dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: ji srid du 'di 'khrul pas dmigs pa de srid du de'i yang dag pa dmigs pa med do //
translated: As long as there is the apprehension of that which is apprehended by error, there is no apprehension of its reality.🔽Because of the imagination of that in that.

original: des der kun rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid 'khrul pas gnyis po der kun rtog ste /
analyzed: des der kun rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid 'khrul pas gnyis po der kun rtog ste /
translated: The reality of the dependent nature is the absence of the duality that is imagined in it by error.

original: thag pa la sbrul bzhin no //
analyzed: thag pa la sbrul bzhin no //
translated: like a snake in a rope.🔽Because the Dharma-element is not different from the dharmas.

original: chos nyid dang chos tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos kyi dbyings ni spyi'i rnam par chos thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: chos nyid dang chos tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos kyi dbyings ni spyi'i rnam par chos thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because the Dharma-element is generally included in all dharmas,

original: chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings las tha dad pa ma yin no //🔽yod pa kun nas spangs te med la mngon zhen gang yin pa //
analyzed: chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings las tha dad pa ma yin no // yod pa kun nas spangs te med la mngon zhen gang yin pa //
translated: therefore all dharmas are not different from the Dharma-element.

original: 'jig rten rmongs pa'i rnam pa tshabs chen 'di go ji lta bu //
analyzed: 'jig rten rmongs pa'i rnam pa tshabs chen 'di go ji lta bu //
translated: How is this great delusion of the world to be understood,🔽which is the complete abandonment of existence and the adherence to non-existence?

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: yod pa kun nas spangs te zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings yod pa yin na 'jig rten gnyis su 'dzin pas de la rmongs nas chos kyi dbyings de spangs te gzugs la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa gzhan kho na la mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: yod pa kun nas spangs te zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings yod pa yin na 'jig rten gnyis su 'dzin pas de la rmongs nas chos kyi dbyings de spangs te gzugs la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa gzhan kho na la mngon par zhen to //
translated: the complete abandonment of existence is the abandonment of the Dharma-element, because the world, through the apprehension of duality, is deluded about it and adheres to just another non-existent existence, such as form, etc.

original: med pa ni byis pas kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: med pa ni byis pas kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ste /
translated: Non-existence is the imagined form, etc. of the childish.

original: 'jig rten ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag yod pa las yang dag pa nyid du snang ba yin no zhes de la rmongs pas 'jug cing de dag la yang dag pa nyid du mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag yod pa las yang dag pa nyid du snang ba yin no zhes de la rmongs pas 'jug cing de dag la yang dag pa nyid du mngon par zhen to //
translated: The world is engaged in this form, etc. which have existed since beginningless time, through ignorance of thatness, and it is attached to them as if they were real.🔽And:

original: yang / 'gro ba dag na de las gzhan yang cung zad yod min la //
analyzed: yang / 'gro ba dag na de las gzhan yang cung zad yod min la //
translated: There is nothing else in the world except that.

original: zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid gsum las te /🔽'gro ba na ngo bo nyid gsum las ma gtogs pa gzhan ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid gsum las te / 'gro ba na ngo bo nyid gsum las ma gtogs pa gzhan ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: This is in terms of the three natures.

original: 'gro ba ma lus pa yang de la kun tu rmongs te phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus pa yang de la kun tu rmongs te phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is nothing else in the world except the three natures, and the entire world is confused about that, attached to the misapprehension of the imaginary nature.

original: de kho na nyid sgyu ma lta bu yongs su tshol ba zhes bya ba de kho na nyid ni yang dag pa nyid ma yin pa'am yang dag pa nyid du'ang rung /
analyzed: de kho na nyid sgyu ma lta bu yongs su tshol ba zhes bya ba de kho na nyid ni yang dag pa nyid ma yin pa'am yang dag pa nyid du'ang rung /
translated: The investigation of illusionlike thatness is thatness, whether it is reality or realitylessness.

original: gang gi ngo bo nyid gang yin par phyin ci ma log pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi ngo bo nyid gang yin par phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: It is the nature of that which is unmistaken.

original: yang dag pa nyid ma yi pa la yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid du yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de yang de kho na nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid ma yi pa la yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid du yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de yang de kho na nyid yin no //
translated: That which is not reality is known as not reality. That is reality.
